loans.name: Leokadiya

texts.en: Leokadiya is married with six children and all her children go to school. She owns a four-room house where she stays with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Leokadiya takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Leokadiya owns a bar selling all types of local brew, wines and local gin in Kawempe kilokole. She works seven days a week. Leokadiya receives at least 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail. Leokadiya has been in this business for 10 years. Prior to this business, she was a poultry farmer. Her business challenges include seasonality and the rainy season .  Leokadiya has been with MCDT for seven years. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock by buying jerrycans of local brew and boxes of local gin. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to open a branch in Bwaise.

loans.use: To buy more beer and local gin

loans.name: Atakola Women's Group Of Jinja

texts.en:
It’s now a decade since 48-year-old affable and focused N. Mayimuna painstakingly began her produce-selling business in Luzinga, Jinja. She has not fared badly, either, as her business has enabled her to educate her five children to secondary school and university level.

Mayimuna has, for the most part, been selling maize, a favorite among many traders in her area of operation. Before she took root in this business, she was doing odd jobs – mostly animal husbandry and selling pancakes. It’s from selling pancakes and selling animals that she got enough capital to start her own business.

Mayimuna has got into a steady and dependable business stride now and she now makes 50,000 shillings per week. With this loan, her sense of optimism is sky high that she will be able to buy additional maize for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more maize for her shop

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en:
Lamosa is 48 and married with 8 children (ages 6 - 14).  She owns a business venture, selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Lamosa has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lamosa needs a loan of WST $3250 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Lamosa joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Lamosa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Deysi Karina

texts.es:
Deysi de 24 años, vive en el Guasmo (parte del suburbio, la mayor parte habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 8 años y el otro recién nació, ella trabajaba en el asadero de pollos de su tío pero como no tenia suficientes ingresos decidió independizarse y empezar con su propio negocio. 

Con sus ahorros ella alquilo un local y sillas para su negocio de venta de pollos asados, por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene como sustentar su hogar y darle una vida mejor a sus hijos. Trabaja desde las 16h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días, pollos enteros y asados los vende a $ 8.00, el seco de pollo (plato típico, lleva arroz y pollo con un jugo) a $ 1.50, Aguado (un caldo que lleva arroz y pollo) a $ 0.80. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas, sillas y una cocina para su negocio. En el futuro quiere poner el negocio en otro local mas grande, para tener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Deysi, 24, lives in Guasmo (a part of El Suburbio mostly inhabited by retailers), Guayaquil. She has two children; an eight-year-old and a newborn. She worked for her uncle roasting chickens but because her income was very low she decided to become independent and open her own business. She used her savings to rent a space and chairs for her roasted chicken eatery and that good decision now makes it possible for her to support her family and provide a better life for her children. She is open for business from 4pm until 10pm every day. She sells whole roasted chickens for $8.00, “seco de pollo” (a typical dish made of rice and chicken with broth) for $1.50, Aguado (a chicken and rice soup) for $0.80. She will use the requested funds to buy tables, chairs and a stove for her business. In the future, she’d like to install her business in a larger place so that she can have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tables, chairs, stove.

loans.name: Theodomil

texts.en:
Theodomil is 28 years old and is still single. He lives by selling a variety of goods including cooking oil, drinks, cosmetics products, etc. He has been in this business for about six years and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Theodomil is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through adding a large quantity of foodstuffs such as different types of flour, Irish potatoes, rice, etc. With these additional goods for sale, he hopes that he will earn more profits than previously. Those profits will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business and build his own house which he has wished for for a long time.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 44 años, vive con su hijo Davis (21), quien trabaja en construcción.Desde hace 7 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de collares, anillos, pulseras, entre otros accesorios para damas, que elabora  a base de mostacillas, y vende los modelos que produce de acuerdo a los pedidos que le realizan. A Gladys le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues además de resultarle bastante rentable, también es como un pasatiempo, donde puede reflejar toda su creatividad, pues muchos de los diseños fueron creados por ella misma. La mayor parte del día la emplea en realizar esta labor, y además  le sobra  el tiempo necesario para realizar las labores de su hogar, pues si no se da sus pausas, el trabajo suele resultarle muy cansado. En el futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio y también quiere contratar a algunas  amigas para que le ayuden a instalar un taller.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete que será  muy puntual y responsable  con el pago de sus cuotas.Tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  material (mostacillas) que necesita  para continuar elaborando mayor cantidad de joyas.
texts.en:
Gladys, 44, lives with her son Davis (21), who works in construction. For 7 years she has been making and selling necklaces, rings, bracelets, and other women's accessories that she makes out of beads. She sells her items according to orders that she has. Gladys likes her work very much, and in addition it is sufficiently profitable. It is also a hobby for her where she can express her creativity. She creates many of her designs herself. She does this work for much of the day, and she also has spare time to carry out the household tasks, because if she does not take breaks the work can be very tiring. In the future she wants to continue to improve her business and also hire some friends so that they can help her set up a workshop. This is the second loan that she has taken from MFP, and she pledges that she will be very punctual and responsible with her payments. She is planning on investing the money requested in the purchase of a large quantity of materials (beads) that she needs to continue producing a larger quantity of jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials (beads) for her business

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana, de 40 años, es una madre de familia, que vive con su esposo Venancio (50), ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con el menor de ellos, en su casa que es propia.Cada mañana, luego de atender a sus vacas, sale a cultivar papa, habas, alverjas, maíz, y verduras, ya lleva en esta actividad 25 años, junto a su esposo, quien muchas veces prefiere que ella se quede en casa preparando los alimentos. Los terrenos propios y arrendados que siembran le dejan ingresos económicos considerables que utiliza para cubrir los gastos domésticos, la educación de sus hijos y sobre todo para ahorrar dinero. De las vacas que cría esmeradamente, extrae la leche que le sirve para elaborar quesos, y luego  ofrece sus quesos en las tiendas de su localidad, y en las ferias semanales. Para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad, también piensa reinstalar la tienda de venta de comestibles que tenía en su casa.Es  la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  se siente satisfecha de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque todos son personas solidarias y responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Rosana tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios  sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus sembríos de papa, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Rosana, 40, is a mother of 3 who lives with her husband, Venancio, 60, in their own house. Only the youngest still lives with them. Each morning after taking care of the cows, she goes to the fields to farm potatoes, beans, legumes, corn and vegetables. She has been farming for 25 years together with her husband although he frequently prefers that she stay home preparing the food. The fields that they work are their own and rented ones and these yield considerable income that they use for household expenses, their children's education, and especially to save money. From the cows that she carefully cares for, she is able to extract milk that she uses to make cheese, and then sell the cheese in local stores and at weekly markets. In the future she is thinking about planting more, and also to again set up the food store that she had in her home. This is the fifth time that she has requested a loan with MFP, and she feels satisfied that she works with the members of the communal bank, because the people are all supportive and responsible with their payments. Rosana is planning on using the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer that she will spread over her potato crops, and thus she will continue prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 34 years old and is married with four children. She is well-known in the business of selling clothes and has been in this business for about five years. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Mediatrice needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With the use of this loan, Mediatrice will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition, she will be able to continue to provide food for her family and build a secure future.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Rudito

texts.en:
Rudito L. Jr. is from the village of Pelaez, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 51 years old. Rudito is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rudito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  tomatoes for sale. Rudito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rudito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudito is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rudito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a las Señora Carmen Ramona V. Gimenez que vive en la cuidad de Villarrica. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras nombrándolo Comité •• Mujeres Activas••.


 Ellas se dedican a la Artesanía elaborando prendas de vestir, manteles, camisas, etc. y muchas otras creaciones que son heredadas de sus madres, abuelas, pasando estos conocimientos de generación en generación. 


También muchas de las integrantes trabajan en pequeños comercios para la cual le fue de mucha  importancia la ayuda que les ofreció Fundación Paraguaya.


Cabe destacar que mediante el comité ellas lograron aumentar  sus ganancias
Y poder cada día mejorar aun más sus condiciones de vida.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Carmen quien se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanía en ao po´i (es una tela especial de hilos de algodón que son utilizados para fabricar las prendas de artesania), ella fabrica camisas, vestidos, manteles y otros y son muy admirados por la gente lo que hace que la venta sea muy rápido.
La señora Carmen es muy trabajadora y comenta que seguirá trabajando ya muy satisfactorio para ella ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tela ao po´i.
Es importante mencionar que algunas de las señoras fabrican prendas que se exportan en muchos países.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Carmen Ramona V. Gimenez, who lives in the city of Villarrica. They enthusiastically agreed to form a Women Entrepreneurs Committee, naming it the "Mujeres Activas" ('Active Women') committee." They work in handcrafts, making clothing, tablecloths, shirts, etc. and many other creations inherited from their mothers and grandmothers, who passed this knowledge from generation to generation. Many of the members also work in small businesses, so the help offered them by Fundación Paraguaya was very important to them. It is worth pointing out that through the committee they were able to increase their earnings and improve their living conditions even more everyday. One of the members is Carmen, who makes and sells ao po´i handicrafts (ao po´i is a special cotton fabric used for making handcrafted items). She makes shirts, dresses, tablecloths and other items, and they are much admired by other people, which makes them sell quickly. Carmen is very hardworking and says that she will continue working and is very happy to be able to help her family. She is asking for the loan to buy ao po´i cloth. It is important to mention that some of the women make items that are exported to many countries.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ao po´i fabric

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group Cristo Redentor (Christ the Redeemer) 1 & 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to maintain quality service for her clients. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being at her home resting.

Francisca has run a beauty salon business for over six years, starting with two blowers and curling irons that she bought with some savings. Francisca is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her venture by buying more beauty products, a blower and some hair brushes. She will save her profits because she wants to build her house. Living in her own house is her dream.

This associate began working with Esperanza because she needed to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, a blower and hair brushes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, es una madre de familia muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos a quienes desea brindarles la mejor educación. Su trabajo de Gladys es el servicio de maquillaje y peluquería, para ello cuenta con un salón de belleza, en donde todos los días, realiza corte, tintes, permanentes y reacondicionamiento de cabellos de sus clientes. En horas de la tarde su establecimiento es el más concurrido y más aun cuando son fechas festivas o de celebraciones. Es así que atiende hasta altas horas de la noche, realizando peinados y maquillajes, siendo esta actividad muy gratificante para ella, le gusta mucho su labor por que le es muy rentable y tranquilamente puede pagar el alquiler del local. Lleva 20 años de trabajo y en todo este tiempo ha logrado el reconocimiento de sus clientes, es por ello que para el futuro planea trasladar su local en un espacio más amplio e instalar un bazar donde pueda vender productos de belleza y bisutería. Es su doceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar puntualmente como lo venia haciendo. Se siente feliz de integrar este grupo comunal; por lo responsables que son. Con el crédito que solicita, renovará algunos accesorios de su salón de belleza y comprará una computadora, para que su hija, quien estudia en  la universidad.
texts.en:
Gladys is a kind and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her three children for whom she wants to provide the best education. Gladys has her own beauty salon where she provides makeup and styling services. There she works every day providing haircuts, coloring, perms, and hair conditioning to her customers. Her establishment is busiest in the afternoons, especially during the holiday festivities and celebrations. She provides her services to her customers until the late hours of the evening since it gives her great satisfaction. Gladys enjoys her work because it is both profitable and peaceful. In addition, it helps pay the rent for her salon. Gladys has been working for 20 years, and during this time, she has become well-known among her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business by adding more space in order to open a bazaar where she can sell beauty products and trinkets.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time like she always has. Gladys is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because everyone is responsible. The loan she is requesting will be used to replace of the accessories in her salon and to purchase a computer for her daughter who is studying at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the equipment in her salon & purchase a computer for her daughter

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
Relita P. is from the village of Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Relita is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Relita raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Relita is just starting this business.

In 2008, Relita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Relita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Relita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Relita's fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help its Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Angela Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, y está muy a gusto con el banco ya que las socias son muy unidas y le encanta las charlas educativas. Tiene 21 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene un hermoso pequeñito de 2 años de edad. Su marido trabaja en un tanquero.
 
Es comerciante, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ofrece sus productos a las personas que habitan por su sector, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana en las tardes ya que en las tardes su suegra le cuida el bebe. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una vez al mes y a veces dos veces de acuerdo a lo que venda o pedidos que tenga.

Este crédito es para realizar un viaje a Guayaquil a comprar más mercadería. Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a community made up of individuals of various occupations, such as: artisans and merchants.

Angela is the founding member of the community bank and she is very happy with the group, especially because they are a much unified group who enjoy the educational talks. She is 21 years old and she lives with her partner, and together they have a beautiful 2-year old baby. Her husband is a transport driver. 

She is a merchant, selling all types of clothing. She carries out her sales door to door in her neighborhood. She completes her sales on credit, collecting weekly payments. She works four days a week in the afternoons, when her mother-in-law takes care of the baby. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil once or twice per month depending on her sales and the orders she receives. 

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise while on another trip to Guayaquil. Her dream is to have a house of her own. She currently lives with her parents in law.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Selenge L. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger - a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent - in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a secondary school. 

Since 2008 Selenge has been operating a underwear, hat and scarf retail business from a stall at Narantuul market, the largest and most important market in the city. Her stall is located near to the main door of the market, which is a very popular and crowded area. She sells a variety of underwear, hats and scarves and her wide selection of products attracts many customers. She imports her products from China once or twice a month. After years of operating this business her earnings have enabled her to start building a house in her yard for her family. 

Selenge is a very open-minded and sociable woman and is well known by her customers. About the future she says, "I would like to start another stall from my business profits in the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import winter clothing items from Erlian, a border city of China, for her business.

loans.use: To import items of winter clothing

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia tiene 64 años de edad, reside junto a su familia a la altura del Km. 8 de la carretera a Jaén, la zona pertenece al distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola conformada principalmente por zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace cuatro años, ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno situado cerca a la zona donde vive. Allí ha instalado el cultivo de limón y se vale de los ingresos de esta actividad para ayudar a la economía de su familia. La fruta que cosecha la ofrece en venta a los acopiadores de la zona.

Eulogia desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Eulogia es una mujer luchadora y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa, las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 64 years of age and lives along with her family at kilometer 8 on the highway to Jaén. The area belongs to the district of Olmos, an agricultural region made up primarily of rural areas, belonging to the province of Lambayeque and which is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She has worked in agriculture for four years and has a small plot of land situated near the area where she lives. There she has set up a lemon orchard and makes use of the earnings from this business to help meet her family's financial needs. The fruit she harvests she sells to others in the area who will then transport it to market for sale. 

Eulogia wishes to purchase fertilizers for the maintenance of her crop. Thus she thought it wise to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1,000 nuevos soles which will help her achieve her goal. 

Eulogia is a determined woman who enjoys keeping busy. The people who know her consider her to be levelheaded and worthy of trust.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for the maintenance of her lemon crop

loans.name: Ronkosi

texts.en:
Ronkosi O. K. is 60 years old. He is married to Melissa K. and is a father of ten school-going children. Ronkosi is a businessman involved in selling young bulls to the businessmen who are willing to fatten them and sell later at a profit.  He has been in this business for the past 20 years and is doing well.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he plans to spend on purchasing more cows to increase the number of young bulls for selling. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease land for farming.
 
His future dream is that he will be a commercial businessman and a renowned one. Despite his age Ronkosi believes he is hard working and he will achieve his set target.

loans.use: To buy young bulls for reselling

loans.name: Kifunjo Development Association Group

texts.en: M. Rachael is the leader of Kifunjo Development Group. She has a drugstore business selling flu caps, antibiotics, quinine, and so on.  From this business, she is able to make 200,000 in monthly profit. In addition, she is able to make an extra 50,000 per month from farming. Rachael is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school.  She needs a loan to be able to buy drugs for her drugstore. To start up her drugstore 4 years ago, she first had training in nursing, then she turned to self-employment.

loans.use: To buy drugs for drugstore

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy C. (pictured with her husband) is 22 years old. Her husband, Mr. Sineth Chhan, is 27 years old. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2008 and have one young son. 

Channy and her husband are vegetable farmers. They grow cabbage and beans on their farmland in the village where they live. Channy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en:
They say a big family is a happy family. But it can be a big responsibility, too, especially if you are going to run that big family alone. This is the experience of Aleja F., 46, one of CCT*'s Community Partners in Manila. She is a widow with seven dependents. They used to live in Samar, Visayas few years back, but at present she and her family reside in Tondo, Manila.

Aleja's business is the buying and selling of plastic wares, through which she earns an average earning of Php11, 000 a month. She has done this kind of business for around two years by now. She conducts her daily business at home, with the help of a hired vendor.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a Php12,000 loan. She will use this fund to level up her plastic ware business, purchasing more products as she looks for more regular customers. With this, she will also have enough to pay the vendor she hires to sell her products. Indeed, this loan is one big step to help Aleja augment her family's daily needs, as it sustains her business.

Aleja says that the availability of a sales assistant is one major problem in her business. Sometimes, she finds no one available to work for her, which should not happen in any case. Nevertheless, she has big hopes that this problem will be met with a solution. Aleja hopes to save up and own a commercial space for her business. And the biggest dream of all, to see all of her children finish their schooling, because her family, big as it is, is all her heart could contain.
	

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic wares for sale

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. José Antonio F. A. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa de Enacal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Lector de Medidor de Agua tiene  nueve   años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para hacer una mejora en su casa de habitación y cancelar una deuda, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. José Antonio F. A. is an active employee of the Enacal Company in San Rafael del Sur where he has worked as a water meter reader for nine years. He is married and currently has a child who is of school age. José Antonio has received seven loans from CEPRODEL and each was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other items in order to expand and improve his home. This loan he is requesting will be used to make an improvement to his home and pay off a debt.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have helped him improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies & repayment of a debt

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Anna Liza A., a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Zaldy A., a construction worker, and is mother to their four children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Anna Liza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to members of the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns a living by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and other members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Anna Liza hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en: Darisuren is 54 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the province of Tuv in Mongolia. All of her children got married, and she lives with her husband in a rented house. She began a cosmetic retail business in 2008. Currently she also operates a beauty salon, which she started in 2010, in addition to her cosmetics sales business. Her business has expanded slightly, and she is training six people who will have stable jobs in her beauty salon after graduation. She wants to enlarge her beauty salon and expand her cosmetics sales business. Darisuren is a hardworking and modest person. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase cosmetics and necessary tools for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and necessary tools

loans.name: Vatan

texts.en:
Vatan A. is 40 years old and a married man. He has three dependent sons who are between 11 and 15 years old. Vatan and his family live in a small settlement built for refugee families, in Bilasuvar district. He fled to Bilasuvar in the beginning of the 1990s. 

Vatan earns his living by operating a business buying and selling sheep. His wife helps him in his business activities. Being in this business for many years, Vatan knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. 

He is planning to expand his herd and purchase more sheep. For this reason he requested a loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. This is his first loan in the amount of 1000 AZN. He bought seven sheep. The income from this loan helps pay for his children's education and feed his family.

loans.use: to buy seven sheep.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin M., 37 years old, is married and lives in the Dongkor district of Phnom Penh City. Yin M. sells groceries from her home. She has had experience in this business for many years and earns approximately $8.33 per day. To share in family responsibilities, her husband built a small workshop where he provides a vehicle washing service. This couple has been married for years and they have three school-aged children. In order to increase her income, Yin M. wishes to expand her grocery business by asking for a loan from Kiva. She will use the funds to purchase a larger amount of essential grocery items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of essential grocery items to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro A. T. es una mujer de 50 años, que vive en el sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde posee un hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 16 a 22 años. Este es el ambiente donde Maria A. se desempeña en la  venta de productos de misceláneas al detalle; actualmente aprovechando que esta es una gran época para vender   detalles dirigidos a la mujer, a propósito del día de las madres que se avecina, ella ha solicitado su credikiva, con el cual comprará muñecos en peluche, ropa, electrodomésticos menores, que exhibirá en su miscelánea decorada,   con estos detalles bien empacados, con el propósito de despertar  la atención el interés, deseo  y la acción de compra de sus clientes, e incrementar sus ventas. Maria inició su negocio hace menos de un año con útiles escolares aplicando a esta compra el capital suministrado por su hijo, quien tuvo como objetivo el  incremento de  los ingresos del hogar;  inicialmente funcionó en un local arrendado y Maria lo ha hecho crecer con su gran vocación de servicio,  que traslada a sus clientes a quienes con ello gana día a día. Su sueño más adelante es ampliar su negocio y ubicar nuevos puntos de ventas, por lo cual debe esperar porque aún no cuenta con el suficiente capital de trabajo, ni la infraestructura para hacerlo, pero si con todo el empeño,  para que a mediano plazo su sueño se convierta en una realidad.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro A. T. is 50 years old and lives in the south of the city of Barranquilla together with her husband and her three children who are aged between 16 and 22.  Here Maria A. sells a variety of products retail.  She is currently taking advantage of the fact that this is a great time of year for selling gifts for women as Mothers' Day is approaching.  She has requested a Kiva loan to buy stuffed dolls, clothes and small electrical appliances which she will display in her store.  With these nicely packaged gifts, she intends to attract her customers' attention and awaken their interest in buying and their desire to buy.  This will mean they will buy her products and she will increase her sales.

Maria started her business less than one year ago, selling school supplies.  She made this purchase with capital provided by her son whose goal was to increase their household income.  Initially, Maria worked in rented premises.  She has grown her business through the great service which she provides to her customers which means she earns every day.  Maria's dream for the future is to expand her business and set up new sales locations.  She will have to wait to do this as she has neither enough working capital nor the infrastructure to do it right now.  However, she will strive to make her dream become a reality in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: to buy stuffed dolls, clothes and small electrical appliances to display in her store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old and married with 6 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like oil, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming and tricycle transport.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Neron

texts.en:
Neron is from the village of Sardab, Digkilaan, Iligan City. He is 31 years old. Neron is married with four school-aged children. He provides motorcycle or habal-habal transport to local community members. Neron has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Neron joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Neron has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide his transportation services. Neron is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the tools needed to maintain the equipment. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools to maintain his transportation vehicles.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 54 and married with three adult children. She is a farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya where she has been farming for over 20 years. Her mixed farm produces carrots, potatoes, maize, and milk which are all sold locally. Farming is her main source of income. Margaret has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her improve her family's livelihood and be independent. She would like to acquire three quality dairy cows in the next 5 years. Her biggest challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and diseases which affect her production.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es: El señor Rudy es albañil constructor y su esposa se dedica a labores agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de calaminas, vigas y puertas, esto para la construcción de una habitación en su casa para tener mayor comodidad. Vive en casa propia en la comunidad de Achacachi a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rudy works as a bricklayer in construction, his wife is a farmer.  He needs the loan to buy plywood, beams and doors to add a room onto his house in order to be more comfortable.  

He lives in his own house in Achacachi, two hours from the city of La Paz.  He’s married and has a son.  This is his first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Clarivel

texts.es: Clarivel vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades D. 9, 19 y 22 años D. edad  y tiene un negocio mediante el cual prepara deliciosos desayunos, almuerzos y jugos que venD. entre sus clientes en un punto comercial ubicado en su barrio Costa Hermosa. Allí también aprovecha su clienteL. para ofrecerle otros productos como verduras, frutas, negocio en el cual  es apoyada por un empleado.  A Clarivel siempre le ha gustado ser una mujer independiente y tener un negocio le ofrece esa satisfacción, desD. hace 25 años. Su microempresa D. alimentos,  está ubicada en una vía principal del barrio y allí L. ayuda su hija en L. preparación D. los menúes,  generando ingresos con los que apoya L. gestión D. su hogar. Clarivel tiene muchos sueños entre los cuales está ver a sus hijos prósperos y educados profesionalmente, ellos son el motor que L. inspiran  para que cada día su fortaleza aumente.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprará verduras y frutas  en mayor volumen para distribuirlas entre sus clientes que son principalmente tenderos, también comprará un enfriador, y una estufa para lograr conservar adecuadamente las carnes y los refrescos y una estufa para aumentar su potencial  D. venta D. almuerzos, con lo cual augura una inversión exitosa por el conocimiento que tien del mercado y por L. experiencia en el manejo D. este tipo D. negocios.
texts.en:
Clarivel lives with her spouse and their three children aged 9, 19 and 22. She has a business in which she prepares delicious breakfasts, lunches and juices for her customers at a commercial location in her neighborhood of Costa Hermosa. She also has an employee that helps her with the sale of other products like fruits and vegetables. 

Clarivel has always enjoyed being an independent woman, and for the past 25 years have a business has given her that satisfaction. Her small food service business is located on one of the neighborhood's main streets. In her business her daughter helps her prepare the meals, generating an income that supports the household. Clarivel has many dreams, one of which is to see her children become prosperous and professionally educated. They are the inspirational force that makes her stronger every day. 

Her credikiva [Kiva loan] is the first financing she has gotten through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With these funds she will purchase large amounts of fruits and vegetables, which will then be distributed among her customers who are primarily shopkeepers. She will also buy a cooler to be able to adequately refrigerate meat and drinks, and a stove to increase her potential for lunch sales. She believes this will be a successful investment given her knowledge of the market and her experience in this kind of business.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, a stove and products like rice, cooking oil, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 1  est un regroupement  de 10 femmes mariées du village de KIGNELE dans la sous préfecture de SELINGUE, région de SIKASSO (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 30  ans,  4 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide et du gombo.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  deuxième  prêt  de campagne.
MINATA, debout en rouge au milieu,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU,SELINGUE et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30.000 à 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 1  is a group of ten married women from the village of Kignele in Selingue sub-prefecture, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and are on average 30 years old with four children. They grow groundnuts and okra. 
In order to make their farms more profitable, the group's members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, and are on their second agricultural loan. 
Minata, who is standing in the middle, plans on using her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of groundnut seeds, light equipment and agricultural inputs from the great market in Selefougou. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while to gain value before being sold in Selefougou's great market, in Selingue and in neighboring markets. They are retailed for cash to customers who generally come from big cities.
After selling their crops, members of the group expect to each make a profit of 30,000 to 50,000 CFA, which will be used to pay back the loan's interests and for the daily expenses of their families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (such as fertilizers and seeds) and light equipment.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a 23 year old Rwandan entrepreneur. Her husband works as a tailor and she has 2 children, 1 and 4 years old. Her elder son is in school. 

For the past 8 years, Claudine has been running a shop where she sells clothes, shoes, and kerosene. The profits from her successful business have allowed her to buy a piece of land.

She will use this loan to purchase more goods to sell in her store so that she can continue to make profits. She hopes to earn enough profits so that she can begin construction on her family house.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale such as clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Dek

texts.en:
Fishing is the most important part of 36-year-old Deck’s daily work. She and her husband have been living on a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought.

Dek and her husband also support their four children who are enrolled in school. 

Dek is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan from Kiva to repair her old house. And in the future, Dek hopes that all of her children study at as high a level as they can.

She took the photo at Hattha Kaksekar Ltd.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia del Carmen D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su esposo Víctor, dos hijas y un hijo. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora.  Se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. belleza para dama tales como: ganchos para el cabello, diademas, colas, etc. Su venta la realiza D. manera ambulante en los principales lugares D. la zona como el mercado municipal y las tiendas cercanas a su hogar D. residencia. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que ella siempre trata D. tener variedad en su mercadería y sobre todo precios accesibles. Además gracias a su carisma y amabilidad las personas la prefieren ya que ella siempre realiza su trabajo con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad D. artículos D. belleza para dama D. tal manera que le permitan estar un paso delante D. la competencia. Los principales artículos en los cuales piensa invertir su crédito son: variedad D. ganchos para el cabello, variedad D. colas, diademas, aretes y otros productos que resulten llamativos para los clientes y que se encuentren en el mundo D. la moda. Espera tener éxito en esta decisión y lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
42-year-old Cecilia del Carmen lives in her family home together with her husband Víctor, two daughters and one son.  She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who sells ladies' beauty accessories such as hairpins, hairbands, hair clips, etc.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor in the main places in her area such as the town market and the stores near her home.  She has many customers as she always tries to have a variety of merchandise available at affordable prices.  Thanks to her charisma and kindness, people prefer to buy from her.  She always carries out her work with a lot of enthusiasm and commitment.

Cecilia has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy a range of ladies' beauty accessories and take a step ahead of the competition.  The main items in which she is planning to invest her loan are: a range of hairpins, clips, bands, earrings and other products that are attractive to her customers and are to be found in the world of fashion.  She hopes that this decision will be successful and that she will achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy a variety of hairpins, hair clips, hairbands, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru:
Мухаммаджон честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей скота и корма. Он начал свой бизнес 10 лет назад и успешно продолжает. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальной прибыли. Мухаммаджон с удовольствием занимается и любит свой бизнес. Он хочет получить максимум прибыли для содержания своей семьи и обучение своих детей. Он хотел бы получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.  Мухаммаджон заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их доброты и милосердие.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Muhammadjon is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock and livestock feed.  He started his business ten years ago and successfully continues it now.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  Muhammadjon runs his business with satisfaction and loves it.  He wants to make a maximum profit to support his family and educate his children.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.  Muhammadjon is grateful in advance to all creditors for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Dios Es Bueno 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Clarita is one of the members in the group called Dios Es Bueno 4 & 5 (God is Great). She makes her home here in a simple structure with four children and her long-term partner. She plans to continue enjoying church and being at home with her family. 

Clarita is excited to be taking her second  loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for one and a half years, starting out with some savings she had accumulated. She decided to began a loan with Esperanza International and the group because she was needing capital for her business. Before the loan she was looking for a way to find money and invest in her business, but she could not find it. 

Clarita plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing snacks, candies, cookies, etc. She is running a candy stall, in front of her house and she used to carry it to the local school and sell to the kids. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She would like to have an improved business and to travel to different countries.

Her group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, surrounded by sugar cane fields, where many Haitians have emigrated to work in the sugar cane industry. This group is composed of Haitians and Dominican members. This city economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry.

loans.use: to buy snacks and sweets to resell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 29 years old, married, and has a 9-month-old child.  He rents a house in Hioma, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for 3 years, and he faces a challenge of price fluctuations, which affect his business profits. He needs this loan to buy sugar, soap and matchboxes to sell. He hopes to expand his business into a wholesale shop in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and matchboxes to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, convive con su pareja y es madre de un niño de seis años, por quien trabaja día a día para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en el distrito de Neshuya. EL trabajo de flor consiste en la siembra y cosecha del árbol de la palma, el cual es materia prima para la elaboración del aceite que es un principal insumo de la cocina. Ella tiene una chacra propia en donde realiza esta actividad por ya tres años aproximadamente, además que cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja. Pero cuando es temporada de cosecha, necesariamente debe contratar peones, quienes se encargaran de hacer la recolección de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tienen tiempo para estar a lado de su hijo que aún es pequeño y necesita del cuidado de ambos. Le esta yendo muy bien en esta actividad, pues sus productos son vendidos a una fabrica de elaboración de aceite recibiendo buena paga por ello. Solo espera continuar y mas adelante cultivar cacao. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que espera una vez más su apoyo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará sacos de abono, asimismo contratará peones para que le ayuden en la fertilización de sus tierras y éste lista para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Flor, 28, is a very cheerful, enterprising woman.  She lives with her spouse and is the mother of a six-month-old little boy that she works hard to provide a better quality of life for.  They all live together in their own house in Neshuya District.  

Flor’s work consists in planting palm trees which are the raw material for making palm oil that’s a main cooking ingredient.  She has her own field where she’s been doing this activity for about three years; her spouse helps her.  However, during harvest season she needs to hire day workers who will do the harvesting.  

What she likes most about her work is that they have time to spend with their son who is still little and needs care from both of them.  She’s doing well in this activity because her products are sold to a factory that makes the oil and she is paid well for them.  She hopes to stay in business and to plant cocoa beans in the future.

This will be her sixth MFP loan and she’s hoping for your support once more.  She will use the requested amount to buy sacks of manure and will hire day workers to help her fertilize the soil so that it will be ready for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Sadbaroi

texts.ru: Садбарой замужем, имеет двоих детей. На протяжении 11 лет занимается продажей разных промышленных товаров. У нее свой магазин. Доходы идут на содержание семьи. Любая женщина хочет улучшения благосостояния в семьи и старается внести свой вклад в это дело. Займ она хочет получить для увеличения объема и расширения ассортимента товаров в магазине к Новому году и празднику Иди Курбон. Она надеется в поддержке и получении займа.
texts.en: Sadbaroi is married and has two children.  She has been involved in selling various household products for 11 years.  She has her own store.  The earnings go toward supporting the family.  Any woman wants to improve the well-being of her family and tries to contribute to this process.  Sadbaroi wants to obtain this loan to increase the volume and to expand the assortment of merchandise in her store for the New Year's and Idi Kurbon holiday.  She hopes to get the support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to increase volume and expand goods assortment for the holidays

loans.name: Buston

texts.ru: Бутон талантливая и умная женщина. Она замужем и у них четверо детей. Её муж занимается услугами перевозки людей на местном городе. Бустон занимается шитьём женских национальных платьев и вышивки. Она также делает реставрации юбки, брюки и пальто. Данный бизнес начала в 2002 году с собственными денежными средствами. Она работала на рынке «Рохи - Абрешим» имела ателье. Бустон хотела бы получить займ в размере 1000$  США для покупки тканей и фурнитуры, для шитья женских национальных платьев для продажи.
texts.en: Buston is a talented and smart woman.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband provides a service of transporting people in the local town.  Buston is involved in sewing women's national dresses and embroidery.  She also provides alteration services for skirts, pants and coats.  She started this business in 2002 with her own monetary funds.  Buston worked at the "Rohi-Abreshim" market and had a boutique there.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of fabrics and accessories in order to make women's national dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and accessories

loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en:
Sadaina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sisters. Sadaina has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sadaina sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Sadaina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap.

The main business challenges for Sadaina include seasonality, thieves, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build rental rooms. Sadaina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Digna Rosario

texts.es:
Digna es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que le gusta salir adelante, ella vive con sus dos hijos en Pimampiro que se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura en el Norte de Ecuador. Digna trabaja en la crianza y venta de pollos, se dedica a esta actividad gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre aprendió desde que era muy pequeña, pero ahora ve la necesidad de incrementar el negocio porque tiene que mantener a sus dos hijos y es su único ingreso económico.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de pollos y balanceado para la alimentación de los mismos. Esta inversión le ayudará a Digna a obtener mejores ingresos gracias a las ventas ya que los pollos con buena alimentación crecerán grandes y gordos.

Los sueños que tiene es poder darles el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Digna is a very hardworking person who puts forth a lot of effort and likes to get ahead.  She lives with her two children in Pimampiro, located 45 minutes from Ibarra, in the Imbabura province, in the north part of Ecuador.

Digna raises and sells chickens and does this thanks to her mother having taught her when she was very young.  Now she sees the need to grow her business because she has to support her two children and this is her only source of income.

This will be her second loan through Fodemi and she will invest the money into chickens and balanced feed.  This investment will help her increase her income thanks to better fed and fatter chickens.

Her dream is to provide for her children’s education and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Twifatanye /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Christine  fait partie du groupe TWIFATANYE /Rbv. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée avec 4 enfants de 4 à 11 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Elle a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Christine est cultivatrice des maïs. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, des engrais chimiques location de champs et paiement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture des maïs. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Christine voudrait être une grande cultivatrice des produits agricole dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Christine is part of the Twifatanye / Rbv group. She is 30-years old and is married with four children from 4 to 11 years old; three of them are in school. She is responsible for a person other than her children. She has six years of primary school education.

Christine is a corn farmer. This is her second loan with ACB. She will use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pay for farmland rental and labor for her corn farming.
 
Her strategy for the growth of her business is to modernize her farming. In the coming years, Christine would like to be a great farmer of regional crops. With her profits, she plans to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pay for farmland rental and labor for her corn farming.

loans.name: Lucio Escobar

texts.es:
Lucio, vive con con su esposa y su hija de 20 años. su trabajo es de aserrador  de madera, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y por muchos años él ha continuado con esta labor, su horario que tiene son flexibles.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar taladro y madera para aserrar y luego venderla a mejor precio y de esa forma poder darle lo necesario a su familia.
El objetivo de lucio es crecer su negocio  aumentar en clientes de esa forma darles un buen estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucio lives with his wife and 20-year-old daughter.  He saws lumber.  He learned this occupation from his father and for many years he’s continued with this work.  His work schedule is flexible.

He needs the loan to buy a drill and lumber to saw and then sell at a better price thus providing his family with what they need.  Lucio’s objective is to grow in business increasing the number of customers to provide a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a drill and lumber to saw.

loans.name: E-Koue Group

texts.fr: Le groupe E-KOUE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ayoko Sèna, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Ayoko Sèna est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Cyprien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ayoko Sèna a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Ayoko Sèna vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs et de la sauce) à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses différentes charges. Ayoko Sèna achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Ayoko Sèna désire obtenir un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe E-KOUE .
texts.en:
The E-KOUE group is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, called Ayoko Sèna, has her hand raised in the photograph. This is the first time that this group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé, with the objective of scaling up their business. Ayoko Sèna is 33 years old and married to someone called Cyprien. The couple have four children living at home, some of whom attend school. Ayoko Sèna stopped school at the secondary level.
For twenty five years, Ayoko Sèna has sold food (rice, cornmeal and sauce) from her home. Ayoko Sèna buys her products in a market in Benin. In the hope of increasing her stock of products and better meeting her customers' needs, Ayoko Sèna is seeking a first loan with ALIDé, together with the other members of the E-KOUE group.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, corn and condiments for sauce.

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
Federita is from Punta, Panaon Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Federita is married. 

To make a living, Federita sells balut (boiled, fertilized eggs) in the local community. Federita has been in her business for three years and earns 1,500 PHP a month for these activities. Federita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2011, Federita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is married and has one child. She runs a salon in Likoni, Kenya, and has had this business for three years. She began the business from her own savings.
Everline is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase weaves and hair shampoos. Despite the high cost of stock and some customers not paying on time, Everline intends to open more salons in the future. She intends to save the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase weaves and hair shampoos.

loans.name: Maria Luceny

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades económicas. Fue así como hace unos 7 años montó una cafetería para atender a los clientes del sector y así poder tener unos ingresos con los que pudiera contribuir en su hogar. Gracias a que sus ventas se han incrementado en los últimos tiempos, Maria busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de cafetería para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.

De esta manera estima que sus ventas se incrementen y así pueda tener mejores ingresos para mejorar la condición económica en su familia. Su sueño es sacar sus hijos adelante y que en su hogar puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar productos de cafetería para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.

loans.name: Gneleniton V Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe GNELENITON V sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MASSIYA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "GNELENITON V" are married women averaging 45 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kolombada, a village in Commune de Guegneka, in Dioïla Prefecture. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of further carrying out their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are millet and peanuts. They are on their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this new loan, MASSIYA, who is the second person standing from the left in the photo, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. 

MASSIYA plans on making an average profit of about 120,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. Her primary income sources are milk,eggs, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Rearing poultry for eggs and meat'. Her biggest challenge is 'Price fluctuations, unpredictable markets for agricultural products.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Jeniffer was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Chose Juhudi Kilimo since the products are tailor made to suit farmers needs.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How Juhudi works to boost farmers income.'

Her highest monthly expense is business related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Jeniffer replied 'Will boost the poultry project.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jeniffer owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, sewing machine, TV' but does not have 'solar power, running water, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Even though Adwowa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Adwowa is an entrepreneur. She runs a chop bar (food stand) in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. Adwowa is married and has three children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adwowa wants to use her loan to purchase more ingredients which would improve her overall sales. In the long term, Adwowa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients which would improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Mariam qui se trouve sur la photo, juste devant dans la chaise, est membre d’un groupe de 6 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mamissa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mariam, âgée de 48 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 10 à 30 ans, dont 7 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Mariam à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Elle a mentionné que, "son père fut un ancien combattant et un cultivateur." Mariam cultive l'arachide, le mais, le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et autre. Mariam entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la conviction des agents de terrain myAgro.  Cette année Mariam effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Mariam cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Mariam planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d’élargir sa surface cultivée. Enfin Mariam espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is the woman seated on a chair in the front row, in the photo.  She is a member of a group of six farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Mamissa, located south-east of Bamako, Mali. Mariam is 48 years old and the mother of seven children whose ages range between 10 and 30. All her children currently attend school.

The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, an activity which constitutes the main source of income and provides food self-sufficiency for the family. For this reason, Mariam decided to become a farmer 20 years ago.  She says that "her father used to be a war veteran and a farmer".  Mariam grows groundnut, maize and sorghum on her plot of land. As a farmer, however, she faces challenges such as the lack of rain, etc. Mariam is starting her first year with myAgro. She became convinced that she should join after talking to myAgro field representatives. This year, she will be making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (open-pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnut in order to increase her yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot of land.

Mariam has been growing groundnut for 20 years now for its commercial value (since she sells her crop at the market), and its profitability.  With her expected increased yield and income, she is planning to increase the size of her arable land. She also hopes to be able to ensure food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: to buy a package of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnut and to benefit from myAgro's technical farming training.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Noemi requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.
