Noemi has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Noemi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
In the city of Villa de Garcia, Nuevo Leon lives Maria Isabel with her two children and her husband. She sells hamburgers from her home and has been doing so ever since she moved to there. She started her business not only to earn extra income but also this allowed her to take care of her kids herself, that are still very young. A company employs her husband but his salary is not enough to cover the mortgage payments on their home among other expenses. Since Maria Isabel started selling hamburgers they have been better able to cover their expenses.

Her devotion to her husband and the love for her family has permitted Maria Isabel to struggle day after day, putting her family first and helping her husband. She now needs a loan of $250 to purchase ingredients and utensils that she uses to make her product. Show your generosity. You have the ability to help her. Do not doubt it any longer. The decision is in your hands. They will thankful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la comunidad de Villa de García, Nuevo León, vive Maria Isabel con sus dos hijos y su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en su propio domicilio desde que llegó a la colonia donde vive, comenzó con esta actividad porque además de generarle ingresos extras, al mismo tiempo le permitía cuidar ella misma a sus hijos, quienes son muy pequeñitos aún. Su esposo es empleado de una empresa y con su sueldo no completaban para hacer los pagos de la casa que están pagando aún y los otros gastos, desde que María Isabel comenzó con la venta de hamburguesas pueden cubrir mejor sus gastos.

El compromiso con su esposo y el amor a su familia ha hecho que María Isabel luche día a día para sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar a su marido. Ella necesita ahora de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar insumos e utensilios que utiliza para producir su producto. Muestra tu generosidad, tu tienes la posibilidad de ayudarla, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en tus manos, ellos te lo vana agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hellen would like to buy beads in bulk

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.en:
Wilmer is a butcher and owns a small stand where he sells beef. His father taught him the family trade over 35 years ago. Wilmer then helped his father at his shop. Wilmer eventually started his own business but about 8 years ago his store caught on fire. He has not been able to buy a new shop. Therefore, Wilmer has been selling meat from a table and stand that he made himself.

Wilmer is second time borrower with Mifex and Kiva. He used his first loan to buy more meat and improve his home. He was able to fix a room in his house to rent out to a close friend. This enabled him to generate a second source of income.

With his second loan, he hopes to buy different kinds of meat, including poultry and fish. He wants to increase his revenue so he can save money for a new store. His goal is to increase his profits and buy a new refrigerator for leftover meat.

loans.use: to purchase different types of meats

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita sells dairy products from her home (cheese, cream, yogurt, and milk). She is married, 64 years old, and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. With her share of the loan, she wants to buy a refrigerator to preserve her products for a longer time. She belongs to the group "Jastic 5", together with Mrs. Lucinda Hernández López (sales of tacos from her home), who, with her part of the loan, wants to set up a space and buy kitchen utensils for improved production of her food products.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

BENITA se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos en su domicilio (queso, crema, yogurt, leche), ella es casada, tiene 64 años, tuvo cinco hijos, su esposo es agricultor, con la parte de su préstamo quiere comprar un refrigerador para conservar sus productos por mas tiempo. Pertenece al grupo Jastic 5 junto con doña Lucinda Hernández López (venta de tacos en su casa) con la parte de su préstamo acondicionara el lugar y comprara utensilios de cocina para la mejor elaboración de sus alimentos.

loans.use: Dairy sales

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sumariani

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Sumariani lives in Warnasari, a village in Western Bali. Her hut is very simple, walls from woven bamboo, and floor of raw sand. Ni Nengah Sumariani lives with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a tenant farmer. Economic condition in her area is quite harsh. For basic needs each day Rp25,000 (about US$3) is needed. Ni Nengah Sumariani works on 2 jobs to help her husband to fulfill family needs. From 6:00AM-12:00PM Ni Nengah Sumariani sells vegetables house to house around her neighborhood. However the profit is not sufficient to support her living expenses, since each day she only profit Rp15,000 (about US$1.80). So she added her pig farming business. Today Ni Nengah Sumariani raise 1 mother pig. 1 Mother pig could bore 6-12 piglets. After 4 months each could be sold for Rp900,000 (about $99). So maximium income for 4 months are Rp10,800,000 (about $120) minus feed cost of Rp 7,200,000 (about $80) from 12 piglets at Rp600,000 ($6.60) makes Rp3,600,000 (about ($40). So per month is about Rp 900,000 (about $100) or Rp30,000 ($3.30)/day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Sumariani tinggal di desa Warnasari, sebuah desa yang ada di Bali barat. Dengan kondisi rumah yang sangat sederhana, dinding terbuat dari gedek dan lantai tanah, Ni Nengah Sumariani tinggal bersama suami dan 3 orang anaknya. Suaminya berprofesi sebagai seorang Petani. Kondisi perekonomian dilingkungannya cukup sulit, karena untuk kebutuhan pokok sehari – hari diperlukan biaya sebesar Rp. 25.000.- Ni Nengah Sumariani menjalani dua profesi untuk membantu suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Pagi hari mulai pukul 06.00 sampai pukul 12.00 siang, Ni Nengah Sumariani berprofesi sebagi dagang Sayuran Keliling. Ni Nengah Sumariani menjajakan dagangannya disekitar lingkungannya. Namun, keuntungan yang didapatnya tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidupnya, karena per hari hanya mendapat keuntungan Rp. 15.000.-. Hal itu ditutupinya dengan membuka usaha tambahan, yakni usaha ternak babi. Saat ini Ni Nengah Sumariani memelihara 1 ekor induk. Satu ekor induk bisa mempunyai anak 6 – 12 ekor. Setelah di pelihara selama 4 bulan, per ekor bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 900.000. Jadi total pendapatan selama 4 bulan pemeliharaan adalah Rp. 10.800.000.- dikurangi biaya pakan Rp. 7.200.000.- ( 12 ekor @ Rp. 600.000.- ) adalah Rp. 3.600.000.-. Jadi keuntungan per bulan adalah Rp. 900.000.- atau Rp. 30.000.- per hari

loans.use:
To buy mother pig & animal feed to increase pig population

Membeli induk babi dan pakan untuk menambah populasi peliharaannya

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Mrs. Taiwo B. is 32 years old, married with 3 children and lives in Mushin, Lagos State.  She sells cosmetics in her community.  She has been in business since the year 2000 and she is now requesting a loan of $400 to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sayit

texts.id:
Sayit T. pays his six employees 25,000 rupiah per day to help him make fried cassava chips. He is currently making as much as 400,000 Rupiah per day and uses 2,000,000 Rupiah to buy cassavas. Because it is difficult to obtain cassava, he plans to also offer fried taro chips to his customers. To purchase the taro chips, he needs to borrow 1,500,000 Rupiah. Sayit T. has a wife and one child. Their living expenses are 25,000 Rupiah per day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Modal senilai Rp 2.000.000,00 digunakan Sayit untuk membeli singkong mentah. Dengan 6 orang tenaga kerja yang dibayar Rp 25.000,00/hari dia membuat kripik singkong. Keuntungan per hari yang dia peroleh sebesar Rp 400.000,00. Dia memiliki rencana menambah barang dagangan, yaitu kripik talas, karena susahnya untuk mendapat bahan baku singkong. Sayit memerlukan dana Rp 1.500.000,00 untuk membeli kripik talas. Tanggungannya saat ini adalah seorang isteri dan seorang anak dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 25.000,00.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing for the beach

loans.name: Luos

texts.en:
Mrs. Luos N., 37, works growing rice and vegetables and sells them at a nearby market. She can generally make about $6 each day, while her husband can make on average around $5 a day in revenue from his fishery work.

Luos Naran has five children, including the one who will be born in the next three months. Two of her children are currently employed by a garment factory and the rest of her children are too young to attend school. Because she is pregnant and is not able to work on her rice field, her husband has to take care of her and does all the work himself.

Recently, this couple has requested a loan to purchase some farming supplies including fertilizer, seeds, pesticide, and gasoline to improve their production. This couple plans to save a lot of money to give their children better lives.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Reyna O. is a 40 year-old woman, mother, and agriculturalist. She is a farming woman, who labors diligently with the land and in the sun. She lives in San Ignacio, and is happily married to a farmer like herself, who supports the family as well by working at a solid job at a factory. Together, they have six children, three of whom work and the three youngest got to school and help their mother at home. She has cultivated two apple orchards for more than 20 years, and this agriculture business is her passion. While taking care of her crops, she sells fruit that she grows and harvests. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase agricultural items for her crops and guarantee that it is a success.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer

Mujer, Madre y Agricultora es La señora Reyna O., de 40 años de edad, es una mujer de campo, forjada en el trabajo de tierra y sol, habita en San Ignacio, dice ser felizmente casadas con un hombre de campo como ella que para apoyar en el negocio familiar y tener una entrada fija trabaja en una empresa como operario. Ambos tienen 6 hijos 3 de ellos trabajan los 3 últimos aun estudian y ayudan a su madre en los oficios de la casa. Tiene cultivada 2 manzanas de Piña y Pitaya desde hace mas de 20 años este negocio agrícola es su pasión, mientras se desarrolla el cultivo vende frutas que ella misma cultiva y cosecha. Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para su cosecha y garantizar esta se realice con éxito.

loans.use: Purchase Agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand a tie-dye business

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi A. is 33 years old, married, and the father of two children (his daughter, Renée, is in the photo with Kossi). In order to earn money to meet the needs of his two children, he is a tailor in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this first loan from FECECAV, he would like to strengthen his business by purchasing new fabric, buttons, and other sewing materials. With the profits he’ll make from selling clothing, Kossi hopes to also purchase another sewing machine to expand his business. He appreciates the opportunity that this loan will provide to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Kossi A. est âgé de 33 ans marié et père de 2 enfants (sa fille, Renée, est dans la photo avec Kossi.) Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses 2 enfants, il fait la couture à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il veut renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat des nouveaux tissus, boutons et plaintes. Par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses vêtements, Kossi aussi espère acheter un autre machine à coudre pour agrandir son entreprise. Il apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie et la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Building his business by purchasing new equipment

loans.name: Fuente De Esperanza (Source Of Hope) Group 3

texts.en:
Samena, the group leader, has two children, ages 5 and 1 and a half. She has a small business selling clothes out in the country where people don´t have easy access to many products. She buys the clothes near her home and her husband, who works in the country, takes them with him to sell for a profit. Samena would use this loan from Esperanza International to buy even more clothes to sell, which will help her better provide for her family.

Samena currently lives with her family in a small hut constructed from scraps of tin and wood. She is originally from Haiti, where conditions are even worse. She hopes that she will be able to provide a good education for her children through the money she makes from her business.

Note: This is a group loan to 5 people.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to re-sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 60 year old mother of three living children. She also supports three orphans. She lives in the Nyalenda slums of Kisumu, Kenya. Rose, who is a trained community health worker, has been in second hand clothing business for many years. She has received three microfinance loans from KMET/KIVA partnership and has repaid them all. She currently requests US$800 to buy more second hand clothes in bulk.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is forty-five-year-old Flora from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has four children between the ages of seven and twenty-six. Flora owns a beauty salon which she runs with the assistance of two employees. Flora's salon generates approximately US$ 110 in profits each month.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

This is Flora’s second loan with SELFINA. She successfully paid back her initial loan of US$ 225, which has allowed her to request a larger amount this time. Flora is requesting a loan of US$ 625 to purchase necessary items such as hair products, wigs, and cosmetics for her salon.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora O., a 45-year-old a widow with three children, is a very dedicated owner and operator of a grocery shop selling such items as rice, evaporated milk, canned foods, drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, and candies in Obuasi, where she lives. Dora supports her family with proceeds from her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bulk supplies of grocery goods in order to expand her business. Dora O. hopes to thereby save more towards her children’s education. She belongs to the group called 'Jesus loves you Trust Group', whose members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To purchase more canned foods, drinks, milk, assorted spices, washing soaps, etc. for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Faragnogokan (Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Spécialisées dans l’achat et la vente de friperie, de savons, de sucre, de bois de chauffe,  de vêtements pour enfants etc, les cinq (5) femmes du groupe Faragnogokan de l’association  Laïdou ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants et  vivent dans le quartier Mancourani I de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Après deux prêts solidaires remboursés sans difficulté, ce groupe est à son troisième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 balles de friperie, 10 cartons de savon, 4 sacs de sucre,1 chargement de bois de chauffe et 200 vêtements pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionneront auprès de grossistes du marché de la ville de Sikasso et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale du Mali) pour la friperie,  le savon, les vêtements pour enfants et le sucre. Quant au bois de chauffe, elles se ravitailleront auprès des paysans producteurs dans les villages environnants de Skasso. Les ventes se font au marché de Sikasso et dans les foires des villages. C’est au retour de ces différentes foires, qu’elles achèteront des sacs de charbon de bois qui seront vendus aux marché de Sikasso et dans leurs domiciles respectives à une clientèle contituée des femmes et des hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 40.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement à aider les conjoints à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Specialized in buying and selling second-hand clothing, soaps, sugar, firewood, and clothing for children, the five women of the group Faragnogokan of the association Laïdou average 31 years of age and four children. They live in the Mancourani I district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having repaid without difficulty two solidarity loans, this group is on its third loan, which will used to buy: 2 bales of second-hand clothing, 10 boxes of soap, 4 sacks of sugar, 1 load of firewood, and 200 pieces of children's clothing. The group members get their supplies from Sikasso wholesalers and sometimes in Bamako (capital of Mali) for the second-hand clothing, the soap, the children's clothing, and the sugar. As for the firewood, they will be resupplied from peasant producers in villages surrounding Sikasso.

Sales are made at the Sikasso marketplace and in village fairs. On the way back from these village fairs is when they will buy sacks of charcoal that will be sold at the Sikasso marketplace and out of their respective homes to customers composed of women and men.

They each envision realizing an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA per month that will be used essentially to assist their husbands provide for their families.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods (second-hand clothing, soap, sugar, children's clothing, firewood

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina C. D. E. vive en casa propia, en la zona D. Pasankeri, con sus dos hijos pues su esposo ha fallecido.
Paulina trabaja como obrera en una microempresa que realiza el trabajo D. alcantarillado en la ciudad D. La Paz, también realiza el trabajo D. lavandería para familias particulares. Paulina quiere construir dos habitaciones en su terreno, ya que las habitaciones que tiene resultan pequeñas para la familia.
El crédito será para la construcción D. dos habitaciones nuevas en obra gruesa.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y pueD. acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Paulina C. D. E. lives with her two children in the house she owns in the Pasankeri area of La Paz. Her husband has died. Paulina works for a small sanitation business in the city of La Paz and also takes in laundry from private households. Pauline wants to build two rooms on her property as the existing space in her house is too small for her family. The loan money will be for the rough construction of two new rooms. This is the second time Pauline is asking for a loan and is able to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two rooms

loans.name: Abdul Wasea

texts.en:
Abdul Wasea is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives in Qala-e Adsey, and he has a general store in which he sells different kinds of materials. He needs more inventory for his business to make it more successful. 

Now he requests an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans for the term of 18 months. He wants to make his shop large and complete his necessary materials to maintain his business and support his family. 

He is very happy for this loan process in Afghanistan, especially the AFSG (Kiva's Field Partner) and Kiva. He would like to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To make his shop larger and complete the stock for his store

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina D. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Faustina sells shoes and fabric, as well as fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at the Elmina new market, which she has done since 2000.

Faustina uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Faustina will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to add to her husband's savings to acquire a piece of land to build their family house.

loans.use: Faustina will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for five years, B. Otabek was born in 1978 in Shahrituz district. He is married and responsible for four people, including his wife and three children. Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his herd and repair his enclosure so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from more than 20 km from his village. With this goal in mind, Otabek is requesting a loan that will serve as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable--conditions that have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy cattle and repair the enclosure

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
la sra, Reina C. tiene 30 años de dad, es vecina de la colonia Fraternidad y esta casada, tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos esta en el colegio y la otra en la escuela, su esposo trabaja en la albañileria y se ayudan economicamente para sacar adelante su hogar.
se decica al negoci ohace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes, es muy esforzada y dinamica.
para la venta de tortillas necesita comprar maiz, leña, cal, agua.
es por tal razon que necesita el credito ya que desea comprar maiz para almacenarlo porque en los meses siguientes se pone mas caro.
su mayor anelo es crecer y estudiar y a sus dos hijos hacerlos profesionales para que en el futuro puedan tener mejor oportunidad en esta vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina C. is 30 years old and lives in the Fraternidad neighborhood. She is married and has two children. Her son is in high school and her daughter is in also in school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and they help economically to keep the home going.

She has been working in the business for 6 years and has many clients. She is forceful and dynamic. To sell tortillas, she needs to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water. For this reason she needs a loan. She also wants to buy corn to store because in the upcoming months it will become more expensive.

Her greatest wish is to grow and study and that her two children will become professionals so that in the future they will have more opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood, salt, lime, and cornmeal

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Эрсалиев Абдусаттор житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Уже 27 лет работает в сфере животноводства. Занимается купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает около 40 дней , а затем продает на тех же рынках. Кроме этого занимается сельским хозяйством. Но получаемый урожай использует для собственного потребления. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить еще одного бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение шести месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdusattor E. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is married and has eight children. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for 27 years. He buys and sells cattle. He buys young calves, feeds them for about 40 days and then resells on the same markets. Besides that he is also in agriculture, but he keeps the produced harvest for himself. He plans to get a loan to buy one more calf. He can pay off the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Ma. Edna

texts.en:
Ma. Edna is 46 years old. She is working hard managing her store so that she can support the college education of her only child. Her family is living in the rural village of Andarayan Solana, Cagayan. She is hoping that through her perseverance, they will be able to attain a progressive way of living.

Edna has manged a general store for more than five years in their village. She wakes up very early in the morning to open her store. For the fulfillment of her business plans, she would like to take on a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She has gained a lot of customers and a better profit through her good customer relationships and by providing for their needs.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Managing a small piggery in their backyard is the source of income of Marilyn. Aside from that, her husband is engaged also in running a small store that adds to their earnings. Marilyn is married to Roger S. and they are blessed with four children. The couple lives together with their children in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela.

Marilyn and her husband are working hand in hand just to give their best to provide the needs of their children. Marilyn wants to have good living conditions and a successful business. She also wishes to send her children to school and be able to finish college courses someday.

With all this in mind, Marilyn is asking for financial assistance from the lenders to be able to improve her business and to earn more profit. She wishes to access a loan amounting to Php 15,000 to be able to buy additional piglets to raise and more feed to increase the weight of the pigs to make them sell at a higher price. She also wants to improve the pig pens for her pigs to provide them with more comfort. The loan will be a big help to make all her dreams come true and to give them more profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Bashiran Sadiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is the wife of S. M. who has resided in a city named Kasur, Pakistan for the past eleven years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and for its shrines.

Bashiran baji couldn’t get an education because of her parents’ small financial resources, but she decided to give her children (two sons and one daughter) a good education. Currently they are all in school and getting an education. Her husband runs a leather-selling business. He sells leather to the factories. He has been in this business for the past five years.

Bashiran baji operates a business sewing clothes and, from the income, she pays off the school fees of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy leather so that her husband is able to complete the orders of his customers.

She is the group leader of seven other women from her locality:

Rukhsana baji, Razia baji, Shazia bano baji, Noreen J. baji, Razia baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

loans.use: To buy leather for her husband's business

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia is a proud wife, mother, and retail clothing seller in Miami. Her business targets female products, which include pants, shirts, underwear, cosmetics, and beauty supplies. Ligia is aware of the financial benefits of repeat customers, and therefore focuses her marketing strategy on obtaining long term clients. This is why her numerous clients look for her even when she’s not around to place new orders. Some of her clients are from her prior business, where she prepared food. Ligia has two children and a husband that works as a plumber.

Lidia took the first step in building her credit in 2004 by starting her business with her first ACCION USA loan of $500. She has invested more than $2,000 in her business with the help of four loans from ACCION USA. Ligia currently needs a loan of $1,000 to purchase new clothing inventory- styles that keep her clients happy and in style.

She is a proud woman that goes out everyday to find her customers rather than wait for her husband to sustain her, she says. Her immediate goal is to make the transition from a traveling salesperson to a local store owner. She is a skilled salesperson who has a great attitude towards her customers – a combination that continues to bring fortune to both her and her family.

loans.use: Clothing inventory

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
La señora Camila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Viene ejerciendo muchos años; su negocio de venta de jugos, junto con su pareja que también la apoya y se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad, en un puesto muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes. Es muy conocida y querida por sus clientes, ya que sus jugos son únicos y tienen un buen sabor. 
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, lo invertirá comprando frutas como: papayas, manzanas, maracuyás, bananas, naranjas, todos que los compra por cientos, en verduras compra sus veterragas y otros, para dar un sabor mas rico, a sus jugos. De esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando utensilios de cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos. 

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Camila belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro, "Time Is Money", community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, one of whom still lives at home.

She's been working many years. She operates a business, along with her husband, selling fruit juices. The business is located in the city's Central Market, in a stand that has been well fitted out so that she can serve her customers there. She is well known and loved by her customers because her fruit juices are unique and taste so good.

She will use the S/.1,500 [1,500 soles] loan to buy fruits such as papayas, apples, passion fruits, bananas, oranges, all in bulk, along with vegetables such as "veterragas" [not sure--a kind of pepper, perhaps?] that will add flavor to her juices and provide the product that her customers want. Another part of the loan will be used to buy kitchen utensils so that she can replace the old ones.

Camila is happy with her business even though the work is hard and she has to get up early to do it. She believes that it's worth the sacrifice to fulfill her life's dreams and goals. She's also grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her and other women that want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for fruit drink business.

loans.name: Gollen Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes qui voulons nous activer dans le commerce du bois de menuiserie en ouvrant un magasin de vente en détail du bois déja transformer pour l'utilisation des menuisiers de notre écovillage d'une part et aussi l'ouverture d'une boutique de produits féminis que nous comptons exploiter en même temps. Ce choix est dû au fait que les menuisier vont toujours chercher leur matières premières à Ziguinchor qui est distant de 45 kilomètres, alors que notre écovillage ne dispose pas d'activité dans ce sens. C'est pour cela que nous avons chertché à faire autres choses que ce qui se fait d'habitude. La demande en bois de menuiserie est très forte et souvant les artisans ne répondent pas à la demande par manque de matériaux et c'est cela que nous voulons combler. De l'autre coté nous allons installer une boutique de vente d'effets vestimentaires féminins, qui est aussi très demandé.
texts.en:
We are a group of young women who want to be active in the lumber business by opening a retail store for wood which has already been processed and is ready for carpenters to use in our eco-village.  In addition, we would open a shop of women's items that we intend to operate at the same time.  This choice is due to the fact that furniture makers always go to find their raw materials in Ziguinchor, which is 45 km away, while our eco-village lacks this kind of business.  This is why we sought to do something different that what is usually done.  The demand for lumber is very high, and artisans do not often meet it due to a lack of supplies.  And this is what we want to fill.  Elsewhere, we are going to establish a shop for women's clothing and accessories, which are also in high demand.   

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and some wood for carpentry

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean S., 31 years old, has been a rice farmer since she was a child in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She says that, "Sometimes there is failure in business, so what a farmer should do is to apply fertilizers and new methods to increase the yield."

Having three children at home is difficult, especially since they have different demands. Jean is now asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals.

CEVI provides credit assistance to her to sustain her farm. She also has access to training and insurance coverage by joining CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Ilemi B Group

texts.en:
Upendois a member of the Ilemi B borrower group in Mwanjelwa,Mbeya,she is  years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 16,11,4 years.

Upendo started her own clothing business selling clothes 7 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Upendo`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy Fabric clothes(kanga,vitenge)

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Upendo hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Annia is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge,kanga

loans.name: Kendy Xavier

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, el señor Kendy P. se dedica a su actividad agrícola por medio de la siembra de frijoles y de maíz siendo este el centro de su trabajo en la tierra el cual al venir la cosecha muy esforzadamente la levanta y luego comercializa el producto.

Acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra como es la compra de crea, insecticidas, entre otros y por ello espera que el crédito sea otorgado para continuar en su actividad.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica in state of León, Mr. Kendy P. is dedicated to agriculture planting beans and corn. This is the focus of his crops, which during harvest he builds up with great effort and then, sells the yield.

He went to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy supplies to the crop, as well as to buy insecticides and other products. He hopes he will receive the loan so that he can continue with his activity.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Apply into beans and corn crops

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos H. is 39 years old and a widow. She has four children who all go to school. Amos has a retail business in a shop made of iron sheets, and she is requesting a loan to build a concrete shop. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a concrete shop

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier V. , tiene la edad de 43 años , habita en el barrio , San Ignacio , ubicado en La concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante , ellos tienen tres hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle mejores condiciones de vida  y poder establecer una pequeña pulpería para que su esposa trabaje desde el hogar ; a la vez estar velando por la educación de los pequeños , don Francisco desde hace veinte años , se dedica a la agricultura ya que con su propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno , agradece a la institución por apoyarlo durante nueve desembolsos ya que durante este tiempo a logrado establecer diversos cultivos . Con este último financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios y poder fumigar para quitar toda plaga y poder tener una buena cosecha.

loans.use: Comprar veneno y insumos para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es una madre de familia de 32 años. Vive feliz con su esposo José Luis que tiene 38 años de edad y con sus 3 hijos: Mayte de 11, Keiko de 5 y Matías de 3 años.
Hace dos años tuvo la idea de empezar un negocio rentable, donde ella misma sería su jefe. Es así como se inició en la preparación y venta de queques, los cuales vendía a sus hijos y amistades. Al poco tiempo el negocio creció y empezó a preparar tortas y otros bocaditos, comenzó a tener pedidos para matrimonios, fiestas de promoción, bautizos y cuanto evento realizaban sus vecinos y conocidos. 
A ella le agrada mucho elaborar estos deliciosos postres, ya que en cada uno de ellos vierte mucho cariño y dedicación, aunque muchas veces no puede darse abasto para elaborar todos los pedidos que le realizan, pero esto significa que sus postres son muy solicitados es por ello que siente muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder brindarle a su familia un futuro mejor. 

Es su séptimo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos, al igual que todos los miembros de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayores cantidades de ingredientes para sus postres, los cuales adquirirá al por mayor, pues de esta forma son más económicos.
texts.en:
Georgina is a 32 year old housewife. She lives with her husband, José Luis, who is 38 years of age and with her three children: Mayte, 11; Keiko, 5; and Matías, age 3.

Two years ago, she had the idea of beginning a profitable business in which she would be her own boss. As a result, she began preparing and selling cakes, which she used to sell to relatives and friends. After a short time, the business grew and she began to prepare pies and snacks. She began to receive orders for weddings, promotion celebrations, baptisms, and events organized by neighbors and acquaintances.

It is very satisfying to her to make these delicious desserts since she pours affection and dedication into each one. Although often she can’t fill the orders that are given to her, this shows that her desserts are quite sought after. This is why she feels able to get ahead and offer her family a better future.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual in making all her payments, just like all the members of her group. With the money she is applying for she will buy greater quantities of ingredients for her desserts. She will acquire these ingredients at wholesale since this is more economical.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making desserts

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, aged 3 and 10. Both her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with four people. Flavia takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and they get three meals a day. She incurs additional transportation expenses to and from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall selling passion fruits in Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone. She sells both at retail and wholesale. Flavia works seven days a week. She has an average of 20 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing price of passion fruits. Flavia’s monthly rent for home and work place is about 40,000 UGX. She has been in this business for over nine years and with MCDT for two years, servicing her fourth loan working with the same group-mates. Flavia joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving loans to poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of passion fruits. She is aspires to see her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of passion fruits

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna es una mujer muy serena de 39 años, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, siendo la suya, la tienda más concurrida de la parte baja del pueblo. Cada día, antes de abrir su negocio limpia y ordena sus mostradores, con este dinamismo pudo captar su clientela y acumular las ganancias que le han permitido ir surtiendo su tienda con abarrotes, verduras, herramientas del campo como machetes y hachas. Pero lo que no tiene son medicamentos de primeros auxilios, y muchos de sus vecinos cuando están enfermos acuden hasta la ciudad por enfermedades sin mayor complicación. Por ello, Digna está muy motivada en vender medicamentos, pero quiere capacitarse acerca de ellos para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que para este préstamo le va permitir progresar. Con el dinero que solicita comprar esos medicamentos básicos necesarios, así como un estante adecuado para ellos.
texts.en:
Digna is a calm, 39-year-old, married mother of two children. The family lives in their own house. For the past 6 years she has sold basic food items and her store is the busiest in the lower part of town. Every day, before opening up for business, she cleans and arranges her counters. This dynamism helped her capture customers and accumulate profits that have allowed her to stock her store with groceries, vegetables, field tools like machetes and axes. But what she does not have available is first-aid medicines and many of her neighbors must go into the city when they are suffering some minor ailment. This is why Digna is motivated to stock basic medicines but she wants to be trained in their proper use first so that she can provide good service to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because this loan will allow her to progress. With the funds she plans to buy the necessary basic medicines and a proper display case for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Dwelling Place Group

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

She trades in infant layette and adult clothes. Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called Dwelling Place. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Joyce, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sangita B. is a resident of Bhakepati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Nabin B. is a tailor. Her son is just a year old.

Mrs. B. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting for Rs 20000.00 to increase the necessary stock of food for her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She will also use the loan to expand her shop. She wishes to use her income to provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: to buy supplies of grocery goods for resale

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeurn M. and her husband, Mr. Chon Sout, are farmers who own a 1 hectare field and cultivate rice to support their family. She is 50 years old and has three children who are all students in the local school. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Oeurn M. wants to start another business raising pigs. Since she does not have enough money, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pigs and pig feed for the new business.

This is a group loan for four people located in Prey Chhoeteal village in Takeo province. The four members will use their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Oeurn M. is the group leader.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to make her business larger

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Antonio Laínez G., labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene dos  hijos a su cargo y uno de ellos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado once créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los once créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y mano de obra para el techo de su casa.
Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Noel dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Noel Antonio Laínez G. works as a dental hygienist in Managua's Mercado Oriental. He is married and has two children, one of whom is school age. He has had 11 loans with CEPRODEL in the past eight years and has invested his loans in making improvements to his home thanks to the loans given to him by CEPRODEL -- he is an excellent client. This loan is needed to invest in the purchase of building materials like zinc and labor for his home's roof. All of this is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children. Noel told us that the loans are to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and amplification

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
el sr. Fidel C. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la colonia Bella Orizonte en la ciudad de Choluteca. esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, su esposa se queda todos los dias en su casa para el cuidado de sus hijos y para estar pendiente de sus estudios ya que todos estan estudiando.
Fidel se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para vender sus frutas, en estos momentos el necesita mas capital para comprar sandias y naranjas ya que las ventas estan buenas.
Fidel se transporta a otro lugar para comprar las frutas, cuando las frutas se le terminan rapido esto hace que tenga mas gastos porque tiene que estar viajando mas a dicho lugar, por eso es que quiere comprar mas y asi tener para varios dias sin tener que estarse movilizando para comprarlas. esto le ahorraria mucho dinero para el.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel C. is 46 years old, and lives in the Bella Horizonte Colony in Choluteca. He is married and has 4 children. His wife stays at home to take care of the children and oversee their studies, for they are all students. Fidel gets up every day at 4 in the morning to sell his fruit. Right now, he needs funds to buy watermelon and oranges, since sales are good. Fidel travels elsewhere to buy the fruit, and when he runs out quickly, he incurs additional expense, because he has to travel even more. For this reason, he wishes to buy more and have stock for several days, without having to travel to buy fruit. This would save him a lot of money. He needs his earnings to cover his family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit:  watermelon and oranges

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Cándida Rosa Venegas, es trabajadora de Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza, vive en la Roberto González, es soltera no tiene hijos.
La señora Cándida Rosa solicito el crédito para comprar medicina de su mama ya que es una señora de edad y padece de la presión.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa Venegas is a cleaning woman employed by Chinandega's City Hall; she lives in the Roberto González neighborhood, is single and has no children. She requests funds to buy medicine for her mother, who is a senior citizen with high blood pressure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Alikakay Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Alikakay' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. These are a group of small-scale-entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group in order to buy more goods to add to their business inventory. In this way, they can attract many more customers, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group is Fatu K.. The 46-year-old was born in Magburaka town; she is married to a shepherd and they have 4 children. Fatu sells market food and also rears and sells cattle. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy market food like rice, onions, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. to add to her business inventory.  

(Also in the picture is loan officer Abdul Karim, on the right.)

loans.use: Buy rice, onions, Maggi cubes, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Dayana Maria

texts.es: LA SRA. DAYANA ES SOLTERA, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO TIENE 3 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN LA VENTA DE LOS COSMETICOS A PESAR DE SER TAN JOVEN, ES ALGUIEN BASTANTE RESPONSABLE QUIEN ADEMAS LUEGO DE INDEPENDISARSE DE SUS PADRES TUVO QUE EMPEZAR A GANAR SU PROPIO DINERO PARA PODER ESTUDIAR FUE DIFICIL PARA ELLA REALIZAR LAS DOS ACTIVIDADES EN TIEMPO Y DINERO PERO SUPO SALIR ADELANTE Y AHORA LE VA MUY BIEN, UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES EL DE SALIR PROFESIONAL Y DEDICARSE A SU PROFESION, ELLA ACTUALMENTE NECESITA EL DINERO PARA PODER SACAR PRODUCTOS DE PROMOCION EN EL CATALOGO Y DE ESA MANERA PROVEERSE DE MAYOR MERCADERIA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Señora Dayana is single and makes a living selling cosmetics from a catalog. She has three years of experience in the sale of cosmetics despite being so young. She is a very responsible person who, in addition to becoming independent from her parents, had to start earning her own money to study. It was hard for her to do both, financially and time-wise, but she figured out how to get ahead and now everything is going well for her. One of her desires is to dedicate herself to her profession. Right now, she needs money to be able to get promotional products from the catalog and in this way sell more merchandise. She is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting her with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es: Haydee tiene 42 años, pues su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio ya que se inicio desde hace 4 años, fue con ingresos ahorrados de ella que inicio esta actividad, ella tiene 1 hija a su cargo. Ella posee muchos clientes los cuales son de la zona, por lo que les brinda además de buen servicio buenos precios, por este motivo es que los clientes regresan a su negocio. Sus sueños de Ella son incrementar su negocio y tener una pulpería como una fuente de ingreso fija. Este financiamiento será para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisetas, faldas y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Haydee is 42 years old and engages in selling general merchandise. She is experienced in this business which she started four years ago with her savings. Haydee has a daughter from whom she is responsible. She has many customers who are from the area and provides them good service and good prices so that they keep returning to her business.

Haydee dreams of expanding her business and opening a grocery store as a steady source of income. This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as trousers, shirts, skirts, and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, and cosmetics

loans.name: Women Of Substance Group

texts.en:
Korpo O. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Of Substance. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children, 9, 12 and 15, and also cares for three siblings. She is a college graduate. For 7 years, Korpo has been selling charcoal at the Paynesville Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells good charcoal which keeps customers returning but faces transportation problems. She started selling with funds she got from her parents. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 61,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal. Her goal is to grow her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She describes herself as a quiet but determined business woman.

In the photo, Korpo is holding the sign and Kormassa is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo B. is from the village of District 1. He is 47 years old, separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,100 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Ablaye G. vit dans la localité de Bambilor ou il exerce l’activité  de couture depuis plus  de 30 ans déjà. Il est âgé  de 41 ans et a sa charge une femme. Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mars 2010. Il est surtout spécialisé  dans la confection de prêts à porter, taille basse et robes de femmes. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par passion car depuis le bas âge il a commence à coudre. Grace à son activité  il parvient à se prendre en charge. Monsieur G. sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de tissus et accessoires dans le but de confectionner des prêts  a porter prévus  pour la vente. Ce crédit  pourra contribuer a l’accroissement de ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Ablaye G. lives in Bambilor where he has been in the tailoring business for more than 30 years. He is 41 years old and supports one wife. He has been a member of the Bambilor branch of the U-IMCEC since March 2010. He specializes in making ready-to-wear "taille basse" (a popular West African dress) and other women's dresses. He chose this business because he loves sewing, which he began at a young age. Thanks to his work, he manages to support himself. Mr. G. is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs, which will be used to buy material and accessories in order to make ready-to-wear clothing to sell. This loan could help increase his profits.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize, oil, cheese, meat and carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Sani Bahini

texts.en:
Sani Bahini T., 46, is married and has two children, 24 and 22 years old. In 1990, she established her farming business, and by working six days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and repaid two loans from Patan BPW, having used her most recent one to purchase additional farming materials. In the future, Sani Bahini plans to supply vegetable produce to local store. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: Farming materials

loans.name: Aziz Mai's Group

texts.en:
Aziz mai lives in a city called Multan (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She does not know how to read or write but she is excellent in her embroidery art. She runs a boutique in her home. 

She has a big family and lives in a medium-sized home. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters. None of them could get their education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is eighteen years old, and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her younger son also works in a factory for a low income. Aziz’s husband is a driver. He works full-time to put three meals a day on the table for his family. 

Aziz and her family lead a very simple life. Their expenses are very low, but they want to improve their standard of living. Aziz has applied for a loan from Asasah for the improvement of her boutique business. With the loan amount, she will buy clothes and embroidery material for making more quality products for selling through her boutique. She is a new loan user and hopes that it will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery material for boutique business

loans.name: Vy´a Renda Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó gracias al deseo de las señoras de formar un grupo para trabajar en forma conjunta y al mismo tiempo tratar de mejorar las actividades que cada una realiza para ayudar a su familia.

 Así como muchas mujeres de Villarrica las mayoría de las señoras de este comité se dedican a la Artesanía realizando bordados en tela ao po´i confeccionando numerosos artículos que más tarde llevan a la venta. 
Estos trabajos lo realizan en forma paralela a  otras actividades cotidianas en sus hogares.
La señora Emilce quien es presidenta del comité es una señora muy trabajadora que también trabaja con artesanías de ao po´i.
Ella fabrica prendas de vestir para hombre y para damas y los vende a muchos negocios de Villarrica y también recibe pedidos de negocios de Asunción.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas de ao po’i.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the desire of the women to form a group to work together and at the same time try to improve the activities each performs to help her family. Like many of the women of Villarica, most of the members of this committee are craftswomen making ao po’i (typical Paraguayan embroidery); they make numerous articles for subsequent sale. These activities are performed alongside their daily household chores. Emilce is the committee president; she is a very hard working woman who also makes ao po’i crafts. She makes clothing items for both men and women that she sells to many stores in Villarica. She also gets orders from stores in Asunción. She is requesting funds to buy ao po’i fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ao po´i (Paraguayan embroidery) fabrics.

loans.name: Erick Josue

texts.es: Erick de 33 años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Anielka Rios con quien tiene una niña de 2 añitos de nombre Yaresly. Erick trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 5 años, desempeñandose como tecnico catastral. Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de reparar una pared de su cocina que se encuentra en mal estado y asi brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa con las mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Erick is 33 years old and he lives with his girlfriend, Miss Anielka Rios. Together they have a little girl, 2 years old, named Yaresly. Erick has worked in the municipal city hall in Juigalpa for the past 5 years. He is a survey technician. He requests a first time loan to repair a wall in his kitchen, to improve his family's quality of life. His dream it to have a home that is in a better state of repair for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a wall in his house.

loans.name: Monica Katiuska

texts.es:
Mónica de 30 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su propia papelería ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que mantener. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende papelería, cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc. Ella quiere con el préstamo comprar papelería y artículos de papelería etc. 

En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio, poderlo expandir. También terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mónica is 30 years old and has a stationery store in the front part of her house. She lives in a periurban area, called La Perimetral, that is surrounded by the salt marsh of Guayaquil.

With effort, little by little, she has been able to have her own stationery store since she is a single mother with two children to support. She works from 7am to 10pm and sells stationery, notebooks, pens, laminated sheets, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy stationery and other supplies for the store.

In the future she wants to continue with her business and be able to expand it. She also wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pens, notebooks, paints

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon I. runs a general store selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Sto. Domingo, Echague, Isabela. Corazon has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase inventory and for working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Ram Kumari

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Ram Kumari K..  She is married and has 3 children aged 18,13 and 11.  In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family.   In the future, Ram Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice K. is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim, bread and fish by the side of the road and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim and beans to sell. Joice is 30 years old and is married, with a husband who is a soldier. She has one child, who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of simsim and beans to sell.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE ARENA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth; ella tiene 41 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de accesorios de maquinarias pesadas como (tractor),conjuntamente con su esposo ambos se dedican a este negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas accesorios para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Grain of Sand village bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district of Cusco, Peru.

Lisbeth is 41 years old, married with one child.  She works buying and selling accessories for heavy machinery like tractors; she works with her husband in this line of work.

She is seeking a loan to buy more accessories for her business.

She is grateful to those who will provide her this loan and help her; she promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase accessories for her business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 34 years old. He is married to Juliana who is 28 years and a tailor. They are blessed with one child, 6 years old. Michael is a shoe seller and he has been in this business for 12 years with a monthly income of 12,000 KES. His wife assists him in meeting their family’s expenses and he is happy about that.

Friends introduced Michael to KADET LTD. This is his first loan. He plans to use 4,000 KES in expansion of his shoes business to another town. He will use 11,000 KES to stock his current business with things like shoe soles, brushes, polish, and gum.

In the future, Michael would like to own a big wholesale shop for shoes.

loans.use: Part of it will go to expansion of current business stock, while the rest will be invested in a new business

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a forty-three-year-old married woman with six children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salt pan (salt deposit, such a salt lake, from which salt can be extracted, processed and sold) and crude salt business for fifteen years. She started with two bags and now owns one hundred fifty bags with a stock valued at three million Uganda shillings. Her hardship is rain and her vision is to educate her children. Scovia needs the loan to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.use: Buying bags of crude salt

loans.name: Risa Ole

texts.en: Risa, 22 years of age, has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep and goats to rear and later sell at a profit.  In the future, Risa hopes to practice zero-grazing, which is easier to manage.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 46 years old, is a married woman from the town of Banga. She is engaged in farming. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest. Violeta works hard to support her family financially.

Violeta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jessenia Mariela

texts.es:
Jessenia tiene 35 años D. edad  es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos. ElL.  viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO  más D. 5 años. Jessenia  tiene un kiosco D. venta D. golosinas, gaseosas y comida, se dedica a esta labor desD. hace 10 años. ElL. inició esta actividad gracias a su hermana quién le dejó su pequeño kiosco, emprendió esta labor con L. idea D. obtener ganancias para ayudar con los gastos D. L. casa y D. sus hijos a su esposo. ElL. solicitó el préstamo para comprar mercadería (golosinas, gaseosas, panes, confitería) para su pequeño negocio y algunos ingredientes para L. comida que venD. como: arroz azúcar y aceite, al por mayor ya que esto le permite ahorrar un poco. Jessenia  sueña con tener un restaurante o una 
Tienda comercial en L. zona por dónD. vive.
texts.en:
Jessenia, 35, has a live-in partner and four children.  She has been collaborating with EDAPROSPO for over five years.  Jessenia has a small sales kiosk where she sells snacks, soft drinks and food.  She’s been in this business for 10 years.

She started the business thanks to her sister who gave her her small kiosk.  She started the work hoping to earn profits to help her husband meet her household and her children’s expenses.

She requested the loan to buy merchandise (snacks, soft drinks, bread, sweets) for her small business as well as some ingredients for the food she sells like: rice, sugar and oil, at wholesale because this allows for some savings.

Jessenia dreams with owning a restaurant or a commercial store in the area where she lives.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: sweets, soft drinks, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Ameen's Group

texts.en:
Ameen is one member of this group loan from Kiva partner Asasah. 

She is a caring and supportive lady. In order to help financially support her family, she does stitching works. She learned this art before her marriage and now is taking full advantage from it. She receives orders from different boutiques and ready-made clothes shops and completes the orders on time to earn for her family.
 
She belongs to Pakpattan, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Peer Karian road. She moved there after her marriage.
 
She has given birth to two daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.
 
Ameen’s husband is a very hardworking person. He operates a business of making wooden cots. He started this business 30 years ago and in this number of years he has successfully built a good reputation among his clients for his good work. He also makes other furniture like chairs and tables and sells to different furniture shops on profit.
   
Ameen has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy wood and nails in larger quantity for making good quantity cots for selling.
 
She is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to make his business more profitable after investing loan money into it.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameen.

loans.use: To buy wood and nails for wooden cot-making business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
M. is currently in the business of selling siko (a local beer), simsim (sesame seeds), beans and small fish. She is 23 years old and married to a man who is in the army.  They have 4 children and none of them goes to school.
