She told a loan officer that when she first started selling various kinds of vegetables her business was not going well, and since she was a new seller, she only had a few customers who supported her. But her business has improved since she has diversified her products, and now she has many customers. She lives with her three children who work as a translator and garment factory workers.

Mrs. Ek has requested a loan from Kiva via Credit to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport her products from her home to the market, which will reduce the cost she spends everyday on a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport her products from her home to the market.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. NguY. Thi Y., aged 43, joined TYM Fund in 1997. With her first loan cycle, she borrowed VND 500,000 to invest in livestock raising. As this was the first time she had borrowed money for her business, she did not have experience and had made just VND 100,000 after 3 months. Although it was not a big amount, thanks to that loan she got used to loans and the repayment mode of TYM Fund.

After 10 years in TYM, Mrs. NguY. Thi Y.'s family has experienced many changes. Today besides livestock raising, she operates a milling machine, which is the main source of income of her family. Starting as a poor household, her family now has a stable monthly income of VND 2-3 million. Her family's life is getting more and more stable and they even spend more on their children's education. Concerning the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 10 million to buy another milling machine to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy another milling machine to expand her business

loans.name: Godwin

texts.fr: Godwin A. est âgé de 38 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il gère un magasin de pièces détachées à  Danyi à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Même si les entreprises connaissent des difficultés aujourd’hui, Mr Godwin ne se plaint pas trop car l’année est bonne pour lui où il a réalisé déjà de grands chiffres d’affaires. Il souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité ce qui lui assurera une bonne marge à la revente. Ce faisant il contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Godwin A. is 38 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He manages a spare parts store in Apéyémé, an inland town in Togo, located on the Danye plateau, 175 kilometers from Lomé - the capital-. Even if, nowadays, businesses experience hardships, MR. GASSOU does not complain too much because the year has been good for him. He has already made good sales figures. With this second FECECAV loan, he wishes to increase the size of his activity which will insure a good profit margin. This way, he will contribute to the improvement of his family's living conditions.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and resale spare parts  for cars and motorcycles

loans.name: Kham

texts.en:
Mrs. Kham T., 52, is a housewife who has five children, two of whom are married and live away from home. One of her daughters makes a living selling groceries, and uses her income to help support the family. Kham is married to Mr. Man Nit, who is 55 years old and makes a living repairing rice-threshing machines. He earns about $4 a day.

Kham hopes to enlarge her daughter’s business, and has applied for a $500 loan to buy more groceries. The loan will generate enough income to make payments while also improving the family's standard of living. The entire family lives in Resey Krok Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Mrs. Sreymom Suong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of twenty two people, is located in Rom Lech Village in Kampong Cham Province.  All the members in this village bank will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sreymom S. is a village bank president.  She is a farmer wH. owns a 1-hectare field for cultivating rice for a living.  Since her field is far from irrigation, it is difficult to generate water for her field.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fuel to support her pump to water her field and make her crop more productive.  Her husband, Mr. T. Hao, is a village chef wH. makes a small salary to help support the household.  

Mrs. Sreymom S. is 48 years old and the mother of five children; one of whom is a car repairer, while another one helps their mother on rice field.  The remaining three are attending the local school.  

All the members are shown in the picture but two are partially blocked from view.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These seven are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fuel to support her pump to water her field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Osaphea

texts.en:
Mrs. Osaphea M. was born in 1981 and she now lives in Tonle Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Tuon Srey Mom, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. Although they try to work hard, they still earn little income and cannot provide better conditions for their family. Additionally, they do not have any transportation to travel to some places such as local market, the work place, and so on.

In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Osaphea M. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family to use for all their needs. Mrs. Osaphea M. has two children who are staying at home because they are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family to use to help with personal and business responsibilities.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan L. is 42 years old with one child. She is married to a fisherman and they work together at fish selling. She and her husband manage their fishing business, which they started with just a small sailboat. Mrs. L. personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She became a member of Paglaum MPC, and she has been a member in good standing for almost 8 years.

Recently, a loan of Php 12,000 was requested for the purchase of new nets and to have additional working capital for their fishing business. They are tempted by the idea of expanding their fishing activities as they want to buy the fish catch of their neighbors and sell more fish at the nearby fish market. With numerous plans in her mind, Mrs. L. dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from their daily sales and of saving also for their old age.

loans.use: additional capital for fishing and buying additional fish nets

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is currently in the business of selling bread. Victoria is 46 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. She has three children, who all go to school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling bread.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto M. is engaged in rice farming. He tills a three hectare piece of land that he inherited from his parents. Because of his farm, it is easy now for him to feed and clothe his family.  Ernesto says, "I am the head of the family, I need to work better for the future of my seven children.” 

Ernesto needs a loan of PHP 14,000 (USD 300) from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm. The loan will truly give Ernesto a better yield so that he can continue to support the needs of his family. 

About CEVI

CEVI helps people start and maintain businesses. It helps clients by providing not just credit assistance, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertlizers for the farm

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, en la calle Eduardo Avaroa de la zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz, percibe una renta de jubilada del magisterio. El crédito que solicita es para pagar la maestría de su hijo que egresó de la Universidad como doctor, ya que por el momento su hijo no trabaja y sus posibilidades de encontrar trabajo mejorarán al obtener la maestria.

No es cliente de Impro pero califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa lives in her own home with her husband and sons. They live in the Cotahuma Zone of La Paz. They receive rent from some retired teachers. The loan that is being requested is to put towards her son's masters in medicine. Her son cannot currently work but with this enhanced education it will be easier for him to get work and earn an income. She is not a client of Impro but qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zoe Mullard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of a masters for her son, who is a doctor

loans.name: Jennifer Atieno

texts.en: Jennifer Atieno O. is a 31-year-old mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She sells maize near the road in Yolanda slum here in Kisumu, not far from where the maize is ground. She is asking for 15,000 KSH to purchase more stock to sell. She is married but her husband has been unable to find work of late.

loans.use: buying cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is already 34 years old and married to Santiago G., 39 years old, who works as a tricycle operator in their village. They have been blessed with three children: Charmila Mae, 17 years old, a college student, Laisa, 13 years old, presently in her second year of high school and Angelika, 3 years old.  They all attend a public and university school near their place. They reside in Barangay Minanga Norte Iguig, Cagayan.
Lanie manages a hog-raising business in their backyard in order to help her husband earn extra income. She works hard to make it grow to be able to earn more profit. Lanie is also a rice retailer in their village. This is another source of income for their daily household expenses. Lanie and her husband wanted to allot savings for the schooling of their children. She is applying for a loan of PHP12,000.00 to be used to maintain their motorcycle and to have additional capital to expand her hog raising business. The loan will be of great help to keep their motorcycle in good condition in order to have more passengers.

loans.use: For motorcycle maintenance and additional capital for their hog-raising business

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar is a 32-year-old married mother of three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Muyassar started her business five years ago in order to support her family. All year she sells fruit that she buys from local farmers. Twice a week, Muyassar travels over 60 km to sell her produce at attractive prices at the busy market. With the loan of $1500 USD from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her selling goods, and to buy more fruit to sell. Muyassar strives to give her children a better life than she has, including supporting them through a good education. Muyassar is a well-spoken, friendly businesswoman who is worthy of the support of Kiva partners.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Imylenda

texts.en:
Imylenda H. is from the town of Gracia, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Imylenda is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Imylenda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, delivering dried fish and RTW clothing sales. Imylenda's main source of income comes primarily from selling a variety of different products and delivering dried fishes in the local community. Imylenda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imylenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to sustain her business activities. Imylenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Imylenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and support her family's daily expenses. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sujani

texts.en: Ni Nengah Sujani (DNR.M-0706) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one school-aged child. Ni Nengah Sujani owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Ni Nengah Sujani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional piglets. Ni Nengah Sujani is now requesting a new loan of 3,600,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 3rd from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Nengah Sujani - (DNR.M-0706) merupakan 30 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Nengah Sujani memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Nengah Sujani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nengah Sujani menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Ni Nengah Sujani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Nengah Sujani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli hewan tambahan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,600,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Nengah Sujani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva, Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his shop with merchandise

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Маманов Икром мужчина проживающий в посёлке Учбог, работает разнорабочим на заказ. Он имеет одну корову и трое молодых баранов. Его основной доход не хватает на полноценное проживание. Поэтому он имеет дополнительный бизнес, откорм и продажи скота. Для увеличения численности баранов Икром желает получить следующий кредит.
Он ни разу не нарушал условий организации и состоит в числе положительных клиентов.
texts.en:
Ikrom M. is a man, who lives in the Uchbog village and works as a contractor handyman. He has one cow and three young rams. His main salary is not enough for a fulfilling living. This is why Ikrom has his own business of feeding and selling livestock. Ikrom wishes to obtain another loan in order to increase the quantity of rams. He never violated any conditions of our organization and is considered to be one of our positive clients.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy O. is a seamstress and also sells fabrics and sewing materials at Elmina. Dorothy has received tertiary.  She is single parent and has a child. Dorothy has been selling fabrics since 2002. She is responsible for paying of her child’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more sewing materials and fabrics in larger quantities to resell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward building a house.

loans.use: er loan will be used to buy more sewing materials and fabrics in larger quantities to resell at the market.

loans.name: Maria Inmaculada

texts.es: La señora Maria Inmaculada Calderón M., es madre soltera y tiene 1 hija de siete años de edad. La señora Maria tiene actualmente 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos y vestuario, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante, además que las personas ya conocen que ella se dedica a esa actividad por eso le encargan tanto cosméticos como vestuario. además, cabe mencionarse la señora labora para una compañía limitada, en el cual ella labora desde hace 2 años, debido a la situación económica del país que la obliga a buscar un trabajo fijo en donde debe obtener ingresos adicionales a su negocio. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de cosméticos ya que actualmente posee suficientes pedidos que desea suplir y vender más. Su sueño es llegar a tener una boutique en el cual pueda comercializar sus productos de manera formal en un establecimiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Inmaculada Calderón M. is a single mother of a 1 year old daughter. She currently has 6 years of experience selling cosmetics and apparel door-to-door. Many people already know that she sells these types of products. It should be mentioned that Sra. Maria also works for a private company, which she has done for the last 2 years. Due to the economic situation, she needed to find a steady job where she could earn additional capital for her business.

Sra. Maria will use her loan to buy cosmetics. She has enough products on hand to fill her orders, but she wants to sell more. She dreams of opening a boutique where she can sells her products in a formal setting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is divorced. She raises two sons herself. Her husband doesn’t want to be involved and doesn’t help Ruslana financially.

Challenging circumstances forced her to find ways to feed her family. This is how Ruslana ended up as a market vendor and a small entrepreneur four years ago. Currently, she sells footwear in the local marketplace of her home town of Mukachevo. She has about 50,000 Grivnyas invested in her business.

Ruslana is known for her integrity and consistency in dealings with clients. She works hard to keep her venture afloat. This time Ruslana is seeking a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to continue growing her business and working capital.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La señora Marlene, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 46 años y es madre de 03 hijos, y 01 que depende de ella.Teniendo la profesión de Técnica en Industrias Textilas, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, en un local muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, lleva varios años dedicándose a la Confección de Vestidos, tanto de damas, caballeros y niños. Con el trabajo que realiza esta muy contenta, por que le gusta y así genera sus propios ingresos para aportar en su hogar. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes géneros, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Marlene, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Marlene S. is a member of the Manos Unidas Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province and department of San Martin. She is a 46-year-old married mother with 3 children, one of whom is her dependent. Because she has a diploma in the Textile Industry, she did not hesitate in setting up her own sewing workshop in a well-equipped area in her house. She has been making outfits for men, women and children for several years. She is very happy with her work because sewing is her passion, and because this is the way she earns her own income to help support the household. She states that sales are booming. She works by special order. She is currently in the same business and has faithful customers who go to her house every day to put in orders. She personally attends her customers with the kindness that she is noted for. With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase fabric by the meter, different types of supplies that she uses, such as scissors, needles, safety pins, and buttons. Marlene now feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to reach her goals and realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her business, and for helping so many women who wish to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and supplies

loans.name: Remely

texts.en:
Mrs. Remely S. is from the village of La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 51 years old, married and blessed with 2 children who were in school-aged. Mrs. Nora is employed as the Municipal Assesor's Clerk. She has been employed for more than 12 years having a net salary of 8,000.00 per month only. In 2008, she joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the said Coop.
Currently, she's availing her 3rd cycle loan in the amount of 20,000.00 that will be used for the tuition of her daughter. Together in the picture is Remely and her daughter.

loans.use: Educational Loan Purposes

loans.name: St. Patrick Group

texts.en: Patrick is fifty-three years old. He is married and has five children. All of his children are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Patrick is a professional photographer. He is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Patrick. Most of the group members are either into trading and or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Patrick, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Señorita Alejandra , es soltera, ella hace un año que se dedica a la venta de Cds, a pesar de ser muy joven es una persona muy optimista y responsable ya que ella ha terminado la secundaria, ahora al dedicarse a la venta de CDs quiere reunir dinero para sus estudios en la universidad y asimismo colaborar en su hogar, ella vende en las diferentes ferias, en diferentes barrios, por ejemplo los dias jueves ella vende en la feria de Cumavi, una feria muy conocida en la Villa 1ro de mayo; en este momento ella necesita incrementar su mercaderia ya que en fin de año es cuando más venta tiene y desea surtir su negocio con  nuevas peliculas y Cds musicales, es por eso que accedio a un credito para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Ella se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza y esta muy contenta con las oportunidades que le brinda Emprender .
texts.en:
Ms. Alejandra is single and has worked for one year selling CDs. In spite of being very young she is a very optimistic and responsible person who has already finished her secondary education. She is now selling CDs because she wants to raise money for her studies at the university and at the same time work at home. She sells at different outdoor markets in different districts. For example, on Thursdays she sells at the Cumavi market, a well-known market in the town of Villa Primero de Mayo. At this point she needs to increase her merchandise because at the end of the year is when you want to increase sales and stock your business with new movies and music CDs. That’s why she agreed to a loan for increasing her working capital. She is very proud of the work she is doing and very happy with the opportunities that Emprender offers.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Celia Ysabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia YSABEL es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas mujeres. La mayor Wyni tiene 15 años, estudia en el colegio y esta el quinto grado de secundaria. La menor Camila tiene 4 años y estudia en el jardín. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa pero es nueva. 
  
La socia tiene un stand  en el mercado “Vino Canchon” del distrito de San Jerónimo donde vende papas al por mayor. La socia dice que al principio de abrir el negocio tenia un poco de capital pero para seguir con el negocio necesita mas dinero entonces acudió a la Asociación Arariwa y requiere el dinero para seguir con el negocio. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata de dar a sus clientes la papa de mejor calidad. La socia requiere el préstamo para el negocio de papas  
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
YSABEL, 28, is married and the humble mother of two daughters: Wyni, who is 15 and a student in 11th grade and Camila, 4, who is in kindergarten. The live in the imperial city of Cusco. She is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, but she's new. She has a stand in the "Vino Canchon" market in San Jerónimo district where she sells potatoes at wholesale. She said that she had a little capital available when she first opened her business but now needs financing to continue. She called upon Asociación Arariwa for help in continuing with her business. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising, responsible mother who tries to give her customers the best quality potatoes. She needs the financing for her potato business. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her potato business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es Soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 4 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación del techo y el piso de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client is single and has three children under his care, two of which are school-age. He has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for five years. During this period of time, he has invested four loans in housing improvements thanks to the funding provided by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent customer. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of construction materials to remodel the roof and floor of his house. His objective is to provide better security and better life conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
S. is 35 years old, a married woman, and the good mother of two young kids. Both are going to school and depend on their parents' income. S. owns a small business in which the main activity is decorating wooden furniture. 

Another source of family income is her husband’s enterprise. He is a domestic vehicle trader. Also, he buys vehicles at low cost and then paints and cleans up them and sells them at higher prices.  S. finds that her husband’s business is very profitable and is able to ensure a good standard of living for her family. 

She would like to borrow a $1100 loan for her husband to add to the financial capital of his vehicle sale trade.

loans.use: To add to the financial capital of the vehicle sale trade.

loans.name: Deepa

texts.en:
Mrs. Deepa M., a resident of Thecho, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Radhay Shyam M. and he works with a printing press. Her son is now studying in pre-primary school. Mrs. Deepa opened her cosmetic shop four years ago to help her husband raise their living standards. She sells different varieties of cosmetic goods in her shop, such as face-wash, creams, glass bangles, etc.

Now Mrs. Deepa is requesting Rs 20,000 as a loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods for her shop. Mrs. Deepa wants to save her income to provide better education for her child.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic goods for her inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Keov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. No matter how hard this family tries to work, they do not earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Pov K. decided to apply for a loan to buy piglets and chickens to raise. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pig and chicken feed. 

Mrs. Pov K. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. This village bank includes nine people, all from Veay Chhneah village in Takeo province. They will use their loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chickens

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA
La Sra. Shirley que es socia del grupo fue quien invito y organizo a sus compañeras para formar  la Alcancía Comunal DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA el cual se caracteriza por ser muy unidas. La mayoría de las socias se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. 
Marina es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, es por eso que fue elegida presidenta del grupo, hace muchos años aperturo una tienda en su casa, eso la ayudo a mantener y educar a sus 5 hijos. Ahora el deseo de Marina es ayudar a sus vecinas enseñándoles todo lo aprendido a lo largo de su vida.
La venta de chupetes y gelatina en verano es un buen negocio para Lucila, esto lo viene haciendo hace 7 años, además en casa ella se dedica a la costura, es muy conocida por sus vecinos y es por eso que le traen mucho trabajo, ella está feliz ya que mediante estos trabajos puede mantener a su familia juntamente con su esposo.
Segunda se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos tales como zapatos, ropa, ropa interior y muchas veces vende hasta menú según el pedido que le solicitan. El único interés es el bienestar de su familia. 
El destino del financiamiento será para la compra de insumos y productos para surtir sus diferentes negocios. Los socios agradecen y valoran la oportunidad brindada a EDAPROSPO Y KIVA, asimismo se comprometen en cumplir con los pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA (GOD IS LOVE AND MY GUIDE) Shirley is a group member and she invited and organized her fellow members to form the DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA communal bank. They are noted for being very united. Most of the members sell beauty products. Marina is a very enterprising, responsible woman; that is why she was elected group president. She opened a store in her home many years ago. That helped her support and educate her 5 children. Marina's wish now is to help her neighbors by teaching them all she has learned during her life. Lucila sells gelatin snacks and popsicles. It has been a good business for her; she has been doing it for 7 years. She's also a seamstress and is very well-known by her neighbors who bring her much sewing work to be done. She is happy because these occupations allow her to support her family together with her husband. Segunda sells various products like: shoes, clothes, underwear. Often she even sells prepared meals as requested. Her only interest is the wellbeing of her family. The financing will be used to buy ingredients and products for their various businesses. The members are grateful and they value the opportunity that ENDAPROSPO and KIVA have provided. They pledge, as well, to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Modou Gadiaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou Gadiaga N. est un homme marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 25 ans et le plus petit 4 mois.  Agé de 45 ans, Monsieur Modou Gadaiga  N.  est en charge de sa famille et de ses demi-sœurs.  Son activité principale est le commerce qu’il a embrassé depuis 10 ans.
Cependant il a une activité secondaire le maraîchage (culture de légumes) une activité très développée à  Notto  de par sa position dans la zone des Niayes au Sénégal. Une zone constituée d’un milieu assez original caractérisé par des dunes et des dépressions souvent inondées par l’affleurement de la nappe phréatique et par un climat assez favorable. Ce milieu n’a pas manqué d’attirer la population et de donner également à la région toute sa vocation agronomique.
  Monsieur N. a pratiqué le maraîchage depuis 20 ans sous l’influence de son père qui s’y activait.  En fait Monsieur N. aidait son père dès  son jeune âge aux travaux de maraîchage jusqu’au moment  où il prit l’initiative de développer sa propre activité le commerce.  Cette activité, dit-il,  lui a permis de tisser des relations avec le monde extérieur.
 C’est ainsi en 2009 lorsqu’U-IMCEC a ouvert une mutuelle pour mieux aider les producteurs de cette zone que Monsieur N. est devenu membre et sollicite pour la première fois un prêt de 50 000 FCFA. Il veut acheter avec le crédit des sacs de légumes (pomme de terre….) qu’il va revendre sur le marché. Avec ce crédit  il va constater son revenu augmenté.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou Gadiaga N. is 45 years old, married and father of five children, of which the eldest is 25 and the youngest four months old. He also takes charge of his half-sisters. His main activity is retail commerce which he embarked on ten years ago. His secondary activity is vegetable gardening, which is quite developed in Notto, due to its privileged position in the Niayes area of Senegal. The area is rather unique, characterized by dunes and depressions often flooded by an overflowing water table, and a favourable climate. This environment was certainly attractive to the population and gave the whole region its agronomic vocation. Mr. N. has practiced vegetable gardening for the past 20 years, influenced by his father who had the same activity. In fact, Mr. N. started helping his father in his gardening work from an early age. He eventually took the initiative to develop his own commercial activity, which allowed him to develop relations with the outside world. When U-IMCEC opened a branch office in 2009 to help producers in the area, Mr. N. became a member and is now requesting a first loan for 50,000 FCFA. He wants to buy bags of vegetables (potatoes,…) he will resell at the market. He expects that his earnings will increase thanks to this loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies of vegetables for retail

loans.name: Moussa Maurice

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa Maurice S. est un yoffois de 30 ans qui loge dans le quartier de Dagoudane. Il est societaire de la caisse depuis novembre 2009. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 4 ans. Monsieur S. évolue  dans le secteur du carrelage mais aussi en même  temps dans  l’élevage  avicole. Il a une expérience de plus d’un an dans l’aviculture, activite qu’il a choisi par passion. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans l’activité c’est le fait de satisfaire la clientèle et la réalisation de bénéfices. Il emprunte un montant de 350 000 frs en vue d’acheter des poussins et des sacs d’aliment. Ce crédit pourra lui permettre de mieux gérer l’entretien de sa femme et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Maurice S. is a 30-year old man from Yoff who lives in the Dagoudane district. He has been a shareholder-member of the savings bank since November 2009. He is married and father to a four-year old child. Mr. S. is developing an activity in the tiling business and at the same time in the poultry farming business. He has more than a year's experience in poultry farming, an activity which he chose out of passion. He is most interested by the satisfaction he affords his customers in this business and by the money he makes. He is borrowing 350,000 francs with a view to buying chickens and bags of food for tehm. This loan will allow him to take better care of his wife and children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio.
Norma es soltera, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Norma se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles variados, actividad que realiza en su casa, sus ventas los realiza a los colegios y tiendas a donde reparte.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y harina.
Los sueños de Norma son tener capital propio y una pastelería.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Imperio Communal Bank. Norma is 43, single, and has three children. Norma makes various cakes in her house. She sells and delivers the cakes to schools and stores. Norma needs a loan for 2,100 PEN to buy sugar and flour. Norma’s dreams are to have her own capital and a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar and flour

loans.name: Lini

texts.en:
Lini P. is 40 and married with four children.  She owns a business, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Lini has three years of experience in this business.  Lini needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Lini joined SPBD, and this is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lini's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivating tomatoes and lettuce

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en: This man has a general store in his hometown in Togo. He is 35 years old and is married with two children. His wife also has her own business. He has been in business since 2008 and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more products for resale in his store.

loans.use: Purchase more products for resale in his store

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás de 53 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. El tiene cuatro hijos y tiene una lubricadora. 

Hace algún tiempo uno de los hijos de Nicolás gano dinero y se lo dio al papa para que pusiera su propio negocio, el decidió tener su propia lubricadora, por esa buena decisión ahora sus hijos trabajan con el desde las 09h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar grasas, repuestos para su lubricadora de carros. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nicolás, 53 years of age, lives in the urban zone The Orchids (so called because, at one time, there were many orchids in the area) of Guayaquil. He has four children, and has a store where he sells car lubricants. Some time ago, one of Nicolás’ sons earned a sum of money that he gave to his father to start his own business. He decided to start a lubricants business. Due to this smart decision, his sons now work with him from 9 am until 11 pm every day. He would like to buy more lubricants in order to supply his enterprise, and mechanical replacement parts. In the future, he would like to open multiple branches of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lubricants, replacement parts.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días, Julia es Docente de profesión y trabaja en algunas oportunidades como contratada y viaja, mientras que su negocio queda en administración de su sobrina.
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y gaseosa.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is single and has a son who is in school. She has a store in her house where she sells a variety of groceries, vegetables, and meat every day. Julia is a teacher by profession and sometimes works on contract and travels. When this happens, her niece runs the store. Julia is a member of the communal bank “Glorioso” and is asking for a loan of 1000 sols that she will use to buy rice, sugar, oil, and soft drinks. Her dreams are that her child finishes his studies and to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Jumabek

texts.en: T. Jumabek is 44 years old, married and lives with wife and four children. He is a very hard worker, cultivating vegetables and fruits, an activity which he has practiced for nine years. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature and also because fruits and vegetables sell very well in the markets and are valued within his community. Currently, Jumabek needs a loan of $1000 US for his business. With this loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers to improve the farming and get better production. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli B. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 45 years old. Arceli is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Arceli has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arceli joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arceli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Arceli from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena B. is from the village of Calamagui 1st. She is 55 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Magdalena owns a general store selling a variety of products. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Magdalena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz L. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 38 years old. Ma. Luz is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Luz raises pigs for fattening and sale. Ma. Luz has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Luz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Ma. Luz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Luz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana Lidia tiene su familia que proviene de gente trabajadora dedicada. Ella tiene 34 años y está casada tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cago su actividad es una pulpería vende golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, pan entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque en su tienda se encuentra la variedad de productos que ofrece. Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar la materia prima necesaria que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Ana Lidia comes from a family of hardworking, dedicated people. She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 minor children who are in her care. She has a general store where she sells candy, detergents, staple grains, and bread, among other things. She works from 7 in the morning until 9 at night each day. She says that she has a lot of customers because of the large variety of products she offers for sale in her store. This loan will be used to buy products that her customers want.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy products for her general store

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin H. is 43 years of age and a married woman in Kampong Chhnang Province. In order to meet the needs of the family, Mrs. Chin H. sells a  mixed grill to people who are passers-by in the village. She has six children who attend school. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house, and then he turns fresh palm into sugar-palm juice to sell. This couple has always sold products items from nearby trees, but they dreams of having theirown farmland. So, Mrs Chim H. is taking out her first loan to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming on which she will grow different types of crops.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch B., age 54, lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Touch B. is a good mother of eight children, three of whom are school-aged while the remaining five are married and have a formal salary. 

Touch B. and her husband are rice farmers; additionally, Touch B. owns a few ponds in which she grows lotus flowers. Three months after planting, she harvests them to sell. She sells the lotus to people who need them for ceremonies to bless the gods. Right now, she hopes to plant new lotus, but she lacks funds for growing lotus. Therefore, Touch B. will use her loan for her lotus business. Any remainder of the loan she will use towards growing rice. Touch B. is  at her farm field in the photo.

loans.use: To expand her lotus business and for growing rice

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es:
José de 54 años, es vendedor informal en las calles de Guayaquil, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 25, 18, 13, 10 años en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar esta ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Empezó a trabajar como comerciante ambulante hace 20 años atrás para poder mantener a su familia ya que tiene cuatro hijos, recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil vendía artículos de temporada como cometas para niños, frutas heladas por unidad. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm con ayuda de su hijo de 25 años vendiendo las cometas y las frutas.      

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de cometa para vender a un volumen mayor y materiales de construcción para su casa como cemento, bloques. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old.  He sells products informally on the streets of Guayaquil.  He lives with his wife and  children aged 25, 18, 13 and 10 in a peri-urban area with all basic services in la Perimetral de Guayaquil, an area surrounded by a salt marsh.

He began working as an itinerant salesman 20 years ago in order to support his family since he has four children.  He sold seasonal articles such as children's kites and individual frozen fruits in the streets of Guayaquil.  He currently works from 8.00am to 3.00pm with the help of his 25 year-old son selling kites and fruit.

He would like to use the loan to buy kite materials so that he can sell more of them and building materials for his house such as cement, blocks, etc.  In the future he would like to finish building his house.

loans.use: Materials for making kites, cement and blocks

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth C., 22, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. 

C. sells fruits, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of about USD 4 per day. C. has to spend USD 25 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase pigs to raise for sale.  

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Patrick Peter

texts.en:
Patrick is a 36-year-old man, married to Jennifer who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children aged ten, five and three years. 

Patrick earns Kshs 15,000 per month from his farming and transport businesses. He has been running these businesses for the last five years. This experience has enabled him to identify fast-moving farm products and also to identify trends relating to his transport business. 

He was introduced to KADET by friends who have benefited from KADET loans, and this is his first loan. He plans to purchase farm stock worth Kshs 30,000. He hopes to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of farm stock worth Ksh 30,000

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is an ambitious married man with seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda with dreams of educating his children. For fourteen years he has been trading in cattle and his business dream is to venture into timber. Richard needs a loan to purchase timber for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of timber for resale.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric sells clothes. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children who are three and six years old. His wife is a businessperson. Eric has been selling clothes for 10 years, and he plans to use his loan to stock more clothes to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

He has operated a "nyama choma" (roasted meat) business for the last six months. He sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Elijah faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to own a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase kitchen utensils (cooking pots, plates, spoons). He decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils (cooking pots, plates, spoons)

loans.name: Julia Petrona

texts.es: Julia Petrona se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace mas de 6 que se dedica a este negocio, esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos ya que han sido necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio.  Inicio porque no tenía suficiente ingresos necesarios para su familia, pues es ella quien siempre ha trabajado y mantenido a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de toallas, ropa, calzado, cosméticos entre otros productos.  Ella sueña con agrandar su inventario y realizarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julia Petrona sells general merchandise.  She’s been in this Business for over six years.  This is not her first experience with loans since they have been necessary for her business’ development.

She started out because she did not have enough income for her family since it’s been she who has always worked and supported her family.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy towels, clothes, footwear and cosmetics, among other products.  She dreams with enlarging her inventory and making certain home improvements.

loans.use: To buy towels, clothing, footwear and cosmetics, among other products.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a hairdresser from Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. She completed her junior high school education and has been a hairdresser for the past 13 years. 

Hair weaving is popular in this part of the world and Faustina is keen to add on hair extensions, hair creams, and other treatments for her customers so she can grow her business. A loan will help her invest in these new products. She plans to use the profits to purchase a hair dryer. 

Her income helps supplement her husband’s earnings - he is a security guard – to pay for their children’s school fees and other household expenses.

loans.use: A loan will help her invest in new products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. K. is 30 years old, married and the father of one. 

He sells vehicle spare parts for a living. He also does poultry farming for extra income.  

He has been able to grow his business through Faulu Kenya because he has learned new business ideas. He has also been saving his money with a group in Faulu Kenya.  

He hopes to open another branch for his business. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni K. is married with two children who attend school. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated an open air food market for the past two years, selling to her neighbors and to nearby school children. 

Mgeni decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and cooking oil. She dreams of being self reliant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married with one child who is two years old. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.  For the past two years, he has operated a fresh milk selling business; he sells from door to door to shop owners in his area of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting, he wants to purchase a cooler for transporting milk for sale. He decided to work with Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler for transporting milk for sale.

loans.name: Deborah 3 Group

texts.en:
Domingo lives in Santo Domingo, in one of the poorest communities around the main city of the Dominican Republic. Domingo and his group of five entrepreneurs are taking loans for their businesses. They are sellers of many products like clothing, shoes, groceries and communication products. This group is named Deborah 3.

Domingo requires a loan to buy calling cards to sell in the street to people that need to recharge cards to make phone and mobile calls. He will be buying calling cards or phone cards from different companies to give more options to his clients. 

This is his first loan with Esperanza International and he is excited to start getting a better income. 

He started his business after a friend encouraged him. He heard about Esperanza Internacional and the program in his church from some other members. Attending church is one if his favorites activities. 

Domingo's dreams for his future are to have an improved business and keep working with us for his community. He and his group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy telephone calling cards

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 30 years old and is married with two children between the ages 2 and 8 years old. She sells meat. She employes two people to help her run the business. Her business is opening from 7am until 6pm every day and she has three years of experience.

Nadia has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more meat to sell. With this profits, Nadia will reinvest in her business and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Tuhfaniso

texts.en:
Tuhfaniso is married with two children. She has a shop at the center of Khujand city and sells men’s shoes. Tuhfaniso has been in this business for 12 years. She is very nice with customers and treats them well. The clients enjoy buying things from her and come back often. Tuhfaniso's business has become a stable source of income for her family. Tuhfaniso would like to get a loan of 10,000 somoni to increase the assortment of good she sells. She would spend the additional income to improve the family's living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new shoes

loans.name: Kasem

texts.ar: قاسم شاب اعزب في مكتمل العمر عمره 25 سنة يعمل في تربية المواشي وبيع الحليب له في عمله 5 سنوات حيث انه تعلمه من والده وهو يعمل بجد ونشاط حتى يؤمن العيش الكريم والمستقبل الجيد له ولعائلته وحتى لا يترك قريته فهو يساعد والده في تخطي الظروف المادية الصعبة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواشي جديدة حتى يتمكن من زيادة رأس المال لديه وتطوير وتكبير المصلحة هو انسان نشيط محب للعمل وللتطور يسعى الى امتلاك عدد اكبر من المواشي ليتمكن من بيعها والمتجارة بها فهو يمتلك القدرة على زيادة رأس ماله وتطوير عمله لا توجد لديه سوى بعض الصعوبات المادية الت يتعيق تطور عمله والاعتماد على نفسه في مساعدة عمله واهله له زبائن من محيطه من المزارعين والتجار الذين يقصدونه لتميزه بالاهتمام بالمواشي وتربيته بشكل نظيف واهتمام كبير
texts.en: Kasem is 25 years old and unmarried. He works in raising livestock and selling milk and has been doing this for five years; he learned the trade from his father. He is hard working and enthusiastic and wants to secure a good standard of living and future for himself and his family without leaving his village as he assists his father financially. With this loan he wants to purchase more livestock so that he can increase his capital and expand his business. He is an active individual who loves his work. He aspires to own more livestock and engage in selling animals. He has the capability to to achieve all of this, the only obstacle he faces is lack of capital which is preventing the development of his business and his self-dependency. He has local customers from amongst the farmers and businessmen who single him out because of his dedication to his animals and the hygienic way in which he raises them.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and expand his business.

loans.name: Luciano Felix

texts.es:
Luciano es un cliente de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos en casa propia  ubicada en la comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La casa de Luciano no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Luciano tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida, es por ello que trabaja arduamente criando sus ganados (ovino y vacuno), dándoles el mejor cuidado para que estos produzcan leche de calidad que él pueda comercializar al mejor precio. A pesar de la gran competencia que Luciano tiene en la zona, este cuenta con clientes establecidos que prefieren su producto.

Luciano solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprarle alimento balanceado a sus ganados. Estos necesitan con suma importancia este alimento porque de ello depende la buena calidad de su leche. Esta inversión le permitirá a Luciano seguir creciendo en su actividad y cumplir sus metas.

Luciano ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y presenta un óptimo historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Luciano is a 51 year-old client who lives with his wife and three children in his own home which is located in a rural community in Tambogrande district, Piura.  Luciano's house does not receive all basic services.

Luciano has a great desire to get his family ahead and provide them with a better quality of life.  For this reason, he works hard raising his livestock (sheep and cows), providing them with the best of care so that they produce top-quality milk that he can sell for a good price.  In spite of the fact that he has a lot of competition in his area, Luciano has regular customers who prefer his product.

Luciano is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his animals.  They really need this food because the good quality of their milk depends on it.  This investment will allow Luciano to continue growing in his business and achieving his goals.

Luciano has previously worked with our institution and he has a perfect credit history.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mr. Sum, 53, is a chief of the local police station in Baray district. He has been working at this job since 2005 and has a regular salary. 

His wife breeds pigs in a pigpen behind their house. She raises pigs both for their offspring and for slaughter. The family is able to make around $5.50 a day (U.S. dollars) to cover their financial expenses. The couple has six children, three of whom are already married and who live at their house, and three of whom are single and studying in Phnom Penh City. 

In order enlarge his wife's pig-breeding business and increase profits, Mr. Sum will use the loan to purchase piglets and additional pig feed.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and additional pig feed in order to enlarge his wife's business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Mary Grace has a retail shop that sells bananas, canned goods and snacks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, beverages and yellow bananas.

Mary Grace is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es:
Ana, es una señora de 45 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en compañía de su padre, ella trabaja en loza fabricando comales y ollas, este negocio surge por la necesidad de proveer ingresos para su hogar.
Ella inicia sus labores de 8:00am a 4:00pm, aprendió esta actividad por su madre, actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña, barro, nacazcol y pago de transporte para la producción.
Este préstamo le será muy útil, pues contara con materiales para continuar fabricando los utensilios de barro, su objetivo es permanecer su fuente de ingreso y ayudar a sus hijos para que se eduquen y puedan tener mejores oportunidades de empleo, así también quiere crecer en el negocio y comercializar sus productos en los diferentes mercados.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and has two children who are 13 and 15 years old.  She is a single mother, and lives with her father.  She works making pottery, such as griddles and pots.  She started this business because she needed to earn an income for her household.  She works from 8:00am to 4:00pm.  She learned how to make pottery from her mother.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase wood, mud, nacazcol seeds, and pay for transportation of her products.  This loan will be very useful because while she has materials to continue making clay utensils, her goal is to make her source of income stable.  She wants to help her children get an education so they can have better job opportunities.  She wants to grow her business and sell her products in different markets.

loans.use: to purchase wood, mud, nacazcol seeds, and pay for transportation of her products.

loans.name: Marknaf

texts.en:
Marknaf is 31 years old and married to Christine. They have two-school going children. He has been running a clinic for the last seven years, making a monthly profit of KES 30,000. He has been loaned KES 20,000, which he plans to use to purchase more drugs. With the anticipated, he plans to educate his children to higher levels of education.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for the clinic

loans.name: Julia Robertina

texts.es:
La Señora Julia es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este sector  es de clima frió y tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, carismática, mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres, se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población ha migrado o salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.
 
Doña Julia tiene 47 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos  de 29, 27, 26, 20 y 9 años de edad, tres de sus hijos son casados e independientes, su primer hijo es soltero trabaja solo para sus gastos personales, su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Julia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y como pasa en casa cría ganado, pollos, cuyes y chanchos los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un toro.
 
Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the Barrio Sucre village bank and lives in the Cumbe parish.  The climate is cold and has a beautiful view of nature. The people are friendly, charismatic, and keep up the traditions and culture of their parents. They work in agriculture and livestock. Much of the population has migrated or travels daily to the city to do various kinds of work.

Julia is forty-seven and married. Her marriage has produced five children, who are 29, 27, 26, 20, and 9. Three of her children are married and on their own. Her first son is single and works alone to support himself. Her youngest son is in school in the city. Her husband is a mason, and they live in their own house.

Julia is a homemaker, and because she's at home she can raise cattle, chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs to sell in her community.  

This is Julia's third loan with the village bank, and she plans to invest it in a bull.  Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Ethan

texts.en:
Ethan is 35 years old, married to Jane and they are blessed with two children aged eight and three years old. He has been selling and supplying charcoal for the past eight years, making a monthly profit of 32,000 KES. He has been loaned 50,000 KES, which he plans to use to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale and supply.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to expand his business and also educate his children to higher levels of education. In the near future, he hopes to grow his business, buy a lorry (truck) for transportation and also build a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale
