loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 51 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three grown children. 

Crisanta owns and operates a retail store at home selling various school and office supplies, candies, cigarettes, breads, soft drinks, etc. The children assist her sometimes when not busy at work. She has had this business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 1,600 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell.

Crisanta is a new member of GDMPC. This is her second loan request in the cooperative. In the future, Crisanta  hopes to hold the business for a long period of time and expand product offerings to gain more income and improve general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her late 40s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been running poultry and catering businesses since 1998.  She works from 6 a.m. to 12 midnight (including catering services time) and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy chicken feed and more catering utensils. Her dream is to one day be able to buy an incubator for producing chicks to sell and to increase her stock in her poultry business.

She will share this loan with her loan group 'Antokia', which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and catering utensils.

loans.name: Helen Luz

texts.es: La señora Helen de 29 años de edad, tiene la actividad de venta de DVD y mp4 y otros archivos magnéticos, la clienta compra su mercadería en la localidad de Desaguadero frontera entre Peru y Bolivia, ella viaja dos veces al mes, nuestra clienta es casada, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de almacén en una empresa en la ciudad de Cochabamba tiene una niña de un año de edad vive en la zona de bajo San Antonio la casa donde vive es en anticrético, su esposo solo llega los fines de semana, así que ella sola se encarga de la educación de su hijita. Nuestra clienta llego a la institución por sugerencias de otras clientas de la institución, con el dinero del crédito comprara DVD de películas actuales y así surtir su puesto de venta, es una persona muy trabajadora y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Helen, 29 years old, sells DVDs, mp4s, and other computer files. She buys her merchandise in the town of Desaguadero on the border between Peru and Bolivia. She travels twice a month. She is married, and her husband works as a warehouse helper at a business in the city of Cochabamba. She has a one-year-old daughter and lives in the Bajo San Antonio area. The house she lives in is under anticresis (a Bolivian rental arrangement). Her husband only comes home on the weekends, so she alone is in charge of the education of her little girl. She came to the institution at the suggestion of other borrowers from the institution. With the money, she will buy DVDs of current movies to stock her kiosk. She is a very hard-working person and she is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, namely DVDs of current films

loans.name: Marceline F B

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme mariée qui exerce l'activité de commerce de tissus. Elle achéte son produit chez des grossistes et le revend à crédit à ses clients.Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de se prendre en charge mais aussi de prendre en charge ses enfants.A l'approche des fetes,elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter des tissus basins, des parfums et des habits pour enfants.Son ambition est de s'installer dans une cantine au marché central.
texts.en: This borrower is a young married woman who sells fabric. She buys her products from wholesalers and sells on credit to her customers. The income from her business allows her to cover her own expenses and also those of her children. As the holidays are coming soon, she is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs to buy damask cloth, perfume, and clothing for children. Her ambition is to get a little shop in the central market.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth, perfume, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and a father of three children.

A. is a tailor; in 2003 he opened his own workshop for sewing and embroidery. He also makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats, and trousers for men and women. He has more than four years' experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local customers and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to purchase an embroidery machine. He is aiming to gain more profit to improve his family’s lives.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Maria Arinda

texts.es: Maria es una mujer soltera y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 22 años que conforman su familia y con los cuales sueña en verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos.  Maria inició una idea emprendedora de negocios hace 10 años, vendiendo tamales y gradualmente ha ganado un buen mercado como el de los restaurantes y tiendas, que son sus clientes fijos. Entre sus expectativas de crecimiento está lograr aumentar su producción y su capital de trabajo, para atender el volumen creciente de  pedidos, esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas como carnes rojas e insumos, para la preparación de sus productos, aprovechando que se acerca la época de Diciembre, en la cual el volumen de ventas se incrementa y  aumentaría sus utilidades. Su meta de crecimiento en su negocio es lo más importante, así como también la de hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a single woman. Her family consists of her two children (ages 14 and 22) and she dreams of seeing them become successful professionals. Ten years ago, Maria acted on her idea of starting a business. She sells tamales and has gradually achieved a good market that includes restaurants and stores that have become established customers. Maria expects to grow by increasing her production and acquiring more operating capital so that she can keep up with the increasing number of orders.

For this reason, she is applying for her first Kiva loan. She will use the money to buy supplies, such as red meat and other items, which are used in preparing her products. Maria will take advantage of the December season since her sales and profits increase during this time. She sees her most important goal is to grow her business. Maria also wants to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy red meat and other supplies.

loans.name: El 13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo 13 lo conforman tres perdonas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Andrea de 56 años quien  todos los fines de semanas tiene una fritanga. Este negocio lo inicio con la venta de pasteles y poco a poco fue aumentando e invirtiendo en otros rubros.

Las otras integrantes son Silvia de 26 años quien tiene un tortillería y Marisol de 39 años quien vende productos Avon.
texts.en: The El 13 Group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women, one of whom is 56-year-old Andrea who runs a fried food stand on weekends.  She started this business selling cakes and little by little she expanded it and invested in other areas.  The other group members are 26-year-old Silvia who has a tortilla shop and 39-year-old Marisol who sells Avon products.

loans.use: to buy groceries, meat, cabbage, corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Botir

texts.ru: Ботир заботливый семьянин у него четверо детей. Дети взрослые. Кроме детей на иждивении   у него находятся его родители. Для содержания семьи он предоставляет услуги такси населению. Его работа ему по душе, потому что более 30 лет он занимается водительской деятельностью. Ведь это общение с новыми и разными людьми. Он хочет получить займ  для ремонта автомашины и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Botir is a dotting family man and a father of four children. His kids are all grown up but still live at home. Beside children Botir also supports his elderly parents. To take care of his large family Botir works as a taxi driver. He loves his work because he can meet all kinds of new and different people this way and has more then 30 years of driving experience. Botir needs to get a loan to repair his car and hoping for your support.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima 40, is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Halima has operated a cereals selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products. She dreams of purchasing a dairy cow to sell milk in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase maize, cow peas and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cow peas and beans.

loans.name: Amaeda

texts.en: Amaeda is a petty trader who sells ice cream, cocoa drinks, ice water, powdered milk, sugar, milk, and other groceries. Amaeda is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying everyday bills. Ameada will use her loan to purchase more groceries for sale. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district, Mom is a 36-year-old mother of three dependent children, one daughter and two sons, who are still in school. 

She is a farmer who has been farming on her two-hectare farmland to earn a living and sometimes she works for others for extra income. With her current business, she is able to earn less than 10 U.S. dollars per day and save less than 2 U.S. dollars daily. 

This is Mom’s first group loan with VisionFund. She and her co-member, Khoet, who has been with VisionFund for three years, are requesting a loan for their farming businesses. Mom will use this loan to hire a combine harvester to harvest her rice paddy. She hopes to harvest more rice and make her daily living better.

loans.use: to hire a combine harvester to harvest her rice.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells plastic bowls, bananas and popcorn at Asebu Ekroful. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader.

Victoria has been selling plastic products, bananas and popcorn for four years. She assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees with her income. Victoria will use her loan to purchase plastic bowls, bananas and popcorn for sale.  

She hopes to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, plastic bowls, and popcorn for resale

loans.name: Fidenciano

texts.es: Fidenciano tiene 57 años, está casado y tiene el orgullo de tener hijos ya mayores y muy trabajadores. Vive con su esposa en su casa construida a base de bloques de adobe. Fidenciano se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de 2 hectáreas donde produce distintos productos rentables de su zona como  plantas de cacao y distintos árboles frutales. Esta actividad lo desempeña hace más de 30 años y siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su esposa logrando tambien contratar en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo  a trabajadores del lugar  para agilizar las tareas pendientes. Suele usar  abono orgánico para fertilizar sus cosechas y obtener una buena cosecha porque es necesario mediante la venta de sus productos recuperar el dinero que invirtió esperando también ganar dinero adicional. Los terrenos de cultivo que tiene actualmente son el fruto de trabajo desde que empezó y desempeñaba con ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar y realizar la cosecha de cacao además de adquirir nuevas herramientas para el desempeño de sus labores.

loans.use: Contratar a trabajadores del lugar y adquirir nuevas herramientas.

loans.name: Mercilyn

texts.en: Mercilyn is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Mercilyn owns and operates motorcycle transportation services, Mercilyn wants to increase her income and help her husband to earn a living by selling in retail store in their home. Her husband is the one who drives their motorcycle to gain more income. In 2010 Mercilyn joined GDMPC, so she borrowed a loan to buy a sidecar for the motorcycle so that it can cater to more passengers than a single motor and it is successfully paid and now she avail a new loan of 60,000.00 for a new set of tires and spare parts for maintenance and some of the loan generated amount will be use for financing of her retail store. For the future, Mercilyn wants to save money from her business and children education.

loans.use: to purchase tires, spare parts and financing.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for welding

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem C. is 24 years old and the mother of 3. She lives in Phnom Penh City, and she and her husband run a small game stand by the riverside. She sells balloons, small toys, and offers prizes for people that play her games. Together, she and her husband can make $10 per day in their business. She also is raising 3 cows for future income.

In the future, she hopes to continue growing her business and extending it to more locations.

loans.use: Buy more games for small carnival on the riverside.

loans.name: Rabiya

texts.en: M. Rabiya is 50,  married and has 3 children. She lives in Bilasuvar and she needs a $1200 USD loan  to buy a cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem S. is 43 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their 3 children.  She and her husband work on farming their land and buying and selling cows.  Their children work at a garment factory and help to support their family.  This loan will be used to purchase a horse and cart to transport passengers.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart for transporting customers

loans.name: Rahmatllah

texts.en:
Rahmatllah lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and lives with his own family. He has still not completed his education; he is in university.

Rahmatllah has a cosmetics shop where he works part time. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy goods such as creams, shampoos, powders, and extra equipment for the younger generation. He hopes to attract more customers and make a good monthly income to make a better future for himself and also for his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of his shop

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. is 70 years old, and is a widow with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells beads and clothes, and has been operating it since 1994. She learned this from her mother. She hopes that, with her loan, she can buy more beads and clothes for sales. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more beads and cloths for sale

loans.name: Zenaida's Group

texts.es:
Zenaida, Elizabeth, and DomitiL. have belonged to the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) communal bank for 8, 10, and 12 years respectively. In this time, they have learned to be punctual and responsible, to save, and above all, to work and support their families.

Zenaida is 45 years old and has four children. She travels to markets in Manallasacc and Sachabamba where she buys cheeses, grains, and meats to later sell in the city of Ayacucho. She also travels to the jungle Ayacuchana carrying these goods.

Elizabeth is 38 years old and has three children – and three businesses. Fifteen years ago she began by selling cosmetics, but after joining the communal bank, she began a beauty salon. Later, she began to sell clothing on order.

Meanwhile, DomitiL. creates fine weavings, a skill she learned when she worked with her brother 14 years ago. Little by little, she become more independent, and now she has her own shop and works with her children; they create landscapes in tapestry and sell them in the Santa Clara market in Ayacucho.

Their loans are for 800 soles, 400 soles, and 1400 soles which they will invest in the purchase of cheese, beans, corn, quinoa, meat, polos, sweaters, pants, blouses, cosmetics, wool and dyes. They will use their savings for their children’s educations, emergency funds, to take trips with their children, and to expand their businesses. Zenaida’s, Elizabeth’s, and DomitiL.’s dream is that their children will become professionals, they can improve their homes, buy land, own successful and larger businesses, and run a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Zenaida, Elizabeth y DomitiL. pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante desD. hace 8, 10 y 12 años respectivamente. En todo este tiempo ellas dice que aprendieron a ser puntuales, a ser responsables, a ahorrar y sobre todo a trabajar y mantener a su familia. Zenaida tiene 45 años y tiene 4 hijos. ElL. viaja a las ferias D. Manallasacc y Sachabamba donD. compra quesos, cereales y carnero para luego venderlo en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Asimismo, viaja a L. selva Ayacuchana llevando estos productos. Por otro lado Elizabeth tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, elL. tiene 3 negocios. Se inició hace 15 años con L. venta D. Cosméticos, pero después D. entrar a su Banco Comunal elL. implementó su salón D. belleza y posteriormente comenzó a vender ropa a pedido. Mientras que DomitiL. realiza bellos trabajos en telar, actividad que aprendió cuando trabajaba con su hermano, hace 14 años. Poco a poco fue independizándose, ahora tiene su propio taller y trabaja con sus hijos; hacen trabajos D. tapices, caminos y los venD. en el mercado Santa Clara D. Ayacucho. Sus préstamos son D. 800 soles, 400 soles y 1400 soles que los invertirán en L. compra D. queso, haba, maíz, fréjol, quinua, carneros, polo, chompas, pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, lanas, tintes. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para L. educación D. sus hijos, alguna emergencia, para salir D. vacaciones con sus hijos y para aumentar el negocio. Los sueños D. Zenaida, Elizabeth y DomitiL. son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar L. construcción D. su casa, comprar un terreno, ser una empresaria D. éxito, tener un negocio más granD. y tener una tienda D. ropas.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of food stocks, clothing, and basic materials for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Fati A., age 39, is married and the mother of six children, of whom five are in school. She has worked in this business sector for almost two years. Since her husband is a polygamist, she is alone in providing for her childrens' needs, which she can meet, thanks to the income from her business. She would like to use this loan to increase her shop's capacity in order to satisfy customer demands and also, through the profits gained, to help pay for the schooling of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Fati A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 05 sont à l’école. Elle opère dans ce secteur d’activité depuis bientôt 02 ans. Son mari étant polygame, madame Fati subvient seule aux besoins de ses enfants grâce aux revenus de son activité. Elle désire par ce crédit augmenté la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et aussi par les profits supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy 100 cartons of canned goods, 50 cartons of oil, and various items to increase the stock for her shop

loans.name: Boymahmad.

texts.ru:
Boymahmad N. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 41 years old, is married, has 3 children and a high school/technical education. He works as an elementary school teacher. In addition he is an orchard keeper. The season for planting fruit trees is starting and Boymahmad plans to get a loan to purchase small fruit trees and to plant them. His business provides locals with fresh fruits. He plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Назаров Боймахмад Мирзоевич проживает в районе Шахринау.Взраст 41 год, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование средне-специальное. Работает по специальности учителем начальных классов.Кроме того занимается садоводством. Начинается сезон посадки фруктовых деревьев поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит.Кредит планирует использовать на покупку черенков фруктовых деревьев и для их посадки . Его бизнес позволяет обеспечить население свежими фруктами. Погасить кредит клиент планирует погаситьв течении 12 месяйев.

loans.use: Покупка рассады.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
On one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca we can find Julia's internet booths. She is a young, 21-year-old mother who, together with her husband Ronal, and with much effort and sacrifice, was able to put in the internet booths at her father´s home about 1 year ago. They both always try their best to offer their customers a good and comfortable service.

Now, after observing the needs of their clients, they are thinking of fixing up an area for a phone booth, where they will offer telephone service to their neighbors who do not have phone lines in their homes. The wish of this young couple is to be able to reach their goal shortly, with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca ubicamos las cabinas de Internet de Julia, joven madre de 21 años de edad, quien junto a su esposo, Ronal, con mucho empeño y sacrificio hace aproximadamente 1 año lograron instaurar cabinas de Internet en el domicilio de su padre. Ambos en todo momento tratan de poner lo mejor de sí para ofrecerles un buen y cómodo servicio a sus clientes.

Ahora observando la necesidad y bienestar de sus clientes tienen pensado adecuar un espacio de su local para abrir e implementar un locutorio en el que también pretenden ofrecer servicios de recepción de llamadas a sus vecinos que no cuentan con una línea telefónica en casa.El deseo de esta joven pareja podrá concretarse en corto tiempo con tu apoyo.

loans.use: Install a phone booth for making both local and long distance calls.

loans.name: Princh

texts.en:
Princh S. is 27 years old, has two children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes about $1 a day growing and selling vegetables in a busy local market. Her husband, Mr. Hout Yoeun, is a 27-year-old construction worker who makes about $4 a day.

This couple has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy a cow that will have offspring which they can raise and sell. They will use the remainder of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, which they will use to grow more crops.

loans.use: To buy a cow, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Tautautasi

texts.en:
Tautautasi N. is married with three children. For many years, Tautautasi has developed business experience selling taro and banana to the general public and villagers, twice weekly. Her weekly net cash flow is approximately 200 Tala (~83 USD).

She has received three previous loans with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tautautasi’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. With her loan, she plans to purchase taro tubers, a weed killer, pesticides, a shovel, an axe and a crowbar. She hopes that as her business improves, she will be able to pay for her kids' education and home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen has had a lot of success selling calf meat and she never misses an opportunity to expand the space that she has at home to raise animals so that she can sell them at the local market. Her desire is to increase her merchandise so that she will have a stable position in the market. She always puts in a lot of effort and her main motivation is her love for her 3 kids. She would like a loan so that she can buy more animals to sell their meat.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen, es una mujer exitosa en el campo de la venta de carne de ganado vacuno y no desaprovecha oportunidad alguna en el amplio espacio de su domicilio para criar animales para beneficiarlos y luego venderlos en el mercado local. Su deseo es crecer en mercadería con el objetivo de tener un puesto estable para lo cual sabe que tiene que esforzarse constantemente motivada por el gran amor que siente por sus 3 hijos. Su petición de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de animalitos para mejorar la oferta de sus carnes.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve her prices/Inyección de capital para mejorar la oferta de su mercadería.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
The entire family of Delia is involved in handicrafts and this diligent young woman could never set aside this noble work. The talent she inherited is flourishing in the lovely garments she sells wholesale in the San Jose Market in the city of Juliaca. In addition to this work, Delia also has a small grocery stand inside the Plaza las Mercedes in the same city. Thanks to the good management of these activities she is able to enjoy tranquility along with her humble parents. Due to the cold season orders for her beautiful knit clothing have increased greatly and in order to take advantage of this opportunity she wishes to receive a loan in the amount of 1000 Peruvian Soles ($350 US), which she will invest in acquiring a wide assortment of wools with which she will be able to continue her beautiful art.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Toda la familia de Delia siempre se dedicó a la artesanía y esta diligente joven no podía dejar de lado esta noble labor, es por ello que el talento que heredó viene aflorando en sus bellas prendas de vestir que son vendidas al por mayor dentro del mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca. Adicionalmente a esta labor Delia tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de abarrotes al interior de la Plaza las Mercedes de dicha ciudad, gracias al buen desempeño en estas actividades puede gozar de tranquilidad junto a sus humildes padres.Por esta temporada de frió, los pedidos de sus hermosas prendas tejidas se ha incrementado de una forma descomunal y para aprovechar este fenómeno desea obtener un préstamo por el monto de 1000 soles, dinero que invertirá en adquirir una infinita gama de lanas con el que podrá continuar con su bello arte.

loans.use:
Purchase of various types of wool for the knitting of garments, which due to the intense cold in the area has increased in demand.

Compra de variedades de lana para el tejido de sus prendas, ya que por el intenso frío en la zona se ha incrementado la demanda.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mr. Bora K. and his wife, Mrs. Sarath Nao, who live in a small village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1986 and have five children; one son and four daughters. All of them study in a local school.

Mr. Bora and his wife have been in the business of selling fish and fishing for fifteen years. To add to the fish they catch themselves, they buy other fish from Prek Phnao market at Pon Nhea Loeu district for resale at a market in Phnom Penh.

Bora is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase one boat, fishing nets, and more fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy one boat, fishing nets, and buy more fishes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Mrs. T. L. is the group leader of six in Pour Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and she is a vegetable farmer who grows cucumbers and watermelons. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her rice field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. T. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to produce better crops. Aside from this business, she sews palm leaves together to process into thatch. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Sokak, is a cow and pig breeder. Mrs. T. L. is 25 years old and the mother of a one year old child. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to repay. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Charles T. est âgé de32 ans et est propriétaire d'une boutique d'alimentation générale à Apéyémé, une ville à l’intérieur du Togo située sur les plateaux de Danye à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Marié et père de deux enfants, Charles  est un homme  honnête qui veut gagner la confiance de ses clients, de ses fournisseurs et de ses créanciers. Aussi prend-il toujours son affaire au sérieux et désire par cette opportunité de Kiva et ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV faire des approvisionnements importants et tirer rapidement plus de profits de son affaire. Ce faisant il pourra assumer bien son rôle de père de famille
texts.en:
Charles T. is 32 years old and a business owner in Apéyémé, a town on the Danye plateau 175 kilometers from the capital Lomé, towards the interior of Togo. Married and the father of two children, Charles is an honest man who wants to gain the confidence of his customers, suppliers and creditors. He also takes his business very seriously. With this opportunity at Kiva and this loan, his second from FECECAV, he wishes to purchase supplies key to making more profit from his business. Doing so means he would be able to assume his proper role as a father to his family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for retail sale

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Five years ago Mukhtar started a dairy business. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. Mukhtar was born in 1966. He is married and has three children.

Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) to buy a cow for improving his dairy business.

loans.use: He would like to buy a cow

loans.name: Rukhsana Asif Gull Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a 45 year-old-lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She works as a teacher in a local school after completing her education till 10th standard. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 25 years. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son works in a private office. Her elder daughter works in a private hospital and her younger daughter is in 7th standard. Her husband's name is A. G., and he has a business repairing computers. Rukhsana baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy tools for her husband. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Shazia sadiq baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, sketches and colored thread) for her boutique. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. Reeta baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy tools to repair computers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta Saldon, 30 years old, is married and lives at Miputak, Dipolog City. Her husband is a tricycle driver. In her desire to help her husband, she decided to sell basic commodities such as edible oil, soap, canned goods, sugar, etc., displayed in a small table adjacent to their house. Their neighbors are their customers. The small business was going so well that she decided to expand and joined Paglaum MPC last March 25, 2008. She was able to pay her debt. Now, she avails PHP 8,000 to buy basic goods for her sari-sari store.
In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies. She also plans to renovate their house, including the space for her store.

loans.use: To purchase basic goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sing

texts.en:
Sing V. is 31 years old and lives with his wife in Bati District, Takeo Province, Cambodia, where he is a self-employed fruit seller earning around $5 each day; his wife is a professional tailor sewing mats, usually making a profit of about $1.50/day. 

In order to improve their standard of living, this couple is currently requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport fruits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport fruits.

loans.name: Allakhyar

texts.en:
Allakhyar T. is 55 years old.  He is married with three children.  

He is an entrepreneur who has been selling various kinds of home products for the last 6 years.  Currently, Allakhyar has about $500 in inventory.  His monthly net profit is about $100. 

Today Allakhyar is requesting a loan of $1200 for the term of 15 months to increase his stock.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur. 

One of his dreams is that his children might progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his very best.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase various kinds of home products

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa E. owns a small "sari-sari" (Tagalog for "various kinds") store. She is also engaged in making baskets, which gets additional income for her family. She is 46 years old and has seven children. She started her business in 2001. Now, she still has a store and still makes good quality baskets which she uses to feed and clothe her family.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for making baskets and merchandise for her store. The loan will truly help her attract more customers and grow her business more.

CEVI helps people start and have their own business. They provide all their clients not just credit assistance but also training and insurance coverage to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To buy stock for her sari-sari store and basket-making materials

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Nieves vive en casa propia con su esposo e hija en la calle 7 de agosto de la zona de Villa San Juan de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que tiene es la elaboración de arroz tostado con la cual ella y sus esposo mantienen su hogar y cubren sus necesidades de alimentación y de vestir. El crédito que solicita es para comprar mas materia prima y poder producir mas para vender en cantidad y mejorar sus ingresos.

La actividad y el carácter social hacen que pueda acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Nieves lives in her own home with her husband and daughter on Seventh of August street in the Villa San Juan zone of the city of La Paz. She makes a living making arroz tostado (literally "toasted rice", similar to rice cakes), and it helps her and her husband maintain their household and afford food and clothing necessities. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more raw materials (rice) so she will be able to sell a larger quantity of her product and increase her income. Her activity and her character make her qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice for her business.

loans.name: Haiba

texts.en:
Haiba has owned a small food-vendor store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to Subira huvuta kheri group loan (Group code 2055). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business every day.

Haiba is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Haiba is married, and has four children: ages 20, 16, 12 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар-женщина 40 лет,замужем,имеет 3-х детей.Более 2-х лет она торгует на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района.Нилуфар продаёт парфюмерию,косметику и другие бытовые моющие средства.Каждую субботу она ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан.Двое её дочерей помогают по хозяйству,так как Нилуфар имеет большой земельный участок.Муж и старший сын Нилуфар уехали на заработки в Россию,чтобы накопить денег для постройки нового дома.Нилуфар и её дочери благодарят наших кредиторов за то,что получили дополнительный источник для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nilufar is a 40-year-old woman, married and has three children. She has been involved in sales at the Spitamen district clothing market for over 2 years. Nilufar sells perfumes, cosmetics and different household cleaning products. Every Saturday, she travels to the city of Istaravshan for her products. Nilufar also owns a large plot of land that her two daughters help to take care of. Her husband and oldest son left to work in Russia in order to save enough money to build a new house. Nilufar and her daughters are grateful to our creditors for providing them with this additional opportunity to expand their business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of perfumes and costmetics

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru: Мушараф кредитор в Микроинвест с 2005 года.Она берёт кредит для оборачиваемости бизнеса животноводства.На сегодняшний день у неё четыре коровы и десять баранов.Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для закупа корма баранов. По словам Мушараф ,благодаря Фонду у неё постоянно меняется ( откорм и продажа)скот, с чего есть прибыль на жизнь.Продажей скота занимается её муж, когда скот готов к продаже он выводит его на рынок и продаёт за хорошую цену.Вместо чего покупает помоложе и худой скот, который Мушараф опять будет откармливать и готовить к продаже.На снимке Мушараф в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Musharaf has been a MicroInvest loan customer since 2005. She is taking out a loan for turnover in her livestock business. At present she has four cows and ten sheep. She wants to use this next loan to purchase feed for her sheep. According to Musharaf, she has MicroInvest to thank for the constant turnover in cattle, the fattening and selling that provides her with an income. Her husband handles selling the cattle; when a steer is ready for sale he takes it to the market and sells it for a good price. In turn, he purchases a younger and leaner steer, which Musharaf again fattens and prepares for sale. Musharaf is pictured on the day her loan was dispersed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Rayno

texts.ru: Охунова Раъно женщина , которая кредитуется на расширение бизнеса продажи женской одежды. За товаром она ездит в Бишкек раз в месяц. Она торгует в центре Худжанда, поток клиентов постоянный. Для увеличения летних женских блузок , юбок и платьев она решила получить повторный кредит. На снимке Раъно на месте торговли.
texts.en:
Rayno O. is a woman who is borrowing to grow her business selling women’s clothing. She travels for products to Bishkek once a month. She trades in the center of Khujand; the stream of clients is steady. She decided to get another loan to increase her inventory of summer women’s blouses, skirts and dresses. In the photo is Rayno at her place of business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow women's clothing business

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Veronica M., 32, is married with four children, ages 14, 12,  9  and 7. She also is staying with her mother and father.  She has a business selling concrete at a place called Bahari beach, some few kilometers from the city center. She started this business about three years ago.  She works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $75.

This will be Veronica’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to grow her business, paid hospital bills for her parents and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants to use the new loan to buy a fridge to start selling juice, cold water and ice cream at the place where she sells the concrete.

Veronica will share this loan with her group Bahari, which totals 17 members. The members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Veronica is in the middle of the front row in green.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and start selling cold water, ice cream and juice

loans.name: Albarka Group

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim Sorie K., Kadiatu K. and Isatu S.. Ibrahim, in the middle, is the leader of this group. Ibrahim owns a pharmacy and has been in the medicine business for many years. He will use this loan to buy more drugs to add to his pharmacy. Ibrahim is now 35 years of age. He was born in the Port Loko district of northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple have two children. One of their children is now in class five and the other is in class one.

This group is named Albarka, a Temne word for "Thank You". The members are entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town, 22 miles from Freetown city. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these people due to lack of capital. SMT, in partnership with Shine on Sierra Leone, is opening a new branch in Waterloo. They have come seeking a loan of Le 500,000 each, to help them improve on their businesses.

loans.use: To invest in a pharmacy

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old and is a widow with five children. She sells drinks, juice and pepper soup. She has been in the business for the past twenty-two years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past four years. Her previous loans were invested in her business.

Esther is requesting the loan of N120,000 to purchase more pepper soup ingredients and also more juice and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим Гафуров проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Абдурахим по специальности "врачом" проработал более 25 лет. Вот более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатыый скот на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abdurahim G. lives in the Gissar region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a housewife. Abdurahim has worked as a doctor for more than 25 years. Now he has been doing animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. He feeds and sells large cattle on the market. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Hagigat

texts.en:
Hagigat was born in 1950. She is a mother of 2 children. 5 years ago she started cafe business. 
Hagigat lives in Baku city. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for cafe.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for cafe

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: K. Herbert is an energetic thirty-six year old businessman. He has a retail shop in his local area, which his wife helps him run. He also has a car for hire. He is using his loan to bring more goods into his shop, such as sugar, soap, salt, maize flour, etc. His future plan is to purchase another car for transporting or hiring out for more income.  He has six family members, and would like to help his children get a university education.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 30 años, es madre de 3 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos estudiantes y el último todavía un bebé. Vive con su esposo, con quien también trabaja en armonía. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa por los distintos lugares de su zona, en un horario que ella misma se estableció: de 6 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. Su esposo es quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en el motocarro, mientras que Doris se encarga de administrar las ganancias. En estas actividades lleva un período de 4 años y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sentirse útil frente la sociedad, además que con ambas actividades logra fortalecer la economía de su hogar. 
Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son puntuales en sus pagos y son unidos en el momento de resolver algún problema. Con el dinero que solicita reparará su motocarro, donde gastará un aproximado de 500 soles, con lo restante invertirá en la compra de más prendas de vestir para vender.
texts.en:
Doris is 30 years old and the mother of three children. The two oldest are students while the youngest is still a baby. She lives with her husband and they work together in harmony. She owns a motorcar, but she also sells clothing at different places in her neighborhood. The work schedule that she has established for herself is from 6am to 6pm. While her husband uses the motorcar to transport passengers, Doris is responsible for managing the income he generates.

Doris has been involved in her business activities for 4 years and what she enjoys most about her job is the feeling that she is a useful member of society. In addition, she likes that her businesses provide stability for her household finances.

Doris is taking her 3rd loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank because all the members make their payments on time and work together to resolve any problems. With the money she requested, Doris will have the motorcar repaired. She anticipates the cost will be 500 soles, so she will use the remainder to buy more clothes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for motorcar repairs & purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita B. is a 54-year-old married woman. She has 4 children and the eldest is 24 years old. Her business is rice farming, which is the main source of her income. She works hard on her farm because she says it is very helpful to her family income. Rosita applied for a loan of Php10, 000 from CEVI to finance her farm. She will use this loan to purchase the necessary fertilizers, and other farm needs.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Molleccato Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Molleccato, are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 11 members in Urcos, (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urcos)  a town about 1 hour from Cusco.  There are 9 women and 2 men. All the group members live in Urcos and surrounding towns.  Some are married with kids while others are single.  The members speak Quechua, a local language.

The president of the group is Augusta.  She was born in Urcos and is 48 years old.  She now lives in Andahuayllas.  She is a widow and has 6 children who live independently.  She sells dry goods such as corn and chicha (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicha) and has been doing so for the past 25 years.  She will use this loan to buy more corn to sell and to make chicha.

The other members of Molleccato are involved in various commercial activities.  Some sell goods in the local market.  One of the women has been selling corn from her house for many years and will buy more corn to sell.  Another woman raises and sells “lechon”, a young pig (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suckling_pig), and will invest in more livestock.

All of the members of Molleccato appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(One other Arariwa client is pictured in the photo.  She is not part of the group.)

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Victoria Jenny

texts.es: la señora viene siendo cliente de Emprender desde el año 2007 donde comenzo trabajando con el Banco de Emprendimiento de nombre el Condor, a medida que fueron transcurriendo los años ella vio la necesidad de sacar un credito individual, en ningun momento ha fallado en ninguno de los pagos de ambos creditos demostrando puntualidad.  La Actividad economica que realiza diariamente es la de venta de comida en un pequeño local ubicado en la Plaza El Condor de la Ciudad de La Paz.  La señora vive con Fernando su esposo y sus dos pequeñas hijas, el esposo colabora con la señora en los gastos del hogar ya que cuenta con un trabajo fijo.  Doña Jenny invertira el dinero del credito en la compra de abarrotes para el negocio y el arreglo del tapizado de las mesas para dar a su negocio un mejor aspecto.
texts.en:
Jenny has been a client of Emprender since 2007, when she began working with an entrepreneurial bank by the name of El Condor. As the years passed she realized she needed to take out an individual loan, and she has never failed to make either of her payments on time, demonstrating punctuality. The economic activity that she engages in daily is selling food at a small place located at the El Condor Plaza in the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband Fernando and her two young daughters. Her husband assists with household expenses since he has a steady job. Jenny will invest the loan in the purchase of groceries for the business and in repairing the upholstery of the seating areas to improve its appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: It will be invested in repairing the upholstery of the seating at the business location

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is 35 years old. He is married with five children. He is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food stuffs such as sweets, produce, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store.

Naser is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to increase his stock.

He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
S. Nguyễn Thị is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, S. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  S. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.  S. is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase more baby livestock to raise & sell.  The loan will be the 3rd loan she has taken out with SEDA.  S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza A. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Riza owns and operates a business providing motor services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Riza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Riza is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Ulukberdi

texts.en:
J. Ulukberdi is 58 years old. He is married and the father of 4 children. Ulukberdi is a hard-working and enterprising man who constantly tries to improve and do things better every day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases and improve his yields. Ulukberdi needs tools and fertilizers to continue his difficult work, tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. He is applying for a loan of 4000 Somoni. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help Ulukberdi!    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchaseof mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim S. is 32 years of age and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a widow and a mother caring for a young child. Her child is three years old and enrolled in the primary school. Her mother appears in the picture. Her mother assists her in cooking and caring for her child. 

To earn a living, Lim S. owns and operates a salon where she provides hairdressing and make-up to people who are going to parties in the village. Lim S. needs a loan that she will use, along with her savings, to buy a used motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: El joven Norlan José tiene  36 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos y todos dependen de él. Por lo que Norlan es el sustento de su familia se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte en un triciclo. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, tiempo en el cual lo ha aprovechado al máximo pues les proporciona a su hijos los estudios necesarios ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios y no quiere que esto les suceda a sus hijo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para su triciclo, para un mejor funcionamiento del mismo. Su meta principal es seguir creciendo y mejorar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Norlan José is 36 years old, married, and has three dependent children. In order to support his family, Norlan provides transportation services via a tricycle. He started this business six years ago and has taken full advantage of it by providing for his children’s eduction. Norlan did not have the opportunity to finish school, so he does not want the same thing to happen to his kids.

This loan will be used to buy spare parts for his tricycle so that it will function better. His main goals are to continue growing and improving his services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a tricycle

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
Maria Cruz tiene 54 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos ya independizados. Vive sola en el distrito de Reque, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace mas de cinco años tiene instalado en su vivienda un pequeño negocio en donde ofrece a sus clientes prendas de vestir y calzado para damas, caballeros y niños. Este negocio le provee de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y también la hace sentirse activa. La mercadería que ofrece la compra en la ciudad de Lima y también la distribuye a sus clientes en base a pedidos.

El negocio ha ido creciendo y ahora ya es conocida en la zona por la calidad de las prendas que ofrece y por el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes al momento de atenderlos. María Cruz desea implementar su negocio con la venta de uniformes y calzado escolar, aprovechando el inicio de clases  en las escuelas del país, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y que su negocio se haga mas conocido. Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, los que la consideran una persona bastante confiable y que siempre ayuda cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
María Cruz is 54 years old, separated and has two, independent children. She lives in the Reque district, which is 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a small clothing and shoe store installed in her home for the last 5 years; she stocks items for women, men and children. The business produces income to meet family expenses but also allows her to feel active. The merchandise she sells she buys in Lima; she also works based on prior customer orders. The business has been growing and she is now well-known in the area thanks to the quality of her stock and the good customer service she provides. María Cruz wants to start to sell school uniforms and shoes taking advantage of the new school term that is about to start countrywide. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 2000 new sol, loan for this reason. Her greatest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman and that her business becomes better known. She is held in high esteem by her neighbors, who consider her to be trustworthy and always willing to help those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school uniforms.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina S. is involved in the sale of varieties of cloth at Jukwa market. She sells by moving from one person to another. Augustina has received junior high education. Her husband also sells soft drinks. She supports her husband in paying for their accommodation and utility bills. Her loan, which will serve as  additional capital, will be used to buy a shop to sell her goods in at Jukwa market. She hopes to use the new income she may get as a result of the loan, to save to buy more cloths to fill the shop that she hopes to buy.

loans.use: Her loan, which will serve as an additional capital, will be used to buy a shop in which to sell her goods.

loans.name: G.s. Nagarote Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario compuesto por tres personas, tiene 20 créditos y es uno de los grupos que han sido muy responsables con sus cuotas. Laura vende ropa cosméticos y productos varios en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado pues siempre se preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos. La otra integrante que es patricia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general las 3 son personas muy responsables y trabajadoras y Dolores que es la ultima integrante tiene su pequeña pulpería, ellas decidieron unirse para realizar  este financiamiento con la idea de mejorar sus negocio. ellas desean seguir con esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
This solidarity group, composed of 3 persons, has received 20 loans and has been one of the most responsible groups in repaying their loans. Laura sells clothes, cosmetics, and various products in her own home. She makes her purchases in cash and is always preoccupied about improving her income. Another member is Patricia who sells general merchandise. Dolores, the final member, has a small general store. All 3 are very responsible and hard working people. They decided to unite in order to receive this loan, with the idea of improving their businesses. They wish to continue with their current economic activities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR THEIR STORES

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 59-year-old married woman from Surallah, South Cotabato, Philippines. She has eight children. Her eldest, who is age 36, does not live with them anymore. She is involved in rice farming and hog-raising. Her husband does the major tasks on the farm while she helps him keep it productive. She mostly spends time raising pigs. She says that she and her husband work hard to meet the increasing needs in their household. She also sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines. She applied for a loan amounting to 15,000 Philippine pesos. She told CEVI that she will use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She will also buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feed

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel M. y M., tiene 36 años de edad es acompañada y tiene tres hijos de las edades 14,11 y 7 años, viven en una casa propia ubicada en Santa Elena departamento de Usulután.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de  tortillas, ella empezó su negocio gracias al apoyo de su mama y actualmente comercializa tortillas entre los vecinos y otras personas que circulan por el puesto que esta ubicado en la vivienda, con las ganancias del  negocio ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares, ayudando a sus hijos que actualmente asisten a la escuela.

El préstamo lo necesita fortalecer su negocio, que los invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, gas cal, bolsas entre otras cosas.
Anabel sueña con tener un negocio mejor como lo es el de un comedor, para mejorar su vivienda y poderles dar a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Anabel M. y M. is 36 years old. She lives with her partner and has three children who are 14, 11, and 7 years old. They all live in their own house, located in the Santa Elena department of Usulután. She has been selling tortillas for three years. She started her business thanks to her mother’s support and she sells tortillas to her neighbors and other people who pass by the stand she has in her house. With the earnings from the business she has been able to pay the family expenses and help her children, who are currently in school. She needs the loan to build her business. She will use it to buy corn, firewood, natural gas, lime, and bags, among other things. Anabel dreams of having a better business, such as a small restaurant, so she can improve her house and be able to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, natural gas, lime, and bags

loans.name: Yamileth Del Rosario

texts.es: Yamilet Del Rosario tiene 30 años, su actividad es una pulpería. La ubicación de su humilde negocio, es en su vivienda pues sus vecinos llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece como golosinas, detergentes, jugos, azúcar, aceites, frijoles, leña, papel higiénico entre otras cosas. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy emprendedora y que disfruta de su actividad y del momento de interactuar con sus clientes, pues esto le proporciona más confianza. El destino del crédito es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su trabajo. El deseo de Yamilet es transformar su pequeña pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Yamilet Del Rosario is 30 years old, and her business is a general store. This humble shop is located in her home; her neighbors come by to purchase the range of products she offers, including snacks, detergents, juices, sugar, cooking oil, beans, firewood and bathroom tissue, among other things. Yamilet has shown herself to be a very enterprising person who enjoys her work, especially her interactions with customers, which give her increased confidence. The loan will be used to buy supplies that are necessary for her work. Yamilet's desire is to convert her small general store into a distribution business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Esmeralda

texts.en:
María is a 59-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband and daughter in San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. María is a seamstress/dressmaker by trade. She earns a living by giving sewing classes and by selling clothing that she makes. 

María is a versatile entrepreneur; she can make all types of clothing including school uniforms, pyjamas, dress clothes, etc. She hopes to use this loan to finance the purchase of a machine to make clothing alterations. She plans to use the new machine to create more detailed clothes to offer to clients.

María is also a grandmother and during the day she takes care of her granddaughter until 2 pm, when the child´s mother (María´s daughter) comes to pick her up. When her granddaughter is relaxed or sleeping, María goes to work producing various clothing items. 

Two days a week, María teaches a sewing class in Guadalupe (less than an hour away by bus). On these days, she returns home around 4pm to continue making clothes. 

María´s goal is to sell more uniforms and increase her market share. She hopes to use the profits from her business to improve her family's standard of living. One of the main obstacles for María and her family has been the low level of income the family earns as a whole. At the moment, María´s husband is out of work, rendering the income generated from clothes-making all the more important.

loans.use: buying a machine to make clothing alterations

loans.name: Ines De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora. Inés G. es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la tercera ciudad más importante del país, sus iglesias son las que le hacen a esta  ciudad muy hermosa al igual que sus ríos y su gastronomía.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 24, 20, 18 y 13 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo cursa los estudios universitarios, su tercer hijo trabaja para solventar sus gastos y su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión sastre y gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia

La Señora Inés trabaja junto a su esposo hace 10 años, ella ha realizado cursos de corte y confección, tiene un taller pero el local es arrendado, no tiene horario para trabajar y labora de lunes a sábado, confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir.

Se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como: tela, hilo etc.

su sueño es llegar a pagar todas sus deudas.
texts.en:
Inés G. is a member of the community bank Loma de la Cruz, and lives in the city of Cuenca, the city that is considered the third-most important in the country. Its churches are what make this city so beautiful, along with its rivers and its gastronomy.

Inés is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children who are 24, 20, 18, and 13 years old. Her first daughter is married and lives on her own. Her second son is in college. Her third son works to help to pay for the expenses, and her youngest daughter studies in a high school in the city. Her spouse is a tailor and thanks to their communal work, they were able to construct their own home.

Inés has worked with her husband for 10 years. She has learned cutting and tailoring. She has a shop but the space is rented. She does not have a schedule for working and works Monday to Saturday, creating all types of clothing articles.

This is her fourth loan, and will be invested in the purchase of materials like fabric and thread. Her dream is to repay all her debts.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Узбекова Малика проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 38 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Не имеет высшее образование. После смерти мужа начила с малого бизнеса. Сейчас у нее собственный магазин, где она продает женскую одежду, ткани, нижнее белье. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Malika U. lives in Yavan. She is 38 years old, widowed, and has two children. She lives with her parents. She does not have a higher education. After her husband’s death, she started a small business. Now she has her own shop where she sells ladies’ wear, fabrics, and underwear. She has been doing this for five years. She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma F. is from the village of Carugmanan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 34 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Elma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: God Give And Increase Group

texts.en:
Sabah J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Give And Increase. Sabah is 47 years old, married and has two children, who are 18 and 30 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For three years, she has been manufacturing and selling a locally manufactured soap called "iron soap" in the Rally Town market in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more red oil and caustic used in the production of the soap. She describes herself as a kind woman.

Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more red oil and caustic used in the production of the soap

loans.name: Myline's Group

texts.en: Myline E. is from the village of Ugad. She is 38 years old and is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Myline E.’s Group. Myline is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Myline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: El señor Prudencio, Casado con la Sra. Natalia, ambos nacidos en Cochabamba con cuatro hijos, hace 22 años, que se decidieron vivir aquí en Santa Cruz en la provincia Andrés Ibáñez en un lugar que se llama los Amarillos, distante 15 Km de limoncito, Carretera a Cañada II, en el municipio de El Torno, en la cual el tiene una parcela donde se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, siembra maíz y sorgo una vez cosechado sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de el Torno, directamente del productor  al consumidor, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para contratación de mano de obra para el preparado de la tierra y también para la compra de semillas para, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Sr. Prudencio is married to Sra. Natalia. Both of them were born in Cochabamba and they have four children. Twenty-two years ago, they decided to move to Santa Cruz and settled in a place called Los Amarillos in the province of Andrés Ibáñez, which is 15km from Limoncito along the Cañada II Highway.

In the town of El Torno, Prudencio owns a parcel of land where he farms and raises livestock. He grows corn and sorghum. When his products are harvested, he sells them at the market in El Torno where merchandise transfers directly from producer to consumer. The funds from this loan will be used to pay for labor to prepare his land and purchase seeds. Prudencio is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting corn and sorghum; pay for labor to prepare his land

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao S. (pictured with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Sarith Vit, have been married since 2000 and have four sons. The family lives along a National Road, approximately seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Mao S. has been a rice and vegetable farmer for more than 7 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Mao has already asked for a Kiva loan once, and she is now asking for her second loan of $500 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Battsooj

texts.en:
Battsooj G. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. He and his family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest daughter attends a college and his youngest son currently attends a local high school. His wife is currently unemployed.

Battsooj operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 2000 and has been quite successful. His earnings have allowed him to start building a small shop in his yard and it will be operated by his wife. For the future, he plans to repair and enlarge his house where the family currently lives. Battsooj is a very honest man and is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela de 54 años, tiene una pequeña peluquería. Vive con sus tres hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Empezó hace 16 años como estilista de puerta a puerta ya que se separo de su esposo y necesitaba dinero para mantener a sus tres hijos. Cuando reunió el dinero suficiente para su peluquería readecuo una parte de su casa para convertirla en el local de la peluquería. En la actualidad tiene en su casa su negocio y trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 19h00pm haciendo tratamientos de cabello, cortes, alisados, planchados etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tratamientos, esmaltes y cremas para su peluquería. En el futuro quiere ampliar su casa para tener mas espacio para su peluquería.
texts.en:
