Graciela is 54 years old.  She has a small hairdressing salon.  She lives with her three children in an urban area called Orquídeas (orchids) which is so named because when it was discovered they found many orchids and there is currently a park of these flowers there.

She started out 16 years ago as a stylist working door to door since she had separated from her husband and needed money to support her three children.  When she had gathered together sufficient money for her hairdressing salon she modified part of her home to convert it into her  premises.  She currently has her business in her house and works from 9.00am to 7.00pm doing hair treatments, hair cuts, hair straightenings etc.

She would like to use the loan to buy treatments, varnishes and creams for her salon.  In the future, she would like to extend her house so that she has more room for her salon.

loans.use: Treatments, varnishes, creams

loans.name: Alma's Group

texts.en:
Alma D. J. is from Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Alma is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. 

Alma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 50 years old married, and has three children.  He lives in Bint Jbeil.  Ibrahim has worked in transportation since 2000, specializing in transporting students to and from school and tourist journeys. Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to legally register his van. Ibrahim would like to  buy another van to expand his business

loans.use: To register his van

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles O. O. is 30 years old, married, and has one child whom they hope to give good education to the university level. His wife is a business woman.  His business is located on Kisumu's Oginga Odinga Street. Kisumu is the region in Kenya where Lake Victoria is located. Charles sells microphones, speakers, VCDs,  and DVDs to the local people. He has been in this business for eight years. His business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is that he does not have a permanent place to run his business. At times, Charles also gets harassed by the local government. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. Charles is using his  80,000 KES loan to buy more electronics to increase his business, especially during this festive season. He hopes to acquire a permanent retail shop within the town. He sees himself being the major supplier of electronics in the city in the future. He describes himself as honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: To purchase electronics

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra Vásquez L. tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 21 y 16 años en el barrio Los Jardines de la ciudad de Cartagena, la más turística e histórica de Colombia. Ella tiene en su residencia un taller de modistería en el cual produce principalmente blusas, faldas y vestidos de mujer. Aprendió ese oficio hace veinte años ayudándole a una amiga en otro taller, luego decidió independizarse y compro su primera máquina de coser. Hoy cuenta con una buena clientela formada por vecinos, familiares, amigos y referidos de otros sectores de la ciudad. El éxito de su negocio está en producir prendas sobre medida, porque según ella, no existen dos mujeres que tengan cuerpos idénticos. Además de confeccionar, la señora Sandra suele aconsejar a sus clientas qué tipo de moda y color es el que mejor se acomoda a su figura. Con los ingresos que genera su negocio aporta a la financiación del 40 % de los gastos familiares y ha podido sufragar los estudios universitarios de su hijo mayor. Este es el sexto préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos y accesorios. Con el  primer  préstamo recibido compró una máquina de coser industrial y con el segundo una fileteadora, esto le ha permitido mejorar sustancialmente el acabado de las prendas.Sus ventas mensuales ascienden a $1.200.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 45%.  La señora Sandra alterna su oficio de confeccionista con la producción de adornos en cerámica. En la decoración de estos últimos le colabora su hijo menor en sus ratos libres, ella dice que hay que ser ingeniosos a la hora de generar ingresos porque en materia de trabajo no se pueden colocar todos los huevos en la misma canasta.
texts.en:
Sandra Vásquez L. is 39 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children, aged 21 and 16, in Los Jardines neighborhood, in the city of Cartagena, the most historic city in Colombia which also attracts most tourists.

Sandra has a dressmaking workshop in her home where she mainly makes women's blouses, skirts and dresses.  She learned this trade twenty years ago, helping a friend in another workshop.  She then decided to start working independently and bought her first sewing machine.  Today she has a good customer base made up of neighbors, family members, friends and people from other areas of the city who she has been recommended to.  The success of Sandra's business lies in producing made-to-measure clothes because she believes that no two women have identical bodies.

As well as making clothes, Sandra usually advises her customers about what type of fashion and color best suits their figure.  She uses the profits from her business to cover 40% of her family's expenses and she has also been able to pay for her eldest son's university studies.

This is Sandra's sixth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fabric, threads and accessories.  She used her first loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and her second to buy an overlock sewing machine.  This has allowed her to substantially improve the finishing steps of making her clothes.

Sandra's monthly sales amount to 1,200,000 Colombian pesos and her profit margin is 45%.  Sandra divides her time between her dressmaking business and making ceramic decorations.  Her youngest son helps her to decorate these in his free time.  She says that you have to be clever when it comes to making income because, as far as work is concerned, you can't afford to put all your eggs in one basket.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads and accessories

loans.name: Abdul Hamid's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the RC Boys Primary School in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1935 by the Roman Catholic church to educate the children of Lunsar and it environs. Presently, the school has 18 teachers and about 800 pupils. Over the years, the school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and other professionals in different walks of life. 

This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Forty-two year old Abdul H. T. (pictured back row, second from right) is a teacher at the school, and leader of this group. Born in Freetown, Abdul now lives and works in his mother’s hometown of Lunsar. He is a class VI primary school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for seven years now. His wife too is a teacher. Mr. T. has requested this loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy pieces of furniture (such as chairs, tables, etc.) for his parlor. This will help him a lot and will make his life comfortable, Mr. T. said.

loans.use: To buy pieces of furniture (such as chairs, tables, etc.) for parlor.

loans.name: Noelia De Fátima

texts.es: La Srta. Noelia R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, labora como cajera en una Institución de la localidad donde tiene 6 años de laborar. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta joven es elaborar su monografía para obtener su título como Lic. en Administración de Empresas, por tal razón solicitó su octavo crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de llevar a cabo su proyecto para ser una persona preparada y así tener un mejor nivel social y escalar poco a poco profesionalmente.
texts.en: Srta. Noelia R. is from the town of El Sauce.  She has been working as a cashier at a local institution for six years.  One of things she needs to accomplish as a young woman is to earn her diploma upon completing her degree in Business Administration.  For this reason, she is requesting her eighth loan from CEPRODEL so that she can achieve her goal of becoming a prepared individual.  This will give her the opportunity to improve her social standing and gradually climb the professional career ladder.

loans.use: Pay for her university expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is 37 years old and married with two children. He runs a hardware shop and also does poultry farming to earn more income. His business is only one year old. Elijah hopes to grow his business ten times bigger. He is also determined to set up other outlets for his business. He is asking for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy nails and wheelbarrows.

loans.use: To buy nails and wheelbarrows

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan Diego G. es un  joven de 25 años que fabrica calzado artesanal femenino , negocio que iniciò cuando llegò procedende de la ciudad de Bucaramanga en el departamento del Santander del Sur, y se instaló en el departamento del Atlàntico hace 6 años. En su desempeño en el oficio  le enseñó un familiar,  que ademàs le financiò la materia prima para dar inicio y continuidad, a su hoy trabajo en el municipio de Soledad,con el que genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su famila y por eso sueña con hacerlo crecer paulatinamente, mediante el apoyo de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y su trabajo disciplinado. 
Este es su primer financiamiento en esta organizción, para elaborar sandalias que tiene encargadas por clientes, para quienes ha fabricado nuevos diseños y que en el pasado  no habia podido cumplirles oportunamente, por el poco capital que maneja y que limita sus posibilidades de crecimiento.  Juan Diego vende a credito y de contado, sus inventarios rotan cada 18 dias y espera un resultado exitoso de su inversiòn, porque tiene capacidad productiva y experiencia en la ampliaciòn en el mercado en el que interactua.
texts.en:
Juan Diego G. is a young man of 25 who makes women's footwear by hand.  He started his business when he arrived in Atlántico department from the city of Bucaramanga, in Santander del Sur department, 6 years ago.

It was a family member who taught Juan Diego this trade.  He also loaned him the money to buy raw materials in order to get started and keep going in his business.  Today he works in the town of Soledad and makes income to support his family.  He dreams of gradually growing his business through the support of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and his own disciplined work.

This is Juan Diego's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to make sandals that his customers have ordered.  He has made  new designs for them.  In the past, he hasn't been able to fill his orders in a timely manner because he didn't have enough capital.  This limited his possibilities for growing his business.  Juan Diego sells his good on credit and for cash.  His inventory turnover is 18 days and he hopes that his investment will be successful because he has the production capacity and experience needed to expand in his market.

loans.use: to buy soles, liners, adhesive and other supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is a 45-year-old woman who is married with six children between the ages of 6 and 27 years. She sells cereals as a primary business but also practices seasonal farming in her land. Her five-year-old business in cereals is able to give her Kshs 10,000 every month as income.

Margret has applied for our education loan as a fourth cycle loan so that she can pay school fees for her children. She is also servicing another business loan which she has been repaying well without any issues.	 

She hopes to expand her cereals business in the future and be able to sell cereals in wholesale.  She believes she is courageous, hardworking and an opportunist who never lets good opportunities pass her by.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Las Guadalupes De Jamiltepec Group

texts.es:
Las Guadalupes de Jamiltepec este grupo esta ubicado en una población donde la mayoría de las personas son de origen mixteco, este grupo se llama así en honor a la virgen de Guadalupe y además el pueblo se llama Jamiltepec, este grupo esta formado por personas muy trabajadoras y se conocen entre sí.
Yesenia Guadalupe es la representante de este grupo y fue quien invito a las personas a formar parte de FRAC, esta casada con el señor Antonio, tiene 3 hijos que estudian la primaria y secundaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración de cortinas actividad que aprendió tomando un curso, también vende ropa como son: blusas, playeras, pantalones, faldas, entre otros. Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar más productos ya que tiene poca mercancía y necesita surtir más. Ella comenta que le va bien en sus negocio aunque hay temporadas en que la venta es muy baja, pero sí obtiene un poco de ganancia para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos.
Ella agradece a dios por la vida y a FRAC por el préstamo otorgado.
Este grupo esta integrado por personas responsables que se dedican a diferentes actividades para así poder mantener a su familia a continuación las mencionaré:
Juan Antonio: Venta de comida.
Marcelo: Venta de frutas.
Yesenia: Venta de cortinas y ropa.
Eusebia: Elaboración de tortillas.
Agustina: Venta de pollo.
Yeni: Venta de calzado.
Silvina: Venta de comida.
Irma: Elaboración de pan.
Paula: Venta de abarrotes.
Virginia: Venta de comida.
Araceli: Venta de comida y zapatos.
María: Venta de ropa.
Ángela: Venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
“Los Guadalupes de Jamiltepec” is a group located in an area where the majority of the people are Mixtec Indians. This group is named in honor of the Virgin of Guadalupe. Their town is named “Jamiltepec”. This group is made up of many hardworking individuals and they are known for this trait.
Yesenia is a member of the group and was the one who invited the people to form the group called FRAC. She is married to Antonio and has three children that study in primary or secondary school. She makes drapes. She learned this skill from a course that she took. She also sells clothes such as blouses, bathing suits, pants, skirts, as well as other items. She is asking for a loan in order to buy more products as she has few products and needs a larger variety of things. She says that her business is good but there are times when the sales are slow. She would like to earn a little income in order to help her husband with expenses.
She thanks God for life and FRAC for the loan that she is requesting.
This group is made up of other responsible people that do other activities in order to support their families. They are: Juan Antonio: sells food, Marcelo: sells fruit, Yesenia: sells curtains and clothes, Eusebia: sells tortillas, Agustina: sells chicken, Yeni: sells shoes, Silvina: sells food, Irma: sells bread,  Paula: sells groceries, Virginia: sells food, Araceli: sells food and shoes, Maria: sells clothes and Angela: sells drinks.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Las Piedras Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Piedras, se encuentra localizado en San Vicente de Juárez, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos México, está conformado por las señoras Olegaria y Maribel van a comprar con su crédito masa, tortillas, carne para preparar su comida, el Señor Macedonio va a comprar zapato de dama, caballero y niño, la señora Edilia va a comprar refrescos, leche, huevos, azúcar para surtir su negocio, la señora Oliva va a comprar teleras, jamón, queso, verduras, salchichas para preparar tortas. La señora Oliva tiene 26 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 2 niñas Lalis de 5 años de edad y Emily de 3 años de edad están viviendo con sus papas, ella tiene su negocio de ventas por catalogo de perfumes, cosméticos de Jafra y Avon y colchas por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para invertir en perfumes, cosméticos y colchas y tener mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, su negocio es ambulante, sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año la invito su prima y le pareció bien, lo aprendió ella sola, mete sus pedidos y le dan crédito de un mes, ella está muy contenta con el préstamo que le van a dar lo va a invertir en su negocio para ofrecerles a sus clientes y tener en existencia. Ella tiene la esperanza de hacer un cuartito si Dios quiere para vivir ahí con sus niñas y progresar, también que sus niñas estudien y tengan una carrera. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su interés de ayudarnos en nuestros negocios y que Dios lo Bendiga, gracias”
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Las Piedras'.  It is located in San Vicente de Juárez, Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  It is made up of Olegaria and Maribel, who will use their loan to buy dough, tortillas and meat for preparing their meals; Macedonio, who will buy men's women's and children's shoes; Edilia, who will buy soft drinks, milk, eggs and sugar to stock her business and Oliva, who will buy rolls, ham, cheese, vegetables and sausages to make sandwiches.

Oliva is 26 years old.  She is a single mother and has two daughters: 5 year-old Lalis and 3 year-old Emily.  They are living with her parents.  Oliva has a business selling Avon and Jafra perfumes and cosmetics, and bedspreads through catalogs.  She requested her loan to invest in perfumes, cosmetics and bedspreads so that she would have merchandise to offer her customers.  She does not sell from a fixed sales location.  She goes door to door to sell her products.  Oliva started this business one year ago.  Her cousin invited her to do it and it seemed a good idea.  She learned the business herself.  She places her orders and they give her one month's credit.  She is very happy with the loan that she is going to be given.  She will invest it in her business so that she can offer the products to her customers and have them in stock.

Oliva hopes to build a room, if God so wishes, so that she can live there with her daughters and make progress.  She also wants her daughters to study and have a career.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "We thank you for your interest in helping us with our businesses.  God bless you.  Thank you".

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and bedspreads

location.town: San Vicente de Juarez, Ayala, Mor.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is 37 years old, married, and has an eight-year-old child.  He makes seat covers for motor vehicles.  He has seven years of experience in this business and has employed one person.  

Shem has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he has been trained on business management.  He also saves his money through Faulu Kenya and can easily access business loans.  He has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy fabric materials to make seat covers.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make seat covers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 38 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 3 of them go to school.  Rose sells food in a restaurant and has borrowed a loan to stock more food to sell.  She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el hace servicio de taxi y trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, el hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro. 
                                                   
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the "Yahuar Maqui" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The client is 34 years old, single, and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  He provides a taxi service and works from 7.00am to 10.00pm.  He provides a taxi service in the streets of the city of Cusco.  Through this business, he gets his child ahead in life.  The client would like to expand his taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for his car.

The client is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Madiore

texts.en:
Madiore is 47 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The eldest child is 27 and the youngest is 19. Madiore and her husband are both farmers. She helps him till their land where they grow rice crops. She has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Madiore hopes to improve her family's living conditions. She also wishes to see her all her children succeed.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.en:
Shokirjon is a 21-year-old married man who owns a small farm. Shokirjon has been running a business raising and selling cattle. He has six years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Shokirjon has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. Now Shokirjon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So, he applied for a loan of $3,000 USD. Shokirjon thanks all lenders for their support.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Emma Rina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emma Rina; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de manualidades, ella hace trabajos en tela, lana y tejidos y también hace manteles y pisos y lo vende en forma independiente y también la socia es cesante del nivel de educación, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las manualidades como lana, hilos y crochés.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Emma Rina is a member of the “PUNTUALITO” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 52 years old, is married, and has four children.  She does arts and crafts with fabric, yarn, knitting and also makes tablecloths and mats and sells them on her own.  She is also a retired teacher.  Emma Rina would like to expand her craft business and is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as yarn, thread, and crochets.

She is very happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy craft supplies

loans.name: Mwatsuma

texts.en:
Mwatsuma is a married man with two children: one girl and one boy. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food. For the past four years, he has been selling fish at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He dreams of establishing another business selling shoes in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 44 years-old and married with four children. With two children in school, Anabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Anabelle runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Anabelle has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, egg, noodles, etc.. 

In the futur,e Anabelle would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39 year-old businessman.  He is married and blessed with one child.  For the last five years, he has been operating a welding business to support the family.  He has another source of income in dairy farming. In the next five years, he wants to be successful in his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington is 60 years old, married, and a father of six children aged between three and 29. Wellington is a vegetable farmer and also a water vendor in Rabai, Mariakani. Wellington’s business has been in operation for eight years and is doing well. 

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase water tanks and pipes for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. His dream is to become a very successful businessman and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks and pipes

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Ahmad, who is in his early 20s, is single. He has been running a second hand clothes business for four years now. He works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more clothes, which he sells from door to door. He also paid the rent for the room where he stays and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock of second hand clothes to sell.  His dream is to one day be able to open a shop to sell his clothes.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mango", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: San Fernando Ii Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal San Fernando está conformada por personas muy responsable. Maria, Aleyda Del Carmen, Norma, Rosalina, Zacarías Del Socorro, Leónidas Del Carmen, Modesta Aurora, Santos Isabel, Juan Francisco y Maria Leonor. Santos Isabel se dedica a la venta de cuajada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella inicio su negocio sacando fiado la cuajada y con lo que vendía pagaba y lo aprendió por una amiga fue así que decide reunirse con sus compañeros y realizar estos financiamientos. Solicita un préstamo para la compra de leche, cuajada, queso crema entre otros.
texts.en:
The San Fernando communal bank is made up of very responsible people: Maria, Aleyda Del Carmen, Norma, Rosalina, Zacarías Del Socorro, Leónidas Del Carmen, Modesta Aurora, Santos Isabel, Juan Francisco, and Maria Leonor.

Santos Isabel sells curds. She has 2 minor children in her care. She started her business buying the curd on credit, paying for it with her profits. She learned it from a friend, and that is how she decided to join her communal bank and obtain this financing. She requests a loan in order to purchase milk, curds, cream cheese, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase milk, curds, cream cheese, and other items

loans.name: Ihssan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and a father of one child.

Ihssan has been an owner for a bookshop since 2003. He has a photocopier in his shop and he sells stationery. He has more than eight years' experience in this field and a good reputation. He is becoming well known, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2000 loan in order to purchase a color photocopy machine and to add more merchandise. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a color photocopy machine and to add more merchandise.

loans.name: Tuzamurane/mrnd Group

texts.fr:
Alphonse fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Mrnd. Le nom du groupe signifie «s’entraider l’un pour l’autre ». Il a 52 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 6 à 21 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Alphonse est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire les semences sélectionnée. Dans les prochaines années, Alphonse voudrait être fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Alphonse is a member of Tuzamurane/Mrnd Group, whose name means "to help each other". He's 52 years old, and married with six children, age 6 to 21. They all attend school. His own level of education amounts six years of elementary school.

Alphonse is a rice cultivator who's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to select the seeds he sows. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be a rice provider in his region. With his profits, he intends to educate and provide healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
la sra Maria del Transito tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y esta casada con el Sr. Santos Marcos,  quien se dedica a varias actividades productivas.
Maria se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos y cafe, los granos basicos son para el consumo de su familia y el cafe es para la venta una vez por año.
Maria utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, desea gozar de luz electrica en su casa de habitacion, este servicio es básico para todas las familias, desea darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria del Transito, 43, is a mother of 4 and is married to Santos Marcos who has several jobs. 

Maria grows basic grains and coffee. The grains are for the family's consumption and the coffee is to sell once a year. 

Maria will use the loan to buy a solar energy panel. She wants to have electricity in their home. This is a basic service for all families. She wants to give her children a better future and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El señor Luis Fernando a sus 63 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace 17 años. Esta labor de ordeño de vacas la prendió desde niño de su padre quien en su finca tenía varias vacas. En 1997, el señor Luis Fernando decide independizarse y tener su propio negocio de venta de leche a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Actualmente, el señor Luis Fernando desea comprar otra vaca lechera que le permita incrementar la venta de leche y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. En un futuro el señor Luis Fernando desea tener un mayor número de vacas y generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en: Luis Fernando is 63 years old. He has sold milk for 17 years. Working with cows started when he was a child since his father had some cows on his farm. In 1997, Luis Fernando decided make himself independent and to start his own business selling milk to his neighbors, friends and relatives. Now, Luis Fernando wants to buy another dairy cow to increase his milk sales. With this, he can increase his income and give his family a better quality of life. In the future, Luis Fernando wants to have a larger number of cows and generate jobs in his community.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 25 year old and wants a loan to buy groundnuts (peanuts) for resale. Having started out as a farmer, he saved money to start a produce selling business. He faces hardships of high transportation costs, and he dreams of acquiring a vehicle to help in transportation of his produce.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is 56 years old.  He sells sand so as to earn a living.  He has been in the business for more than ten years and has employed two people.  He also owns rental houses.  Besides that, he does farming.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to boost his farming by buying a water tank. He has also learnt how to save his money.  Zachary has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy another water tank.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Berta Ines

texts.es: La señora Berta Inés se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas como almuerzos y refrigerios a trabajadores de dos empresas del municipio de Envigado localizadas al sur de la cuidad de Medellín, esta labor la inicia con la necesidad de tener un ingreso con el cual cubrir los gastos de su familia puesto que su esposo murió y su hija tiene inconvenientes de salud. La señora Berta Inés requiere para su negocio y la elaboración de las comidas insumos tales como verduras, condimentos y una olla para cocinar de mayor capacidad. El sueño de la señora Berta Inés es tener su propio restaurante y ver mejoras en la salud de su hija.
texts.en:
Señora Berta Inés makes and sells food such as lunches and light snacks to the workers of the two companies located in the municipality of Envigado, south of the town of Medellín. She started this business when her husband died and she needed to earn money to cover the family’s expenses. She also has a daughter with health problems.

Berta Inés needs to buy ingredients such as vegetables, condiments, and larger saucepans in which to cook larger quantities of food. Her dreams are to open her own restaurant and see her daughter’s health improve.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and large saucepans

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 59 years old, widowed, and has one son who works for others to earn a living. She lives in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She has been farming on her rice farm as her primary business for thirty years and she supplements her income by planting cassava. 

Hoeurn has been with VisionFund since 2009, and the loans have helped her have a regular income. Now she earns around US $7 per day but saves only US $1.50 daily. She leads a group of two female members, and they are applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and wood to renovate her house. She hopes to have a decent and improved house to live.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her house renovation.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 to 11 years. She describes herself as honest and God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells containers, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy and  viable area and her primary customers are residents. 

Rose describes her biggest business challenge to be few customers. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to  buy items such as basins, shoes, charcoal stoves, etc. Rose's business goal is to venture into the clothes business within five years.

loans.use: To buy more basins, shoes, charcoal stoves, etc.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. she is the mother of seven children.
Khadra hs a home based project she sells cosmotics, now she is planning to purchase a refridgerator so that she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to improve her family life's conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new fridgerator for her home.

loans.name: Wicyererwa/sk Group

texts.fr:
Jean Claude, père d’un enfant qui a 3 ans, il est âgé de 24 ans. Son enfant n’a pas encore atteint l’âge d’aller à l’école. Jean Claude n’a aucune autre personne en sa charge. Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est de six ans de l’école primaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2011. Il est au troisième cycle et les deux premiers cycles sont  bien remboursés.
Avec le présent crédit, il va acheter 75 kilos des engrais chimiques, il  va louer le champ et le préparer.
La mort, l’inondation ou les catastrophes naturelles sont les difficultés de non remboursement qu’attend Monsieur Jean Claude.
Comme stratégies, il va augmenter des champs cultivables et faire l’agriculture du riz d’une façon moderne.
Il a l’ambition d’être le grand agriculteur du riz qui le fait professionnellement.
Pour sa famille, il va scolariser et faire soigner ses enfants et  habiter dans une belle maison. 
A part d’activité financée, il fait le commerce de boutique et fait l’élevage des porcs.
Autre information intéressante lui concernant est qu’il va construire une maison commerciale.

loans.use: Achat des engrais chimiques, preparation du champs et location du champs

loans.name: Sarpong

texts.en:
Sarpong is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 54 years old and married with three children, one is having Senior High School education and others having tertiary and Basic education. 
Sarpong believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase knife for pruning and harvesting of oil palm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil sews on a machine the leather jackets for men. He is hardworker, has been engaged in this business for 15 years.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a leather sewing-machine.
This 38-year-old man is single, Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Khojavend region, settled in Sabunchu region Bakikhanov settlement.

loans.use: To buy a leaher  sewing-machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah wants to add to her savings in order to buy a new matatu for her transport business

loans.name: Jeyran

texts.en: S. Jeyran is 49. She is a dislocated person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh. She is married and has 4 children. She has small business consisting of hens and 1 cow. She is applying for a 1200 USD loan to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es:
Bernabé lives in the Antofagasta district of the city of El Alto. He makes novel glassware, in different and original shapes, according to the shape of the bottle from which the glass is made. His raw materials are recycled, half-liter, glass bottles. He also works as a driver in a public transportation company (Radio Taxis). With this income he supports his family--his wife and two children who still remain in his care.

He would use the loan to buy empty recycled bottles of different shapes.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted by IMPRO qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Bernabé vive en la zona Antofagasta de la ciudad de El Alto; se dedica a la elaboración de vasos novedosos, de formas diferentes y ornamentales, según el tipo de botella, utilizando como materia prima botellas recicladas de vidrio de medio litro. También trabaja como chofer eventual en una empresa de transporte publico (radio taxis).Con dichos ingresos mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa y dos hijos que permanecen a su cargo El crédito le invertirá en la compra de materia prima (botellas vacias de diferentes formas). Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To buy recycled bottes for his glassware business

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sivorn was married in 1983 and has 6 children, 3 sons and 3 daughters. After she learned how to weave scarves from her neighbor, Mrs. N. started her own business weaving scarves in 2005.

She uses a semiautomatic machine at home. She currently owns one machine and now she plans to purchase another semiautomatic machine so she can increase her production of scarves. Her husband is a government official in the Ministry of Post and Telecommunication.

This is Mrs. N.'s first request for a loan from MAXIMA. She is asking for $1,000 to purchase sewing materials and another semiautomatic machine so she can expand her scarf production.

loans.use: Purchase a semiautomatic machine to weave scarves, and sewing materials.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
The opportunities to get ahead in life are often times within reach for those that know how to take advantage of them. This is a very common saying in the life of Antolina, who works hard each day for the well-being of her four little children. It's because of them that she has decided to opt for keeping her family together, in spite of the immense effort that this takes.

For a long time, her husband worked away from home as a construction worker and one day, because of his great desire to learn, he decided to work under a recognized master baker in his city and learn to how to makes bread. The constant trips that he took brought much sadness to his young children. For that reason, they both decided to open a bakery in their small home, after seeing the need in their neighborhood. Three months have already gone by since their family has been together and Antolina has been enjoying this very much. Although the sacrifice to produce the breads is very arduous, she feels very happy to be with her husband.

They begin making the bread at three in the morning and then later, distribute it to the stores in their neighborhood. Antolina also has a second job, working in an ice-cream factory. Although now, because of decreased temperatures that are occuring every day, the demand (for ice cream) has diminished considerably. However, she will continue to work hard to earn the money that will allow her to sustain her children. To reach this goal, she wishes to increase the production of bread even more and to improve their little bakery by obtaining a machine that will allow her to increase the quality of production of their delicious and exquisite breads.

Because of this, she has come to these integral people (Microfinanzas PRISMA), so that she can obtain this loan that she so yearns for to make her projects a reality. Help her - your support is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Las oportunidades para salir adelante están muchas veces al alcance de los que saben aprovecharlas, este es un dicho muy común en la vida de Antolina, que cada día trabaja diligentemente por el bien de sus cuatro hijos pequeños y es por ellos que ha decidido optar por mantener a la familia unida a pesar del inmenso esfuerzo que eso significa.Hace tiempo atrás su esposo trabajaba fuera de su tierra natal como obrero de construcción y un día con sus enormes deseos de aprender decidió ponerse bajo las ordenes de un reconocido maestro panadero de su ciudad y aprendió a elaborar panes, los constantes viajes que realizaba mantenían con mucha tristeza a sus pequeños y es por esta razón que ambos decidieron abrir una panadería en su pequeña casa después de observar esa insatisfecha necesidad en su localidad.Ya pasaron tres meses desde que Antolina goza de su unión familiar aunque el sacrificio de elaborar los panes sea muy arduo, ella se siente muy feliz de estar al lado de su esposo elaborándolos desde las tres de la madrugada para luego repartirlos en las tiendas de su localidad. De manera paralela a este negocio, Antolina, también está dedicándose a la fabricación de helados aunque ahora por las bajas temperaturas que se presentan diariamente su demanda a disminuido considerablemente. Sin embargo ella seguirá adelante para obtener las ganancias que le permitan sostener a sus hijos y para este propósito desea incrementar aún más su producción y mejorar su pequeño taller de panadería para obtener una máquina que le permita elaborar con mayor calidad sus deliciosos y exquisitos panes; es por ello que acude a aquellas personas solidarias para que pueda obtener la tan ansiada suma y hacer realidad sus proyectos.. Ayúdala tu aporte es muy importante.

loans.use: Increase of captial to purchase a machine to ease and increase production of bread for her bakery.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese a young mother of Faleapuna this is her second loan from SPBD. Her business is sewing, and most of her client is village people,sometimes she earned a lot specially when she  sewn a group uniform. She start her business in 2002 in a very small open house but now she extend that and have a special room for her business. She earns $500 WST ($200 USD) in good days with the right customers so she set a goal for her business to move into Apia for a change so never forget the financial assistant from SPBD Office for their support

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and for home improvement

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz have been members of the community bank “Sumaqcha” for four, five, and one year respectively. In that time they have learned to be responsible and to save. They also feel like a family and the community bank’s interest-earning savings accounts make it stand out from other banks in the area.

Melva is 28 years old. She buys light bulbs of different shapes and sizes in Ayacucho and sells them in the countryside. She started this business four years ago with her first loan from the community bank.

Norma is 28 years old and has one child. For the past 11 years she has had a business selling food staples such as rice, flour, beans, and butter.

Rosa Luz has three young children. She is 32 years old. She has a stand in the central market of Ayacucho where she sells breakfasts. She has been running this business for five years.

Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz need loans of 600, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying light bulbs, a glass display case, and a new stand.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest-earning account. Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz are saving to buy furniture for their home, a second display case, and land. They dream of owning a store, and buying a house.

loans.use: Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz need loans of 600, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying light bulbs, a glass display case, and a new stand.

loans.name: Ngunu Kazi Group

texts.en: The Ngunu Kazi is a group of entrepreneurs in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam. Amosi Mgamga M. is the leader of the group.  She owns a food kiosk that sells soda and juice, as well as traditional Tanzanian snack food such as chips, chapatti, and somosa. The group is requesting a loan to help fund their businesses.

loans.use: Fund business expansion.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lý, 48 years old, raises livestock and does business for living. She uses funs from the loans from the TYM Fund to finance her livestock and businesses. Different from typical banks, the TYM Fund makes loans with easy payment terms. She increases the loan amounts gradualL.. The famiL.’s economy becomes better, that allows her to buy few appliances for her home. This time, she is taking out a loan of 450USD to buy piglets. The current famiL.’s income is 200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Lý, 48 tuổi, sinh sống bằng việc chăn nuôi lợn, bò và buôn bán. Nguồn vốn đầu tư cho dự án được chị vay từ Quỹ Tình thương. Không giống như nguồn vốn của Ngân hàng và các tổ chức tín dụng khác, Quỹ Tình thương cho vay vốn trả dần. Sau một thời gian tham gia, nhận thấy cơ chế hoạt động rất phù hợp với gia đình nên chị Lý dần mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn lớn. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển đời sống được nâng lên, chị Lý có điều kiện sắm sửa thêm các vật dụng sinh hoạt trong nhà. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD mua lợn giống. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Simwana's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Simwana is 33 years old and is married with two children, ages 18 and 14. She and her husband also take care of two other children, who are 14 and 18 years old as well. Simwana is a fish seller. She started her business in 2003. She works from 5am to 10pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Queenrose and Asia, who have businesses dealing in clothes (khanga) and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en: B. Sojida lives in the J.Utkansoi region of Tajikistan. As many fellow villagers, she raises livestock. It is the family business but she has her own duties. Mrs. B. Sojida is responsible for the animal care, milk production and sour product-making. It is very hard work so her children help her. Mrs. B. Sojida is married and has a child. She also works on a collective farm. She works hard and has good reputation. Now Mrs. B. Sojida applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase special modernized equipment purchasing for milk processing and sour products making.

loans.use: to purchase special modernized equipment for milk processing and sour products making.

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es:
Mario Alfonso is a young man who has recently married. He learned how to make furniture in his job, and five years ago he decided to start his own business. From his home, he makes small pieces of furniture which he sells to people he knows. Thanks to his hard work, he and his wife are improving their quality of life. Although they don't yet have a family of their own, Mario wants to be able to provide a good life for their children one day, and that's why he works so hard.

He is requesting a loan, which he will repay in 3 months, so he can purchase the necessary materials to make more furniture and keep up with the demand of his customers. With your support, Mario can continue to grow his business and support his family.

Mario Alfonso, es un hombre joven que acaba de casarse, en su trabajo aprendió el oficio de fabricacion y tapicería para muebles, por ello al salir de su trabajo, hace 5 años decidio emprender el negocio por su cuenta, en su casa elabora pequeños muebles y sillones que vende entre sus conocidos, y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a su esposa, ya que aun no tienen familia. el desea darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos cuado los tenga por eso se esfuerza en su negocio.

El solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que la demanda de sus clientes ha aumentado y requiere comprar mas material para elaborar los muebles. Con tu apoyo Mario saldra adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL NEEDED TO MAKE THE FURNITURE HE SELLS, CONTINUE TO GROW HIS BUSINESS AND SUPPORT HIS FAMILY

loans.name: Guirmen

texts.es:
Guirmen is a hardworking man who has been working in the transportation business for the last number of years. He owns three motorbikes, one of which he drives himself, and the other two he lends to his cousins. Guirmen is 37 years old and the father of two school-age sons that love him very much. His wife sells food at night. The most important thing for Guirmen is to make his sons study so that they will be able to become professionals. At the moment he needs to purchase replacement parts for his motorbikes so that he can repair them. Later, Guirmen wants to support his wife in opening a corner store in which she can sell food. For these reasons Guirmen is asking you for a loan, which he promises to repay soon.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Guirmen es un hombre trabajador que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace varios años atrás, es propietario de tres motocarros, uno de ellos lo maneja el mismo y los otros por dos de sus sobrinos a quienes les brinda trabajo de esa forma. Guirmen tiene 37 años y es padre de 2 hijos los cuales estudian y lo quieren mucho, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches. Lo más importante para Guirmen es hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que logren ser buenos profesionales.Ahora necesita comprar repuestos para sus motocarros y darles un mantenimiento completo, posteriormente quiere apoyar a su señora mandando a construir un kiosco para la venta de comida, porque actualmente lo hace de manera ambulante. Esto son los motivos por los que Guirmen recurre a ustedes para solicitarles un préstamo, que promete pagar de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for his motorbike so that he can repair them.

loans.name: Agil

texts.en:
Agil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He settled in the Fuzuli region in the Alkhanly village. He is married and has 3 children. This man was born in 1960.

He has run a cattle breeding business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a calf to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Since 2006, Ebenezer A. sells building materials, such as paint, painting brushes, and other items, at Nyanta in Elmina. Ebenezer received a junior high education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for paying his children's school fees, providing food for the family, and paying the utility bills. He plans to use the loan to buy more building materials to sell. He hopes to use the increased profits to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira tiene 45 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital Hialeah II etapa casada y con dos hijos de 10 y 15 años de edad, que estudian la secundaria,   su esposo trabaja de maestro de obra, en construcciones de escuelas nuevas. Doña yadira vende comida desde hace doce años, con capital propio vendiendo sopa los días domingo, luego comenzó a vender comida lo cual hasta ahora le ha ido bien. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para construir un cuarto en la parte trasera de su casa, ya que su casa es pequeña y se le hace muy incomodo compartir los cuartos, y desea una mejor vivienda digna para su familia. A largo plazo es incrementar las ventas, mejorar el local para brindar mejor servicios a si como hacer variedad de alimentos para ofertar a su clientela, seguir dando estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs Yadira is 45 years old, lives in a neighborhood in the capital city of Hialeah II and is married with two sons who are 10 and 15 years old who are studying in secondary school. Her husband works as a craftsmen, constructing new schools. Mrs Yadira has been selling food for the last 12 years, with money made from selling soup on sundays, which she transformed into selling food which has up until now gone well. The loan she is requesting will be for the infrastructure in order to purchase construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, iron to build a room in the back of her house. Her current house is very small and not very amenable to divide into rooms, she would like an improved life and dignity for her family. In the long term she wishes to increase her sales, improve the business locale in order to provide better services such as offering varieties of products for her clients, and continue to put her sons through school.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs and construction of a room

loans.name: Frank

texts.fr: Frank K. est un cultivateur de riz à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Âgé de 43 ans Frank est marié et père de 3 enfants. Avec ce crédit il désire augmenter son espace cultivable en prenant des métayers et aussi en achetant des insecticides et  herbicides. Il compte sur cette chance pour avoir un meilleur rendement, source de l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Frank K. is a rice producer in Wome, a village located approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He's 43 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. With this loan, he wishes to increase his cultivable area, by hiring farmers and by buying insecticides and herbicides. He counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire farmers and to buy herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim H. is a villager in Trouy Troeng Village in Kandal Province.  She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family.  Her husband, Mr. Pok Phal, is a blacksmith who makes doors and windows by using steel.  Since the business is going well, he needs more material in order to reach his customers’ demands.  So, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy steel for her husband's business.  

Mrs. Khim H. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are both staying at home because they are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy steel for her husband's business.

loans.name: Kaniz Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
"My name is Kaniz and I am a 45-year-old married lady. I reside in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. I have been living in this place for the past 25 years. I am an uneducated lady because my father had insufficient income to send me to school.

"I got married in the age of 16 to a man named B. A. who is a cobbler by profession. I am the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. My first two sons are involved in a decorative embroidery business. The third is a tailor. The youngest works in a factory. I help my sons in their decorative embroidery business. We all three make embroidered clothes and sell them in clothing shops. We have been doing this work for the past 10 years. I am applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to make embroidered dresses.

"I am the group leader for some more women from my locality. Sabra and Samina and Sharifan and Naheed baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their milk-selling businesses. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to re-sell."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for making embroidered dresses

loans.name: Varn

texts.en: Varn Y., 35, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province, Cambodia. She grows rice and earns very little to support her household. Her husband, Tep Phat (pictured), is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and he generally earns $7 every day. This couple has four children; three are students, and one is too young to attend the school. Mrs. Varn Y. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate as a taxi.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to operate as a motor-taxi

loans.name: Purna Maiya

texts.en:
Purna Maiya M. is the resident of KhoKhana. Khokhana is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in agriculture. Mrs. M. lives in a single family dwelling with her husband and three children. Her husband is Bekha Narayan M., a farmer. She has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is now studying in grade 7. Her older son is studying in grade 3, and the younger son is just 9 months old.

Mrs. M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Khokhana. She opened her grocery shop 10 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on. All her children help her in her shop. Now Mrs. M. is requesting a loan to expand her business a little more so that she could earn more for her husband and the family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen A. is 33 years old. He is married with one child who is six months old. He lives in a village called ‘Ntranko’ which means ‘Don’t go beyond the next villages’. He said that in olden days, the community was hospitable so when you came you would not like to move to the surrounding settlements.

He is a chemical seller and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs, etc. in his neighborhood. Many local people use his drugs as first aid and cure when they are sick. He has been in business for three years now and he is only person who supplies pharmaceutical products in the community.

Stephen wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of drugs, including others that are frequently requested by his customers. He hopes to raise good income to take care of his family. He hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking his inventory. This would enable him to save more to support his children in school. Stephen belongs to a village bank called ‘Romans’.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité es uno de los primeros formados en la oficina de Luque de la fundación, el mismo se encuentra en el décimo ciclo del programa del comité de Mujeres y esta integrado por señoras que fueron invitadas por unas amigas quienes ya pertenecían a un comité de un barrio vecino. Actualmente se encuentra integrado por 17 señoras quienes invirtieron en diversas actividades.

La señora Francisca Giménez se dedica a la cantina de una escuela e invirtió el dinero en la compra de jugos, gaseosas e insumos para la venta de comestible en su cantina 

La señora Edith Mabel O. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Mercedes A. se dedica a la venta de electrodomesticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de los mismos  para su venta posterior.

La señora Marçia Isabel O. se dedica a la venta de dulces invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Mirtha A. se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la realización y venta de los mismos.

La señora Elsa A. se dedica a la herbosteria e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para empaquetar y vender sus hierbas medicinales.

La señora Larissa González se dedica a la venta de cosméticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de sus productos para su venta para surtir su negocio.

La señora Blanca P. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercederias para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Liz Rossana M. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al pasa la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Hilaria Báez se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al pasa la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Lilia Rosa C. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió su dinero en la compra de mercederías al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Miguela R. se dedica a la venta de frutas e invirtió su dinero en la compra de frutas para el incremento de sus negocio.

La señora Luz Adriana M. se dedica a la venta de mercería e invirtió su dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Lidia Cañiza se dedica a la venta de cosméticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de sus productos para su venta para surtir su negocio.

La señora Juana P. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra gaseosas y cervezas para la venta de los mismos.

La señorita katherine González se dedica a la venta de bijouterie e invirtió el dinero en la compra de bijouterie para lña venta de los mismos.

La señora Nidia A. se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y golosinas e invirtió el dinero para la compra de insumos para la realización de los comestible.
texts.en:
This village bank is one of the first formed in the foundation office in Luque. The Women’s committee is in its 10th loan cycle, and it members are women who were invited by friends who already belongs to a neighboring village bank. Today there are 17 women who invested in various businesses. Mrs. Francisca Giménez runs the snack bar at a school and invested the money in buying juices, soda pop and food to sell in her snack bar. Mrs. Edith Mabel O. sells clothing and invested the money in buying merchandise to increase her sales. Mrs. Mercedes A. sells small domestic electrical appliances and invested the money in buying inventory for future sales. Mrs. Marcia Isabel O. sells candy and invested the money in buying inventory to increase her sales. Mrs. Mirtha A. sells fast food and invested the money in buying ingredients to make and sell her food. Mrs. Elsa A. sells herbal remedies and invested the money in buying inventory to package and sell her herbal medicines. Mrs. Larissa González sells cosmetics and invested the money in buying products to stock her sales business. Mrs. Blanca P. sells clothing and invested the money in purchasing merchandise to increase her sales. Mrs. Liz Rossana M. sells food and invested the money in buying ingredients to make an d sell her food. Mrs. Hilaria Báez sells food and invested the money in buying ingredients to make and sell her food. Mrs. Lilia Rosa C. sells clothing and invested her money in buying merchandise at wholesale to later sell. Mrs. Miguela R. sells fruit and invested the money in buying fruit to increase her business. Mrs. Luz Adriana M. sells general merchandise and invested the money in buying merchandise at wholesale to then resell. Mrs. Lidia Cañiza sell cosmetics and invested the money in buying products to stock her business and then sell. Mrs. Juana P. sells beverages and invested her money in buying soda pop and beer to sell. Mrs. Katherine González sells decorative items and invested the money in buying decorative items to sell. Mrs. Nidia A. sells fast food and snacks and invested the money in buying ingredients to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items for use in each member's business

loans.name: Babadjidé  Adiatou

texts.fr:
K. Babadjidé Adiatou est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à Idriss YOUSOUF. Babadjidé Adiatou est mère de deux enfants qui sont toujours à sa charge. Babadjidé Adiatou vend des chaussures, des sacs de sortie, des tissus et des bijoux. Babadjidé Adiatou a deux stratégies de vente de ses articles. La première stratégie consiste pour Babadjidé Adiatou à passer de société en société pour proposer et vendre ses articles aux fonctionnaires. La deuxième, c'est la vente de ses articles au niveau de sa boutique au marché Dandji, un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C'est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin que Babadjidé  Adiatou achète ses articles. Babadjidé  Adiatou enregistre de plus en plus de demande de sa clientèle et pour la satisfaire elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a présentement. C'est pourquoi Babadjidé  Adiatou demande de crédit à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Babadjidé Adiatou, age 27, is married to Idriss YOUSOUF. She is the mother of two children who are still in her care. She sells shoes, handbags, cloth, and jewelry. She has two strategies for selling her merchandise. The first one involves going from company to company to offer and sell merchandise to the officials. The second strategy involves selling merchandise out of her shop at the marketplace of Dandji, a working-class district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She buys her goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo, which is a country bordering Benin. Babadjidé Adiatou notes more and more demand from her customers. And to satisfy it, she’s in need of funding that she presently lacks. This is why she’s asking Alidé for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy handbags, shoes, cloth, and jewelry to resell

loans.name: Origami Abiria Betty Group

texts.en: Mrs. A. Betty is married, age 24, with three kids going to school. For over ten years she has been selling Irish potatoes and bananas. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of Irish potatoes and bunches of bananas. Her dream is to educate her kids.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of Irish potatoes and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana first started to make clothes at home, and began produce them commercially in 2008. Since 2008 Ana has made men’s clothing for merchants and also employed tailors. This year, Lora started to see the production of women's clothing added to the workshop. Profitable business led her to open tiny shops in poor districts from Chisinau City. Ana’s tailor shop began producing better quality garments with fine material. Lora decided to borrow a loan of 25 000 lei from Microinvest to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan Z. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 46 years old. Susan is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from peddling cashew nuts, mango,and longganisa; Susan is also a dealer of Avon and personal collections. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family members, such as their daily consumption of rice and viand.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Munhdalay

texts.en:
Munhdalay E. is a 30-year-old married man who has two children. His eldest child is a daughter who attends a local elementary school and the youngest is a son who is just 2 years old and stays at home. His family lives in "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land he has taken as a heritage from his father in Uvurhangay province. Uvurhangay is one of the Mongolian central provinces and is 400 kilometers from the capital city.

Since 2008, Munhdalay has been running a small café at the local market. The café income is his household's only income. To increase his daily income, he is planning to expand his café as soon as possible. Most of his clients are salesmen and saleswomen who work at the market stalls. His hope is to run his business successfully, then, with the profit, to built a house for his family needs. Munhdalay requests a loan to purchase a refrigerator for his business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his café

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 60 years old and married with six children. She sells drinks and frozen foods like fish, beef and turkey. Esther hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase frozen foods and drinks to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De (Benkadi A  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe 1 de BENKADI A  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans , 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  un chef lieu de commune de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent  acheter, de l’engrais,  de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 27.5  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés du village de Marka-Coungo et Fana  après les récoltes et à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group1 of BENKADI A are married women who average 47 years of age and four children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a community seat of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work. Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth loan with the institution, and the past loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment. And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 27.5 hectares. A part of their production is consumed at home, the other part is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of the village of Marka-Coungo and Fana following the harvests. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
