loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry supplies

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
Z. Sadriddin is 34 years old. He is married with two children. Sadriddin is running the business already for 5 years. He is selling the household appliances such as: TV set, air conditioner, refrigerator and many others in his store. The business generates the significant income for the family allowing improving the living conditions. Today Sadriddin requests $800 USD. He is going to spend the loan for purchasing new goods for selling. Sadriddin is very thankful for those lenders who supports him.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for selling.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
“Progress in life begins with patience and sacrifices” is the guiding principle of Francisca G., who lives in Barangay Kinacao Baretbet Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is happily married to Oscar G. Sr. and they are gifted with six children. Oscar manages a vulcanizing shop while Francisca patiently manages their store at home. She also sells live tilapia (fish) in her store. Four of their children have already finished their studies in college and two of them are still studying at the tertiary level.

Francisca and her husband strive to develop their business and pursue success in their business undertakings for the future welfare of their children. She wants to avail of another loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for additional business capital that will be used to further improve and expand her general store. She hopes to increase her daily income to secure her children’s future welfare by continuing to send them to school till they finish a degree in college.

loans.use: Additional capital for a store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: B. Jane is a business woman of thirty-seven years old. She has grocery selling ground nuts in Owino market in Kampala town. She has been in her business for three years. She deals with ground nuts as well, she sells even the grinned ground nuts because she has the ground nuts grinding machine. She is using the loan to purchase bags of ground nuts at least five and above bags of ground nuts expanding on her business. She has two children and her hope is to build some rental houses for more income earning.

loans.use: To purchase bags of ground nuts at least five and above bags of ground nuts expanding on her business.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 13 años se dedica al cultivo de frijoles, maíz y café; actividad que le agrada mucho realizar, pues desde pequeño aprendió las tareas agrícolas. Con respecto al fréjol, este producto le permite acumular dinero cada tres meses y sus cosechas las comercializa en el mercado de su ciudad. A pesar de que no encuentre un buen precio, logra obtener lo necesario para sostener las necesidades de su familia mientras espera los meses de bonanza, que son durante la recolección y venta del café. En estos meses toda su familia se alegra muchísimo y juntos trabajan en la faena de recolección, para abastecer a una de las acopiadoras de su zona, que es su comprador regular, pues le paga un buen precio por su café.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrando ser un cliente muy responsable, sobre todo muy comprometido en las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de guano isla (de los gallinazos) para el abonado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 33 years old and lives with his partner, who is the mother of his two children, in their own home. For the past 13 years, he has dedicated himself to the cultivation of beans, corn and coffee. He finds this profession very satisfying, since he learned how to work on a farm when he was just a small child. The beans allow him to earn money every three months, when he sells his harvest at his city's local market. Although the prices for this product are not very high, he is able to obtain the necessary basics to satisfy his family's needs while they wait for the "bonanza" months, which are when the family harvests and sells their coffee. During these months, the entire family is extremely happy; they work together on the labor of collecting the coffee beans and delivering them to one of the suppliers in the area, which serves as their regular buyer since it pays them a good price for their coffee. This is Rodrigo's third loan with MFP, and during all of this time, he has shown himself to be a very responsible client. Above all, he is very active in the meetings of his communal bank. The funds he is currently requesting will be invested in the purchase of island guano (from turkey vultures) to fertilize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: María Alejandrina

texts.es:
María es madre soltera, es madre de un bebé de 6 meses de nacido y vive junto a sus padres y su abuelita en el Anexo San Sebastián, perteneciente al Centro Poblado Romero, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria de una bodega que funciona en su casa y con ella trata de solventar sus gastos y de apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia. Actualmente viaja una vez por semana a la ciudad de Chiclayo a comprar su mercadería y con mucho esfuerzo esta sacando adelante a su negocio.

La continua demanda de los vecinos de su zona y de otros caseríos ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, acite), abarrotes y bebidas (gaseosas y cerveza), por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María piensa en seguir creciendo con su negocio y seguir abasteciendo a los pobladores de su zona y de las zonas colindantes, ella es una mujer luchadora y siempre trata de sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
María is a single mother; she has a six month old baby. She lives with her parents and her grandmother in the Anexo San Sebastián, which belongs to the Centro Poblado Romero in the Mórrope district. It is located 40 from the city of Chiclayo. She has a convenience store, which is in her house. With the store she tries to pay her expenses and to help the family economically. Currently she travels once a week to the city of Chiclayo to buy merchandise. With great effort she is getting ahead in her business. The continual demand from her neighbors in the area and other villages has made her think about expanding her business. She would do this by purchasing more basic needs type products (rice, sugar, oil), groceries, and drinks (soft drinks and beer). That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativea, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 PEN. María intends to keep growing with her business and to keep serving the people in her area and in adjacent areas. She is a woman who is a fighter, and she always tries to get her loved ones ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to increase her business

location.town: Anexo San Sebastián - Centro Poblado Romero - Morr

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. is 31 years old and married with a young daughter named Mary.

He runs a transport business and employs two people. He’s run his business for five years and also earns income from a green grocer that he operates with his wife.

Peter is requesting a loan for 20000 KES to purchase two tyres (at 4500 KES) and one windscreen (4000 KES), and to repair his car seats (7000 KES).

Peter describes himself as hardworking and determined to improve his standard of living. He would like to own more matatus (vans) for transport and also expand his grocery by the end of 2010.

loans.use: To repair vehicle.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel H. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con un crédito anterior de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarla con sus ingresos que obtiene de empleado de una compañía de construcción en el departamento de encargado de electricista.
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Irma Lindo Gómez, ya el señor Manuel se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel H. is the father of two teenagers who are currently students. With a previous loan from Kiva partner FVP, he has built a room but it is missing the roof. He also wants to build a concrete slab so that his home is stronger and safer. Today, Mr. H. is requesting a loan to finish the room's concrete slab and roof. He plans to pay the loan with his income as manager electrician of a construction company. His dream is to give his children a room of their own and a better life. The person in the photograph is Mr. H.'s wife, Mrs. Irma Lindo Gómez; Mr. H. was at work the day of the site visit.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room's concrete slab and roof

loans.name: Velinda

texts.es:
Velinda es una joven de 18 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

El negocio al que se dedica es la confección de tejidos artesanales, su trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana cuando junto a su madre empiezan a trabajar en los modelos especiales que le han pedido. Ella es una tejedora muy buena, motivo por el cual sus confecciones son muy bonitas y llamativas.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más aun si son artesanías, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan. 
Para el futuro, espera poder comprar nuevas máquinas para avanzar más rápido en la producción.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Velinda con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, aunque para eso tenga que ir ahorrando poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la producción que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Velinda, 18, is very cheerful and hard-working. She lives with her parents and her greatest desire is to get ahead in life. She is a weaver. Her work starts very early in the morning when, together with her mother, they begin to work on the special designs that they have on order. She is a very good weaver so her creations are very pretty and attractive. What she likes the most about her work is to weave, more so if the items are handicrafts. She has been in this line of work for 4 years and considers the most difficult part of the job having to work all day in order to fill their standing orders. For the future, she would like to be able to buy new looms so that production can be faster. This is Velinda's second loan with MFP and she is willing to make her repayments on time even if that means saving up little by little. She is a very well-liked member of her communal bank. With the 1000 soles requested, she will buy more wool so that her curent output can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Gaza city of Palestine. He is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Ahmad owns and operates a barber shop. The primary source of this business's income comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2000 USD which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. Ahmad plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S. lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Meng Korng, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to grow rice.  As well as this job, he is a construction laborer.

Mr. Meng Korng faces some problems on the rice plantation because his field is far from the irrigation system and it is now infertile, so Mrs. Sokha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to support the rice field. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's lives with this loan.

Mrs. Sokha S. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local public school while the other is too young to go  school or work. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 33-year-old married man with three children who are in school. His wife does tailoring while he does mining and sells sand and ballast. He has been running Kolwamba Co. for seven years. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, for helping him boost his business stock.  

He has requested a 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to enable him to add stock, such as sand and ballast. His dream is to own a home in the Rongai area in Nairobi. He describes himself as a faithful and a hardworking man.

loans.use: Add stock of sand and ballast

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Mrs Vicenta O. is from Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and is married with 3 children. She operates a sari-sari (convenience) store but her main source of income comes from her piggery. She has been running her business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 7,400PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 20,000PHP.  She requested a new loan of 30,000PHP from PMPC. This is her 6th loan, the purpose of which is to expand her sari-sari store and to use in her piggery project. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide working capital for her sari-sari store and to use in her piggery business

loans.name: Lucrecia Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia diariamente inicia aperturar su negocio desde las 6:00 Am que se encuentra ubicado en el mercado la estación.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de mercadería para aumentar su inventario y tener mas variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes, tales como: vanidades, pinturas de uña, pinturas de labio, cremas, aretes, colas, diademas etc.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Lucrecia además de su negocio de cosméticos también elabora horneados y cuajadas lo cuales son puesto a la venta a un lado de su tramo ya que son de gran gusto para su clientela.
texts.en:
Lucrecia begins working in her business, located in the station market at, each day starting at 6:00 am. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to increase her inventory and have a greater variety to offer her customers. Things such as vanity items, nail polish, lipsticks, creams, earrings, hair bands, head bands, etc. Lucrecia also makes and sells baked goods and milk curd alongside her stall. Her customers like this very much.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Kelly Edmita

texts.es:
Kelly es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Kelly es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Kelly tiene una panadería en donde elabora panes típicos, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar y también reparte a las tiendas.
Kelly necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Kelly sueña con ampliar su negocio y comprar un carro para repartir su producto.
texts.en:
Kelly is a member of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) communal bank. She is 22 years old and has one son. Kelly has a bakery where she bakes and sells typical breads. She also sells to other stores. Kelly needs a loan of 1.050 PEN ($375) that she will use to buy flour. Kelly hopes to be able to expand her business and buy a car to be able to deliver her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio A. M., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como fontanero, es casado y habita en el barrio Luis Anduray.

El señor José Antonio A., solicito el crédito para mejorar su casa ya que con los crédito anteriores la ha ido remodelando poco a poco, pero el techo no lo tienen completo y desea cambiarlo antes que llegue el invierno, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad.
texts.en:
José works as a plumber in the Chinandega city hall. He is married and lives in the Luis Anduray neighborhood. He is asking for this loan in order to make improvements to his home, as he has been doing little by little. The roof has not been completed and he would like to finish it before winter. He has three young children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Positivas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando en su tercer ciclo y todas lograron buenos resultados en los dos ciclos anteriores.
Hasta el momento muchas lograron abrir su negocio, otras pudieron mejorar con la ayuda de las asesoras, y de esa manera mantener el ingreso que cada una tiene,  en general, se sienten muy conformes de pertener a su comité ya que de una u otra forma facilita el conocimiento para el mejor desarrollo de sus actividades.
Así se puede hablar de la Sra. Antonia G. Britez, de 30 años de edad , tiene 3 hijos, los mismos se quedan  en la casa mientras ella sale a vender sus productos. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de chipa (preparado de alimidon de yuca o mandioca, Harina de maiz, queso, grasa de cerdo, leche), como no posee un puesto de venta sale en los semaforos en los buses para vender, así todos los días recorre bastante para lograr una buena venta para regresar a su casa preparar  el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde ofrecer sus productos. 
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. 
Solicita el préstamo para cubrir algunos gastos y a la ves comprar las chipas para vender ya es la actividad que realiza para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is currently in their third loan cycle, and they have achieved good results from their previous loans. As of now, many women have managed to open their own businesses. Others made improvements with the help of advisors. As a result all of them have kept up their incomes. In general they feel very pleased to belong to the group, as in one way or another the group's knowledge helps each of them in their various jobs. One example from the group is 30-year old Sra. Antonia G. Britez who has three children. They stay at home while she goes out to sell her products. She sells chipa (a kind of bread made from starch obtained from yucca or cassava, maize flour, cheese, lard, and milk). As she doesn't have a stall, she goes to traffic lights and sells to bus passengers. So she covers a lot of ground each day in order to have good sales. She returns home to prepare lunch and goes out again in the afternoons to make more sales. Antonia is a long-suffering woman whose daily life is hard. When she gets home from work, she has to do the household chores and everything else that will help her family get ahead as she is a single mother. The loan will be used to cover various expenses and to buy chipa to sell as this is how she supports her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for chipa (kind of bread)

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is 60 years old and grows pigs for a living. She is married and has three children. Salvacion used to have difficulties finding money to fund her business. In 2008, she learned of CEVI through her friends who were active entrepreneurs. She joined because she really needed financial support for her business. She said she has no regrets about joining because the MFI’s program has been very helpful to her until now. She is now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 that she will use to buy supplements and feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana tiene 38 años.  Su actividad económica es la venta de costura, cosméticos y repostería.  Ella inicio su negocio hace 16 años con C$1,000.00 y ahora posee un bueno inventario de productos cosméticos y desodorantes.  Además, también posee telas, hilos, y materiales para elaborar vestidos incluso hace todo tipo de ropas.

Juana ha recibido 3 prestamos y ha pagado muy bien, además, quiere seguir comprando mas cosméticos y ropa ya que tiene clientes que le hace encargos.  Juana ha mejorado su nivel de vida con sus préstamos.  Tiene artículos del hogar y sobre todo ha comprado mas maquinas de coser para la elaboración de vestidos y trajes de de todo tipo.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, sells seamstress services, cosmetics and pastry. She began her business 16 years ago with a 1000 colon investment and now she has a good inventory of cosmetics and deodorants. In addition, she has fabric, thread and dressmaking materials although she makes all kinds of clothes. Juana has gotten three previous loans and has repaid very well. In addition, she wants to continue to buy more cosmetics and clothes because she has customers that place orders with her. Juana has improved her standard of living with the loans. She has acquired articles for the home but especially sewing machines for her dressmaking activities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes, deodorants, fabric for dressmaking and cake-making pastry supplies.

loans.name: G.s. Lucia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lucia Teofilia y Cristina son personas muy luchadoras y admirables. Pues el deseo de salir adelante con sus negocios y familias les da el motivo cada día para esforzarse aun mas. Ambas se dedican a la venta de mariscos por lo que anteriormente vendían de manera ambulante  y tomaban diferentes rutas, en la actualidad ambas han sabido manejar muy bien sus negocios y tienen un tramo en el mercado en donde tienen una variedad de clientes, ellas conversan con sus clientes y le ofrecen lo mejor para que siempre recurran a su negocio. El financiamiento que están solicitando es para la compra de punches, camarones, jaibas, pescado y chuletas. Sueñan con algún día ser el acopio más grande del mercado.
texts.en:
The Grupo Solidario Lucia (G.S. Lucia) is comprised of Teofila and Cristina, both fighters and very admirable. The desire to succeed with their businesses and families gives them the motivation everyday to try even harder. They both sell seafood. They used to be street vendors and took different routes. Now they both know how to manage their business very well. They have a space in the market where they have a variety of clients. They talk to their clients and offer them the best so their clients always return. The loan they are requesting is to purchase crabs, shrimp, crayfish, fish and chops. One day they dream of being the largest store in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Fanni Leonor

texts.es: La Sra. A. P. Fanni Leonor, de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus pequeños hijos. Vive en casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en pasaje Ramos Lujaraja perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrera de campo en Agrícola Valle Del Sol. Su esposo también trabaja como obrero de campo. La Sra. es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, con todas las ganas de salir adelante.La Sra fanny requiere el préstamo para poder terminar de construir su casa. Su deseo, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder darle a sus hijos unamejor calidad de vida. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento propuesto por nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Señora Fanni Leonor A. P. is 38 years old and she lives with her husband and young children. She lives in her own house, located in a small street, Ramos Lujaraja, in the district of Santiago. She works as a field laborer for Agrícola Valle Del Sol. Her husband also works as a field laborer. Señora A. P. is very responsible and enterprising, with great enthusiasm for getting on in life. She needs a loan to finish building her house. She says she wants to complete the construction of her dwelling so that her children have a better quality of life. She is grateful for the support that we can provide by offering this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina A. is from the village of Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old and single. Melodina operates a business selling clothing in the local community. Melodina has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

Melodina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melodina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melodina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mr. Leng K. (in the photo), is 49 year-old and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Chea, is 49 year-old, have been married since 1980 and have seven children, one son and six daughters. Two of the children are garment factory workers. The other two assist their mother with the farming business and three children are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Leng is a chef. He cooks for wedding parties and other ceremonies. His wife is a farmer; she grows cauliflowers and green beans. In addition, Leng hopes to supplement their income with a new business by raising fish. He does not, however, have sufficient start-up capital. Therefore, he is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to launch the business.

loans.use: To use for raising fish.

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Las Vegas” actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo VI  y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Institución de Micro finanzas Arariwa que está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios se dedican al comercio. 

Kathia nació  en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 36 años, Actualmente, Kathia vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su pareja  y sus tres hijos.  Actualmente,  Kathia vende ropa, perfumes y joyas de forma particular, ella vende a sus amigos, vecinos y trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas, ella viaja dos veces a las ciudades de Lima y Tacna para comprar más mercadería. Le pueden encontrar en su domicilio, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las una de la tarde. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Kathia que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su tienda esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar joyas, ropa y muchas cosas más.  Kathia es una de los socias fundadores del banco comunal y es una persona puntual y responsable con el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The Las Vegas village bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle. Its hardworking, enterprising members are always looking for opportunities to improve their lives and work daily to provide a better future for their children. The group meets every thirty days in the main office of the Institución de Microfinanzas Arariwa, located in the Wanchaq district of Cusco province. Most of the members sell products for a living. Kathia is 36 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, where she was born, with her partner and their three children. Kathia sells clothing, perfumes, and jewelry to friends, neighbors, and workers in public and private institutions. She travels to the cities of Lima and Tacna twice in order to purchase more merchandise. She sells from home seven days a week, from 9 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. For her next loan, Kathia hopes to receive 1000 soles. At the moment her store is modestly stocked with the basic necessities. She'd like to use the loan to buy jewelry, clothing, and much more. Kathia is one of the founding members of the village bank and is punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry, clothing, and much more

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma L. is from the village of Pagahan, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Alma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Alma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alicia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Alicia, de 42 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pupusas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos uno de 24 y el otro de 26 años de edad, este último ya no depende económicamente de ella. Este negocio lo tienen desde hace dos años y lo atiende con su hija, al mismo tiempo fabrica hamacas estos negocios se dieron por iniciativa propia siempre viendo la manera de tener de ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Ella necesita invertir una parte en los materiales para las pupusas como pollo, chicharrón, aceite y  otra parte en materiales para tejer hamacas como hilo de seda de diferentes colores, por tal motivo solita un préstamo que le ayudara a realizar las compras necesarias para contar con materia prima para la preparación de su venta.
Las proyecciones de Alicia son, establecer una pupuseria grande con muchos clientes, ampliar su confección de hamacas, mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 42, sells “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas).  She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 24 and 26.  The oldest child is no longer economically dependent upon her.  She has had this business for two years; she and her daughter take care of the business.  She also makes hammocks.  She started these businesses on her own initiative, always seeing a way to have income to pay the family expenses.  

She needs to invest partly in materials like chicken, pork rinds, and oil.  She will also invest in materials like different colors of silk yarn to weave hammocks.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to make the necessary purchases to have the raw materials she uses to make the things she sells.

Alicia’s projections are to establish a large pupusa shop with lots of customers, to increase the number of hammocks she makes, and to improve the family income.

loans.use: Buy materials to make "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: M. Daniel, a father of 4 says that the sale  of sugar cane molasses has helped him extricate himself out of poverty over the past 4 years. Though it is a small business, he has been able to make the best of his time. It is a business that he began with savings from a beer sale enterprise. He uses molasses to make crude alcohol that is in high favour among many people around his locality. His first business was agro produce sales. His monthly profits are 304,500 shillings. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more molasses for making more crude alcohol.

loans.use: The purchase of more molasses to make crude alcohol

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya M. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter is a university student, while her husband is currently unemployed.

Narantuya manages a consumer goods trade business in her town. She sells a variety of consumer goods and items that are imported from China. Narantyua started her business in 2006 with capital of 600,000 MNT and has built a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT. Her earnings have enabled her to build a house in her yard. For the future, Narantuya hopes to expand her trading business by selling a variety of clothing items. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. established Mary’s Floor World in 1985 after working for a flooring company for several years. Her business did very well due to her expertise in flooring and her business-savvy nature. However, Hurricane Katrina devastated the office that she had just renovated and diminished her clientele. It has been a long road to recovery since the damaging disaster. After finally building her business to what it once was, the oil spill has affected Mary’s Floor World as well. People are not investing in their homes, corporations are hiring other large companies to renovate commercially instead of hiring small businesses, and many locals are without jobs. Small businesses in her city are struggling but with the new mayor and police chief’s dedication to recovery, Mary is incredibly hopeful that New Orleans will return to the city it once was. 

Mary says, “Since Katrina and the recent oil spill, everything has been chaos.” She took out her first loan earlier this year with ACCION Texas-Louisiana to finance a major job. “Normally, I would have never needed to go to anyone to finance a job, but I need funds and the bank rejected my loan application.” She paid back the loan within 30 days after the job was completed. This large contract was crucial to her success because with the profit she made from that job, she has been able to finance smaller contracts. With this recent loan, she will finally have the means to do the necessary repairs and renovations to her office that will communicate to the public her business’s full recovery from the hurricane and the oil spill. 

Mary is hopeful that the city of New Orleans will get back on its feet again and that the local businesses will thrive. Her advice to small business owners is, “If you really want your business to succeed, you have to hang in there no matter how bad it is. Sometimes, it gets pretty tough. You just cannot give up.”

loans.use: Renovating the Office

loans.name: Nambale Mixed Group - Mityana

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Mesearch M.'s membership is with Nambale Mixed Group - Mityana. It’s been over eight years since this married man began his produce-selling enterprise in Nambaale. He primarily has been selling beans and maize in bulk. He took a page from the brothers who were also involved in this genre of trade. It is a worthwhile business enterprise that brings in 160,000 shillings weekly and 640,000 shillings monthly.  

The greater part of his client base comprises mostly wholesalers in and around Mityana. He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more bags of beans and maize for reselling.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine S. started her business in 2001. She trades in flour and grains. Karine is married with 3 children, and lives with her mother-in-law. Karine’s husband helps her in running the business. Their joint efforts have produced great results for years. Now she has some orders and has applied for the loan to purchase packaging and grains.

loans.use: To purchase packaging and grains.
